subject: Move the daily periodic trigger earlier
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-20 14:34:49.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/pipelines.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/8f4662a1b314182eb400e762cb3c81190fe3b8cd', 'message': 'Move the daily periodic trigger earlier

The current time of 06:00 often clashes with the beginning of the
workday in Europe. Looking at current Grafana data, we seem to be having
a period of reduced load starting at around 00:00, so starting the
periodic jobs at 02:00 would hopefully allow us to better utilize our

commit_message:
Move the daily periodic trigger earlier

The current time of 06:00 often clashes with the beginning of the
workday in Europe. Looking at current Grafana data, we seem to be having
a period of reduced load starting at around 00:00, so starting the
periodic jobs at 02:00 would hopefully allow us to better utilize our
resources.

Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: Id9ef2609b080040c68b42c07456ff92d73195304

commit_message:
Remove helm status from deployment scripts for keystone-auth

With the move to helm v3, helm status requires a namespace to be specified, but doing so breaks helm v2 compatability. This change removes the usage of helm serve in openstack-helm-infra's deployment scripts.

Change-Id: I4cf135dc9852506cc2e853c9faa8544b7b2e2fae

commit_message:
Remove helm status from deployment scripts for federated-monitoring

With the move to helm v3, helm status requires a namespace to be specified, but doing so breaks helm v2 compatability. This change removes the usage of helm serve in openstack-helm-infra's deployment scripts.

Change-Id: I21ba5d8ca6f86954c793268142419e0a9e083943
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/64/813864/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Ensure that we restart nfs-ganesha and manila share after config.

Recent changes to manila-ganesha broke how non-HA
deployments were configured, causing the manila-share
and nfs-ganesha processes to potentially start before
the config for them is correctly prepared. This
change ensures that these services are restarted once
their config is ready.

Change-Id: I4e63e64612554d74ffaca5c4e07b90f7ceb88d59

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Ic65d88fa105a2345ce8dbc3973e634446ecbee4b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg-tempest-plugin refs/changes/29/787029/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py3,pep8

commit_message:
Revert "Group cinder-volume services using cluster config"

This reverts commit 2603a774b112dc6e25f9e7b2071124ea3d3d0012, which
converted cinder to use cluster configuration for stateless services.
While well-intentioned, this causes problems due to the lack of a
proper migration for those backends which are not able to support
ACTIVE-ACTIVE configuration.

Configurations that do not support ACTIVE_ACTIVE driver will have the
volume service fail to start, which will cause a service outage.

Change-Id: I7bf4baaf80e5bb58b5c1cf55a2065f3bc50dbced
Related-Bug: #1945239

commit_message:
add kernel-modules-extra in overcloud image needed for HWOL

In case of ovs-hw-offload, without k-m-e installed,
it will have a performance impact because of excessive upcalls
due to the lack of act_ct.

This patch is intended to provision k-m-e in overcloud image
building.

act_ct would be added to kernel-core in rhel9.
So, k-m-e doesnt required in rhel9,centos9.

Closes-Bug: #1946227
Change-Id: If398172876059559ce70ebb868ada82da009a02d
(cherry picked from commit cd5c95441cc56e7ab3f7f4cc1d558fce5bb98d99)

commit_message:
Remove the workaround to install repos on EL9

After merging patch [1] we are going to remove the
workaround to install the repos on EL9 in this patch.

Using this patch we get rid of centos9.repos in the nodepool [2].

[1]: https://softwarefactory-project.io/r/c/config/+/22954
[2]: https://logserver.rdoproject.org/50/36350/1/check/periodic-tripleo-ci-build-containers-centos-9-push-master/225929e/etc/yum.repos.d/

Change-Id: I0d63472894ac22ac5afd621974dd2885946d2464

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I25d070a183d6edfe0469332f5649c9b559d6aa88

commit_message:
Flatten yaql list expressions

In python yaql 2, the expressions are returning a nested list but we
need a list of dictionaries in order to use map_merge.  This change adds
flatten so it returns [] instead of [[]] when nothing is available.

Change-Id: Iba0262fbc2af0903f02c8c28c7ba2b1d935abe7f
(cherry picked from commit 20311a0a50af684f2eab1a98adb58fe94f5ce933)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/63/814763/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: expression: let(k => $.data.key) -> list(coalesce($.data.multistore, {}).get($k)).flatten().select($.get("CephClusterName"))

commit_message:
Remove helm status from deployment scripts for multinode

With the move to helm v3, helm status requires a namespace to be specified, but doing so breaks helm v2 compatability. This change removes the usage of helm serve in openstack-helm-infra's deployment scripts.

Change-Id: Ia600b979bf48629962577b3c5674bfa7415d78c0

commit_message:
Revert update constraint for selenium to new release 4.0.0

This patch partially revert Id1e12179980ad4eb64b8de6fcc1280698bbb2661.
horizon selenium-headless and integration-tests job start failing
after updating selenium version 3.141.0 -> 4.0.0. So let's use
selenium older version until we fixed the failed gate job with new
selenium version.

Related bug: 1947847

Change-Id: I461ab4189fb652c78bc11d0a9283d98948c2725c

commit_message:
[Stable only] remove require_exclusive_lock from detect_vendor

Presumably it was added by a mistake in the Ussuri backport.
Functions that only read data from the BMC must not require
an exclusive lock, and this bug causes a failure when syncing power
state.

Change-Id: I051da583ef6e5131ce36b70b862e91cfdae2b213
(cherry picked from commit e9b16d026171436c66d1651e38c71c9f20acb144)

commit_message:
bnr fix the exportation of the ceph authentication

The file ceph authetication is not being generated due to an
undefined variable.

This patch inserts the tasks that saves the content of
the file in to the block, so the variables are defined.

Change-Id: Id0c841723da00096e379133429a685bffaf407d3
(cherry picked from commit 442c0bc3ac0133b8ef82da2d86d33734692fb49a)

Change-Id: Iae0c0a0346f353def8a7bf349f192472b2d8437b

commit_message:
Inspection - console to tty0 and ttyS0

In tripleo-common iamge-yaml's we set:
  'console=tty0 console=ttyS0,115200'
So that console is on to both the serial and virtual terminal.

Let's use the same default for inspection on the undercloud by
setting IronicInspectorKernelArgs accordingly.

Change-Id: Iae0c0a0346f353def8a7bf349f192472b2d8437b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/03/814803/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: inspection_kernel_args = ['console=tty0', 'console=ttyS0,115200']

See LP#1948032. We set a higher default resource op time out because
podman often times out within the default 20s. We need to guarantee
that this timeout is set *before* we create any bundles otherwise

commit_message:
Make sure resource_op_defaults are set before bundles

See LP#1948032. We set a higher default resource op time out because
podman often times out within the default 20s. We need to guarantee
that this timeout is set *before* we create any bundles otherwise
it might be too late and we'd fail a deployment like described in the
LP.

Change-Id: Ic6ac8d21d12389e70cd382018290324d3ae948ce
Closes-Bug: #1948032
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/15/815015/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # See LP#1948032. We want to ensure that we set the default resource time out # before we create any bundles. Because the default timeout affects how long # we wait for podman, and on a starved system the default of 20s might bite us # too early on Pcmk_resource_default<||> -> Pcmk_bundle<||>

21.10 - Stable cut of charms for release

* On stable/21.10 branch

* Update bundles to point to stable charms
* Pin cffi

commit_message:
Pre-release cleanup of 21.10 release notes

Ready to release 21.10.

Trying out an auto-generated TOC. It is painful and
error-prone to construct it manually over the course
of the cycle. The section headers are now links that
point back to the top of the page. These links can
be disabled.

Change-Id: I2c04d6548cca7b6f0647f2ee203b5a243ba13136
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-guide refs/changes/79/815079/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ===== 21.10 =====the `Supported charms`_ page. As of this release, the project consists of 62 stable charms... contents:: Table of contents: :local: :depth: 3 :backlinks: top * ``s3-store-host`` * ``s3-store-access-key`` * ``s3-store-secret-key`` * ``s3-store-bucket``These options are used to control the polling frequency and the set of metersThis relation adds nrpe checks for services managed by manila charm to be monitored with Nagios.The ceph-mon charm's ``list-pools`` action has a new ``format`` parameter that* 'text' - provides less information [default] * 'text-full' - provides more information in json with indents * 'json' - provides more information in json The default of 'text' maintains the behaviour of previous charm versions.The neutron-gateway charm has three new actions that enable the listing of Neutron resources hosted on a neutron-gateway unit: * ``show-routers`` - lists Neutron routers * ``show-dhcp-networks`` - lists DHCP networks * ``show-loadbalancers`` - lists LBaaS v2 loadbalancers* ``image-volume-cache-enabled`` * ``image-volume-cache-max-size-gb`` * ``image-volume-cache-max-count`` These options allow the enablement of a Cinder image cache as well as set its maximum size and its maximum number of entries. These options are supported on OpenStack Ocata and newer.This action returns some distilled information from the :command:`ceph quorum_status` command. It is primarily intended for verifying which ceph-mon units are online.specifies which application should have its units preferred when schedulingFive new tech-preview charms are now available. cinder charm: Change of method for configuring a clustered Volume service ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The cinder charm changes the configuration of the Volume service to adhere to the recommended upstream method of using the 'cluster' configuration key instead of 'host' for storage services that support an Active-Active setup (see `High Availability Cinder-Volume`_). With this change, for environments running OpenStack Ocata or newer, file ``/etc/cinder/cinder.conf`` will see the 'cluster' key set when the configured storage backend is stateless (e.g. Ceph). releases. Support has ended for it. Please use the `barbican-vault`_ charm instead.The `tempest`_ test charm is now deprecated and will have no further releases. Support has ended for it. Please use the `tempest Python package`_ instead.cinder charm: Pure Storage volumes ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ For OpenStack releases Pike through Ussuri (inclusive) there is a problem in creating Pure Storage Cinder volumes (charm cinder-purestorage) with the 21.10 release of the cinder charm. The issue tracked in bug `LP #1947702`_ and is also described on the `Upgrade issues`_ page in the deploy guide... _Supported charms: ../reference/openstack-charms.html.. _Upgrade issues: https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/charm-deployment-guide/latest/upgrade-issues.html
deleted_lines: ================================= 21.10 (Draft version in progress) ================================= Summary of changes ------------------ * New stable charms * `cinder-lvm`_ * `cinder-netapp`_ * New stable charm features * `ceilometer-agent charm: new polling configuration options`_ * `cinder-purestorage charm: new configuration options`_ * `ceph-mon charm: disk capacity alert threshold configuration`_ * `designate charm: new options for creating DNS records`_ * `nova-compute charm: new options for neutron physnets NUMA affinity`_ * `ceph-osd charm: new action to display availability zones information`_ * `manila charm: new relation nrpe-external-master to nrpe charm`_ * `ceph-mon charm: new parameter for list-pools action`_ * `neutron-gateway charm: new actions to display routers/networks/loadbalancers`_ * `cinder charm: image volume caching`_ * `ceph-mon charm: new action to display quorum status`_ * `barbican charm: new options for request and secret sizes`_ * `OVN chassis charms: New option to influence scheduling of gateways`_ * `Documentation updates`_ * New tech-preview charms * `ceph-dashboard`_ * `openstack-loadbalancer`_ * New tech-preview charm features * `<TITLE>`_ * Informational notices * `neutron-openvswitch charm: DHCP service restarts in DPDK environments`_ * `OVN chassis charms: Change of behaviour for gateway chassis scheduling`_ * `Cinder charm: Change the method used to configure a clustered Volume service`_ * Deprecation notices * `Xenial series`_ * `Barbican SoftHSM2 Plugin`_ * `neutron-api charm: FWaaS removal`_ * `Tempest charm`_ * `Built-in Cinder LVM backend`_ * Removed features * `<TITLE>`_ Overview --------the `Charms`_ page. As of this release, the project consists of <NUMBER-OF-STABLE-CHARMS> supported (stable) charms.* s3-store-host * s3-store-access-key * s3-store-secret-key * s3-store-bucketThese can be used to control the polling frequency and the set of metersThis relation adds nrpe checks for services managed by manila charm to be monitored with Nagios.The ceph-mon charm's list-pools action has a new `format` parameter that* ``text`` - provides less information [default] * ``text-full`` - provides more information in json with indents * ``json`` - provides more information in json The default `text` provides the same output as previous version.The `neutron-gateway` charm has three new actions that enable listing neutron resources hosted on the unit. * ``show-routers`` - Lists neutron routers on the unit * ``show-dhcp-networks`` - Lists DHCP networks on the unit * ``show-loadbalancers`` - Lists LBaaS v2 loadbalancers on the unit``image-volume-cache-enabled`` ``image-volume-cache-max-size-gb`` ``image-volume-cache-max-count`` These will allow the enablement of a Cinder image cache as well as set its maximum size and its maximum number of entries. These options are supported on OpenStack Ocata and newer.The `get-quorum-status` action returns some distilled info from 'ceph quorum_status', primarily for verification of which mon units are online.specified which application should have its units preferred when schedulingCinder charm: Change the method used to configure a clustered Volume service ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The Cinder charm changes the configuration of the Volume service to adhere to the recommended upstream (see `High Availability Cinder-Volume`_) of using the "cluster" configuration key instead of "host" for storage services that support Active-Active setup. With this change /etc/cinder/cinder.conf for environments running OpenStack Ocata or newer will see the "cluster" key set when the configured storage backend is stateless (e.g. Ceph). New tech-preview charm features ------------------------------- <TITLE> ~~~~~~~ releases. Support has ended for it. Please use `barbican-vault`_ instead.The `tempest`_ test charm is now deprecated and will have no further releases. Support has ended for it. Please use the `tempest Python package`_ instead.Removed features ---------------- <TITLE> ~~~~~~~ Removed charms -------------- <TITLE> ~~~~~~~ Purestorage: Active-Active configuration is not currently supported ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ When a volume is created in OpenStack releases from Pike to Ussuri (included) it will go into error state and print the following message in the logs: "Active-Active configuration is not currently supported". this happens because the Volume service was configured to use the configuration key "cluster" which demands from the driver to claim Active-Active HA support explicitly and this feature flag was enabled for Purestorage in the Victoria release. Environments running Purestorage are discouraged from upgrading until the issue tracked in bug `LP #1947702`_ is fixed... _Charms: ../reference/openstack-charms.html

commit_message:
Fix race condition in the sink when deleting records

Updated the sink to behave closer to how we handle this type
of operations in designate.api.v2.

- Added object validation to all requests.
- Better test coverage.
- Use recordset update / delete instead of just record delete.

Closes-Bug: #1947765
Change-Id: I867600eb48a3e30a4d17471ab794ca717706823d

(os_compute_api:os-server-external-events:create). When nova is
configured to enforce scope, these calls fail because the nova service
doesn't have the admin role on the system.

We are expecting to hit more cases like this as more services adopt

Change-Id: I000209a4677d7db5622016667ea7d38626d50918

commit_message:
Ensure the nova service user is a system-admin

Neutron calls some system-specific nova APIs/policies
(os_compute_api:os-server-external-events:create). When nova is
configured to enforce scope, these calls fail because the nova service
doesn't have the admin role on the system.

We are expecting to hit more cases like this as more services adopt
system scope. This commit uses a common function to grant the nova
service user the admin role on the system after it's created.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/805452
Change-Id: I000209a4677d7db5622016667ea7d38626d50918
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/87/806187/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(jamielennox): Nova doesn't need the admin role here, however # neutron uses this service user when notifying nova of changes and # that requires the admin role. Additionally, since we're now trying to # separate all the project-level APIs from system-level APIs across # OpenStack, the nova user needs a system role assignment to call # system-level APIs of other services. get_or_add_user_system_role "admin" "nova" "all" "$SERVICE_DOMAIN_NAME"
deleted_lines: # NOTE(jamielennox): Nova doesn't need the admin role here, however neutron uses # this service user when notifying nova of changes and that requires the admin role.

commit_message:
Add a common function for system role assignments

As more and more services adopt system scope across OpenStack we're
going to need a function to grant system role assignments to users,
including service users.

This commit introduces a new function that creates system role
assignments in keystone and it's similar to the existing functions we
have for creating project role assignments.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/805452
Change-Id: Ie26b5770304bc43b9bde36efe1eda29a520fc287
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/86/806186/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Gets or adds user role to system # Usage: get_or_add_user_system_role <role> <user> <system> [<user_domain>] function get_or_add_user_system_role { local user_role_id domain_args=$(_get_domain_args $4) # Gets user role id user_role_id=$(openstack role assignment list \ --role $1 \ --user $2 \ --system $3 \ $domain_args \ | grep '^|\s[a-f0-9]\+' | get_field 1) if [[ -z "$user_role_id" ]]; then # Adds role to user and get it openstack role add $1 \ --user $2 \ --system $3 \ $domain_args user_role_id=$(openstack role assignment list \ --role $1 \ --user $2 \ --project $3 \ $domain_args \ | grep '^|\s[a-f0-9]\+' | get_field 1) fi echo $user_role_id }

commit_message:
Add test coverage for system-admins creating instances

This commit adds a straight-forward test that we can use to test all the
necessary integration bits we'll need to actually adopt system-scope.

This change is likely going to depend on a slew of other changes before
it will pass. For example, keystonemiddleware will need to pull project
IDs off of system-scoped requests. Tempest clients will need to expose a
way to pass project IDs in requests for system clients. Keystoneauth
will need to handle context objects with both system and project
attributes and craft requests appropriately so services like nova can
pass project IDs along to other services like neutron.

This test is the basis for flushing out all those other changes we still
need.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/805456
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/keystonemiddleware/+/787822
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/806187

Change-Id: Iec7e473be5864c29c2747513622f400bcaef350d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/52/805452/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class ServersSystemAdminTestJSON(base.BaseV2ComputeAdminTest): """Test servers using system-scoped tokens.""" credentials = ['primary', 'admin', 'system_admin'] def test_create_server(self): """Make sure system-admins can create servers in a project.""" self.create_test_server( clients=self.os_system_admin, wait_until='ACTIVE' )

commit_message:
Remove deleting Kibana indices before pod start up

Deleting kibana indices in the start script will result in
kibana index patterns to be removed at each pod restart.
This patchset corrects that issue.

This patchset also removes the annotation for helm hooks.
It is not needed as there is dependency set already in
values.yaml for the register_kibana_indexes job.

Note that these changes are reverting some of the changes
introduced by https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/805246.
The kibana image has also been reverted and therefore the above 2 changes are not
necessary.

Change-Id: Icc6a74e2e23b1e663d989943bc5f3d457e167376
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/24/814224/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove Kibana indices before pod start up

The ps removes kibana indices from elasticsearch when a pod
comes up. It also removes the source code in values.yaml for
the flush job since it is not needed at this point.

Change-Id: Icb0376fed4872308b26e608d5be0fbac504d802d

added_lines: * `Cinder charm: Change the method used to configure a clustered Volume service`_Cinder charm: Change the method used to configure a clustered Volume service ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The Cinder charm changes the configuration of the Volume service to adhere to the recommended upstream (see `High Availability Cinder-Volume`_) of using the "cluster" configuration key instead of "host" for storage services that support Active-Active setup. With this change /etc/cinder/cinder.conf for environments running OpenStack Ocata or newer will see the "cluster" key set when the configured storage backend is stateless (e.g. Ceph). .. _High Availability Cinder-Volume: https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/contributor/high_availability.html#cinder-volume

commit_message:
Swift backend: the key parameter should be secret

The key parameter of swift backend is used to define a credentail to
access Swift so should be hidden in logs.

In Glance the user parameter(swift_store_user) is also defined as
a secret parameter. However it defines user name or id and user name
or id is not currently treated as secret in puppet, so this change
doesn't cover the user parameter.

Change-Id: Iac580df4de14ffdb19436417b2830a834efd087d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/00/814700/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "${default_swift_reference}/key": value => $swift_store_key, secret => true;

policy: Make sure policy_path is an absolute path

The policy_path parameter should be an absolute path because now this
parameter is used to manage the policy file content.

Change-Id: Ib2d41f57ab50ef225887bcad2457ffcc0911cd84

commit_message:
Add charm upgrade issue for cinder

Change-Id: Ia5d895c31434aa19b0ca96ebf1035e5909f7db83
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-deployment-guide refs/changes/56/815056/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cinder charm: Pure Storage volumes ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ For OpenStack releases Pike through Ussuri (inclusive) there is a problem in creating Cinder volumes backed by Pure Storage (charm cinder-purestorage) with the 21.10 release of the cinder charm. A newly-created volume will go into an error state and the following message will appear in the Cinder logs: "Active-Active configuration is not currently supported". This issue is tracked in bug `LP #1947702`_. Affected environments are therefore discouraged from upgrading the cinder charm to the 21.10 release until the issue is resolved for other supported OpenStack releases. .. _LP #1947702: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1947702

commit_message:
docs: Improve info about neutron external interface

Change-Id: I3a9c49c73a932b3d5ceed65c92190e5d72e27bbb
Closes-Bug: #1626259
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/66/814766/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Network interfaces ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ for example provider networks, routers and floating IPs. For setting up the neutron external interface modifydesired interface name. This interface is used by hosts in the ``network`` group. It is also used by hosts in the ``compute`` group if ``enable_neutron_provider_networks`` is set or DVR is enabled. The interface is plugged into a bridge (Open vSwitch or Linux Bridge, depending on the driver) defined by ``neutron_bridge_name``, which defaults to ``br-ex``. The default Neutron physical network is ``physnet1``. Example: single interface ------------------------- In the case where we have only a single Neutron external interface, configuration is simple:Example: multiple interfaces ---------------------------- In some cases it may be necessary to have multiple external network interfaces. This may be achieved via comma-separated lists: .. code-block:: yaml neutron_external_interface: "eth1,eth2" neutron_bridge_name: "br-ex1,br-ex2" These two lists are "zipped" together, such that ``eth1`` is plugged into the ``br-ex1`` bridge, and ``eth2`` is plugged into the ``br-ex2`` bridge. Kolla Ansible maps these interfaces to Neutron physical networks ``physnet1`` and ``physnet2`` respectively. Example: shared interface ------------------------- Sometimes an interface used for Neutron external networking may also be used for other traffic. Plugging an interface directly into a bridge would prevent us from having a usable IP address on the interface. One solution to this issue is to use an intermediate Linux bridge and virtual Ethernet pair, then assign IP addresses on the Linux bridge. This setup is supported by :kayobe-doc:`Kayobe </>`. It is out of scope here, as it is non-trivial to set up in a persistent manner. Provider networks ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Provider networks allow to connect compute instances directly to physical networks avoiding tunnels. This is necessary for example for some performance critical applications. Only administrators of OpenStack can create such networks.For provider networks, compute hosts must have an external bridge created and configured by Ansible (this is also necessary when :neutron-doc:`Neutron Distributed Virtual Routing (DVR) <admin/deploy-ovs-ha-dvr.html>` mode is enabled). In this case, ensure ``neutron_external_interface`` is configured correctly for hosts in the ``compute`` group.
deleted_lines: for example provider networks and floating IPs. For setting up the neutron external interface please modifydesired interface name, ``eth1`` in the example below:.. note:: This is used by hosts in the ``network`` group, and hosts in the ``compute`` group if ``enable_neutron_provider_networks`` is set or DVR is enabled... note:: ``enable_neutron_provider_networks`` ensures ``neutron_external_interface`` is used on hosts in the ``compute`` group.

commit_message:
Modify key repo file permissions

keystone currently emits a warning on world-readable fernet keys
on every single key transaction. This fills the logs with a lot
of warnings. This change is an attempt to fix the file permission
issue.

Change-Id: Ic71fd50d798da9bf7c338d17f3016d6c3b671d83

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/67/814767/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Network interfaces ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ for example provider networks, routers and floating IPs. For setting up the neutron external interface modifydesired interface name. This interface is used by hosts in the ``network`` group. It is also used by hosts in the ``compute`` group if ``enable_neutron_provider_networks`` is set or DVR is enabled. The interface is plugged into a bridge (Open vSwitch or Linux Bridge, depending on the driver) defined by ``neutron_bridge_name``, which defaults to ``br-ex``. The default Neutron physical network is ``physnet1``. Example: single interface ------------------------- In the case where we have only a single Neutron external interface, configuration is simple:Example: multiple interfaces ---------------------------- In some cases it may be necessary to have multiple external network interfaces. This may be achieved via comma-separated lists: .. code-block:: yaml neutron_external_interface: "eth1,eth2" neutron_bridge_name: "br-ex1,br-ex2" These two lists are "zipped" together, such that ``eth1`` is plugged into the ``br-ex1`` bridge, and ``eth2`` is plugged into the ``br-ex2`` bridge. Kolla Ansible maps these interfaces to Neutron physical networks ``physnet1`` and ``physnet2`` respectively. Example: shared interface ------------------------- Sometimes an interface used for Neutron external networking may also be used for other traffic. Plugging an interface directly into a bridge would prevent us from having a usable IP address on the interface. One solution to this issue is to use an intermediate Linux bridge and virtual Ethernet pair, then assign IP addresses on the Linux bridge. This setup is supported by :kayobe-doc:`Kayobe </>`. It is out of scope here, as it is non-trivial to set up in a persistent manner. Provider networks ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Provider networks allow to connect compute instances directly to physical networks avoiding tunnels. This is necessary for example for some performance critical applications. Only administrators of OpenStack can create such networks.For provider networks, compute hosts must have an external bridge created and configured by Ansible (this is also necessary when :neutron-doc:`Neutron Distributed Virtual Routing (DVR) <admin/deploy-ovs-ha-dvr.html>` mode is enabled). In this case, ensure ``neutron_external_interface`` is configured correctly for hosts in the ``compute`` group.

commit_message:
Fix manila haproxy manage

In manila playbook we incorrectly defined haproxy backend name.
This wasn't catched by CI since we do single node deployment.

Closes-Bug: #1947026
Change-Id: I924504060179542bd2347b5155f70795d065381b

commit_message:
Fix manila haproxy manage

In manila playbook we incorrectly defined haproxy backend name.

commit_message:
Ensure KLB is updated

We're moving this because we discovered that Octavia will not always
raise Conflict if you create an LB with the same IP.

If no VIP port got created for an LB, then Octavia will not have any
issue with creating another LB with the same IP.

Closes-Bug: 1947809

Change-Id: I26b911b30403c7ea5a35706b2fc80af499e91330

commit_message:
Fix gates

Remove python-ceilometerclient for heat added as work-around until
[0] is merged. Python-ceilometerclient is deprecated and incompatible
with current master requirements.

Also Disable watcher build for master due to dependency on
python-ceilometerclient.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/heat/+/813724

Change-Id: Id25baad68a94911efda547f166efc9a0516ced65
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>

commit_message:
[OVN] "ControllerAgent" should accept Chassis and Chassis_Private

Because we support OVN version with and without Chassis_Private,
"ControllerAgent" should accept both type of registers. In Chassis, the
"external_ids" are stored as a main attribute while in Chassis_Private
are stored on the chassis reference list.

Closes-bug: #1933401

Change-Id: I4575ca06ccba3537a8fd2347b837231e0643e64c
(cherry picked from commit 1f3762b0fb8258e2f77b600df8ab96f20d65f5b8)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/61/814661/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @staticmethod def chassis_from_private(chassis_private): try: return chassis_private.chassis[0] return chassis_private @property def chassis(self): return self.chassis_from_private(self.chassis_private) external_ids = cls.chassis_from_private(chassis_private).external_ids external_ids.get('ovn-cms-options', [])):
deleted_lines: @property def chassis(self): try: return self.chassis_private.chassis[0] return self.chassis_private chassis_private.external_ids.get('ovn-cms-options', [])):

Yet it still tries to request a cert for it (and fails due to

Get mgr systemd unit\nmgr_unit=$(systemctl list-units | awk '/ceph-mgr/

With this patch applied I correctly get passed this point and am able to

2021-05-04 12:40:44.300445 | 5254004b-fe7a-5ccf-c0b9-0000000000df | TASK | External deployment step 2

The problem is that the 'enable_internal_tls' is global and only checks

commit_message:
Do not ask for cephdashboard certificates when it is disabled

When deploying with TLS-E and cephadm, I disabled the ceph dashboard:
(undercloud) [stack@undercloud-0 ~]$ openstack stack environment show
overcloud -f yaml |grep -i cephenabledashboard

  CephEnableDashboard: false

Yet it still tries to request a cert for it (and fails due to
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1926746):
2021-05-03 14:02:54.876228 | 5254004b-fe7a-614d-c9eb-00000000e323 |
FATAL | Ensure certificate requests | ctrl-3-0 | item={'ca': 'ipa',
'dns': 'ctrl-3-0.mainnetwork.bgp.ftw', 'key_size': '2048', 'name':
'ceph_dashboard', 'principal':
'ceph_dashboard/ctrl-3-0.mainnetwork.bgp.ftw@BGP.FTW', 'run_after': '#
Get mgr systemd unit\nmgr_unit=$(systemctl list-units | awk \'/ceph-mgr/
{print $1}\')\n# Restart the mgr systemd unit\nif [ -n "$mgr_unit" ];
then\n systemctl restart "$mgr_unit"\nfi\n'} |
error={"ansible_loop_var": "item", "changed": false, "cmd":
"/bin/getcert request -N CN=ctrl-3-0.mainnetwork.bgp.ftw -c IPA -w -k
/etc/pki/tls/private/ceph_dashboard.key -f
/etc/pki/tls/certs/ceph_dashboard.crt -D ctrl-3-0.mainnetwork.bgp.ftw -D
'' -A '' -E '' -r -g 2048 -K '' -K '' -u digitalSignature -u
keyEncipherment -U 1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.1 -U 1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.2 -U '' -B '' -C
/etc/certmonger/post-scripts/ceph_dashboard-838da8a.sh", "item": {"ca":
"ipa", "dns": "ctrl-3-0.mainnetwork.bgp.ftw", "key_size": "2048",
"name": "ceph_dashboard", "principal":
"ceph_dashboard/ctrl-3-0.mainnetwork.bgp.ftw@BGP.FTW", "run_after": "#
Get mgr systemd unit\nmgr_unit=$(systemctl list-units | awk '/ceph-mgr/
{print $1}')\n# Restart the mgr systemd unit\nif [ -n \"$mgr_unit\" ];
then\n systemctl restart \"$mgr_unit\"\nfi\n"}, "msg": "", "rc": 2,
"stderr": "", "stderr_lines": [], "stdout": "New signing request
\"20210503140253\" added.\n", "stdout_lines": ["New signing request
\"20210503140253\" added."]}

With this patch applied I correctly get passed this point and am able to
reach later steps:
2021-05-04 12:40:44.300445 | 5254004b-fe7a-5ccf-c0b9-0000000000df | TASK | External deployment step 2

The problem is that the 'enable_internal_tls' is global and only checks
for internal TLS being enabled so it will still be triggered when
CephEnabledDashboard is set to false. Let's switch it to the internal
condition internal_tls_enabled which takes the dashboard into account.

Change-Id: I73a58b00f31bfeffb724e12515d8c5cb0625ca7f
Closes-Bug: #1927093
(cherry picked from commit 92f722a05c361333ec3e3712e3f8ae7569abda49)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/58/814758/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if: - internal_tls_enabled - - name: Certificate generation when: - step|int == 1 block: - include_role: name: linux-system-roles.certificate vars: certificate_requests: - name: ceph_dashboard dns: str_replace: template: "{{fqdn_$NETWORK}}" params: $NETWORK: {get_param: [ServiceNetMap, CephDashboardNetwork]} principal: str_replace: template: "ceph_dashboard/{{fqdn_$NETWORK}}@{{idm_realm}}" params: $NETWORK: {get_param: [ServiceNetMap, CephDashboardNetwork]} run_after: | # Get mgr systemd unit mgr_unit=$(systemctl list-units | awk '/ceph-mgr/ {print $1}') # Restart the mgr systemd unit if [ -n "$mgr_unit" ]; then systemctl restart "$mgr_unit" fi key_size: if: - key_size_override_set - {get_param: CephCertificateKeySize} - {get_param: CertificateKeySize} ca: ipa
deleted_lines: - name: Certificate generation when: - step|int == 1 - enable_internal_tls block: - include_role: name: linux-system-roles.certificate vars: certificate_requests: - name: ceph_dashboard dns: str_replace: template: "{{fqdn_$NETWORK}}" params: $NETWORK: {get_param: [ServiceNetMap, CephDashboardNetwork]} principal: str_replace: template: "ceph_dashboard/{{fqdn_$NETWORK}}@{{idm_realm}}" params: $NETWORK: {get_param: [ServiceNetMap, CephDashboardNetwork]} run_after: | # Get mgr systemd unit mgr_unit=$(systemctl list-units | awk '/ceph-mgr/ {print $1}') # Restart the mgr systemd unit if [ -n "$mgr_unit" ]; then systemctl restart "$mgr_unit" fi key_size: if: - key_size_override_set - {get_param: CephCertificateKeySize} - {get_param: CertificateKeySize} ca: ipa

commit_message:
Add support for openvswitch interface driver with OVN

This patch enables the openvswitch interface driver when the
ML2/OVN driver is used. An interface driver is required when
using the legacy DHCP agent (required for OVN+Ironic).

Change-Id: I56bad4e6ec94b516d1e94d76b423cc3437e3f464

commit_message:
add kernel-modules-extra in overcloud image needed for HWOL

In case of ovs-hw-offload, without k-m-e installed,
it will have a performance impact because of excessive upcalls
due to the lack of act_ct.

This patch is intended to provision k-m-e in overcloud image
building.

act_ct would be added to kernel-core in rhel9.
So, k-m-e doesnt required in rhel9,centos9.

Closes-Bug: #1946227
Change-Id: If398172876059559ce70ebb868ada82da009a02d
(cherry picked from commit cd5c95441cc56e7ab3f7f4cc1d558fce5bb98d99)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/55/814755/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
add kernel-modules-extra in overcloud image needed for HWOL

In case of ovs-hw-offload, without k-m-e installed,
it will have a performance impact because of excessive upcalls
due to the lack of act_ct.

This patch is intended to provision k-m-e in overcloud image
building.

act_ct would be added to kernel-core in rhel9.
So, k-m-e doesnt required in rhel9,centos9.

Closes-Bug: #1946227
Change-Id: If398172876059559ce70ebb868ada82da009a02d
(cherry picked from commit cd5c95441cc56e7ab3f7f4cc1d558fce5bb98d99)

added_lines: Purestorage: Active-Active configuration is not currently supported. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ When a volume is created in OpenStack releases from Pike to Ussuri (included) it will go into error state and printing in the logs the message: "Active-Active configuration is not currently supported", this happens because the Volume service was configured to use the configuration key "cluster" which demands from the driver to claim Active-Active HA support explicitly and this is not true for Purestorage until the Victoria release. This issue is tracked in bug `LP #1947702`_. .. _LP #1947702: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1947702

commit_message:
Assert EFI part UUID is not None before editing fstab

The EFI partition UUID may be None and this will break
the fstab editing. While this is not necessarily fatal when
instantiating a node, it creates an exception at the end of
bootloader installation, so only attempt to add a line to
fstab when the UUID is not None.

Change-Id: I68799980e67c05afe4ca68ca9733605dd166d54d
(cherry picked from commit 333ed70c94e366f16d8f2633f74a5ef05aa5fadb)

commit_message:
React on 404 when creating LB resources

If Kuryr attempts to create an Octavia resource for a loadbalancer that
is no more, we'll get 404 from Octavia API and do nothing more. This
commit changes the behavior to release the LB and clean the state in
such case, effectively triggering a recreation of the LB.

Change-Id: I1b90cc63bda5d899ed85dbe50387bf8dc0c272cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/44/814244/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class LoadBalancerRemoved(Exception): def __init__(self, loadbalancer, state): self.id = loadbalancer['id'] self.name = loadbalancer['name'] self.state = state

commit_message:
dont block kuryr if one subnet runs out of IPs

IpAddressGenerationFailureClient causes VIF Handler to fail, that causes
restart. In large environments this restart can take significant amount
of time causing other projects to slow down the process of creating new
pods.

This failure is not Kuryr failure and Kuryr can still function
successfuly without it.

Closes-Bug: 1943644
Change-Id: I35d5be9ac48c7041be8127ca31d09cf33279e3d7

commit_message:
Support Ansible diff mode

Adds a '--diff' argument to kayobe CLI commands. This is passed through
to ansible-playbook for Kayobe Ansible playbooks, and can be used with
the '--check' argument to see changes that would be made to files.

This change also passes through --check and --diff arguments to
kolla-ansible.

Story: 2009038
Task: 42794

Change-Id: I350795c328c0dc0a91a5cd500c252c5b7b1eafc1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/03/800003/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Adds a ``--diff`` argument to kayobe CLI commands. This is passed through to ``ansible-playbook`` for Kayobe and Kolla Ansible playbooks, and can be used with the ``--check`` argument to see changes that would be made to files. upgrade: - | The ``--check`` argument to kayobe CLI commands is now passed through to Kolla Ansible playbooks.

(cherry picked from commit cd5c95441cc56e7ab3f7f4cc1d558fce5bb98d99)
'}]
commit_message:
add kernel-modules-extra in overcloud image needed for HWOL

In case of ovs-hw-offload, without k-m-e installed,
it will have a performance impact because of excessive upcalls
due to the lack of act_ct.

This patch is intended to provision k-m-e in overcloud image
building.

act_ct would be added to kernel-core in rhel9.
So, k-m-e doesnt required in rhel9,centos9.

Closes-Bug: #1946227
Change-Id: If398172876059559ce70ebb868ada82da009a02d
(cherry picked from commit cd5c95441cc56e7ab3f7f4cc1d558fce5bb98d99)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/63/814663/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: packages: - kernel-modules-extra

avoids conflicts where part of the command name conflicts with an
arbitrary argument. Old aliases are preserved but can be removed in the

commit_message:
Add hyphenated commands

Instead of using e.g. 'openstack server add floating ip', start using
'openstack server add-floating-ip'. This is easier to autocomplete and
avoids conflicts where part of the command name conflicts with an
arbitrary argument. Old aliases are preserved but can be removed in the
future. This is likely to be contentious but it resolves a years-long
bugbear of mine and in theory should make the UI far more pleasant to
use over the long-term.

Change-Id: Ifda58214ac442112bf1801ab2f15496d3be96fcb
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Drop '--infra-rename' argument

There is a plan to move to source only images. So infra images stuff
would not be needed == this switch is worthless.

Change-Id: I50ec5dd7e97028a15758c46eee8c45d8052d0363
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/15/814915/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: cfg.BoolOpt('infra-rename', default=False, help='Rename infrastructure images to infra')

commit_message:
Add note about Grafana certificate

Some environments may experience failure as Grafana graphs
will silently fail to display due to an unverified TLS
certificate for the Grafana server. Add a note about this
and how to overcome it.

Change-Id: I29ec8d63a50b31268129f7717f4931fc75d53d59
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-dashboard refs/changes/25/813725/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: > **Important**: Ceph Dashboard will (silently) fail to display Grafana output if the client browser cannot validate the Grafana server's TLS certificate. Either ensure the signing CA certificate is known to the browser or, if in a testing environment, contact Grafana directly and have the browser accept the unverified certificate.

commit_message:
Add doc updates to 21.10 release notes

Depends-On: I97cab38ecfcbfc586aeccaedcdba3c680b6e50db
Change-Id: I2c59a46c34f0a2ee257d93c14369927a0adfed74
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-guide refs/changes/11/812611/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * `Documentation updates`_ Documentation updates --------------------- A summary of the most significant documentation updates is given below. * In the `OpenStack Charms Deployment Guide`_ (aka "deploy guide"): * A page on OpenStack Ironic support has been added. * A section on cloud operations has been started. * The install section has been updated to OpenStack Xena (with superbond). * Full review of these charms: ceph-dashboard, cinder-lvm, cinder-netapp, neutron-gateway, nova-cloud-controller, nova-compute, and openstack-loadbalancer. * The `OpenStack Charm Guide`_ (aka "charm guide") has been refactored to better reflect the Diataxis framework.
deleted_lines: Documentation updates --------------------- In the `OpenStack Charms Deployment Guide`_ (aka "deploy guide"): * A new page on OpenStack Ironic support has been added. * A new section on cloud operations has been started.

commit_message:
Add the missing documentation for mariadb recovery

This change is a missing part for the new Kayobe functionality
introduced in Ie16354cd01ea7dd83cd3d4058dd8451b8387600b.

Change-Id: Ia3d665d53ccdb9e3b1d40949e96b720fab6df348
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/81/813781/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Performing Database Recovery ============================ Recover a completely stopped mariadb cluster using the underlying support in Kolla Ansible. To perform recovery run the following command: .. code-block:: console kayobe overcloud database recover Or to perform recovery on specified host, run the following command: .. code-block:: console kayobe overcloud database recover --force-recovery-host <host> By default the underlying kolla-ansible will automatically determine which host to use, and this option should not be used.

Infra VMs: follow up

* Improve docs

added_lines: Infra VMs --------- By default, infrastructure VMs are attached to the following network: * overcloud admin network This list may be extended by setting ``infra_vm_extra_network_interfaces`` to a list of names of additional networks to attach. Alternatively, the list may be completely overridden by setting ``infra_vm_network_interfaces``. These variables are found in ``${KAYOBE_CONFIG_PATH}/infra-vms.yml``.

subject: Make setup module arguments configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-09-30 07:46:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/commit/ab711e584bbaa746d67c80ca57a84a840b4ae2d0', 'message': "Make setup module arguments configurable

Ansible facts can have a large impact on the performance of the Ansible
control host. This patch introduces some control over which facts are
gathered (kayobe_ansible_setup_gather_subset) and which facts are stored
(kayobe_ansible_setup_filter). By default we do not change the default
values of these arguments to the setup module. The flexibility of these
arguments is limited, but they do provide enough for a large performance
improvement in a typical moderate to large OpenStack cloud.

In particular, the large complex dict fact for each interface has a
large effect, and on an OpenStack controller or hypervisor there may be
many virtual interfaces. We can use the kayobe_ansible_setup_filter
variable to help:

    kayobe_ansible_setup_filter: 'ansible_[!qt]*'

This causes Ansible to collect but not store facts matching that
pattern, which includes the virtual interface facts. Currently we are
not referencing other facts matching the pattern within Kayobe.
Note that including the 'ansible_' prefix causes meta facts module_setup
and gather_subset to be filtered, but this seems to be the only way to
get a good match on the interface facts. To work around this, we use
ansible_facts rather than module_setup to detect whether facts exist in
the cache.

The exact improvement will vary, but has been reported to be as large as
18x on systems with many virtual interfaces.

This change also introduces a new command to gather facts for Kayobe &
Kolla Ansible on demand, 'kayobe overcloud facts gather'. This can be
used to populate a fact cache.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/794610

commit_message:
Make setup module arguments configurable

Ansible facts can have a large impact on the performance of the Ansible
control host. This patch introduces some control over which facts are
gathered (kayobe_ansible_setup_gather_subset) and which facts are stored
(kayobe_ansible_setup_filter). By default we do not change the default
values of these arguments to the setup module. The flexibility of these
arguments is limited, but they do provide enough for a large performance
improvement in a typical moderate to large OpenStack cloud.

In particular, the large complex dict fact for each interface has a
large effect, and on an OpenStack controller or hypervisor there may be
many virtual interfaces. We can use the kayobe_ansible_setup_filter
variable to help:

    kayobe_ansible_setup_filter: 'ansible_[!qt]*'

This causes Ansible to collect but not store facts matching that
pattern, which includes the virtual interface facts. Currently we are
not referencing other facts matching the pattern within Kayobe.
Note that including the 'ansible_' prefix causes meta facts module_setup
and gather_subset to be filtered, but this seems to be the only way to
get a good match on the interface facts. To work around this, we use
ansible_facts rather than module_setup to detect whether facts exist in
the cache.

The exact improvement will vary, but has been reported to be as large as
18x on systems with many virtual interfaces.

This change also introduces a new command to gather facts for Kayobe &
Kolla Ansible on demand, 'kayobe overcloud facts gather'. This can be
used to populate a fact cache.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/794610
Story: 2007993
Task: 42586

Change-Id: I5ce3c734433e1682ee942867505468c57440e689
(cherry picked from commit 2648f48746fa01a5215e1fd9c79a0e7821414841)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/84/811784/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: filter: "{{ kayobe_ansible_setup_filter }}" gather_subset: "{{ kayobe_ansible_setup_gather_subset }}" when: not ansible_facts filter: "{{ kayobe_ansible_setup_filter }}" gather_subset: "{{ kayobe_ansible_setup_gather_subset }}"

Change-Id: I5c6dc5ea826c57b8c442ee0e876010a9ab726612

commit_message:
Remove helm status from deployment scripts for elastic-beats

With the move to helm v3, helm status requires a namespace to be specified, but doing so breaks helm v2 compatability. This change removes the usage of helm serve in openstack-helm-infra's deployment scripts.

Change-Id: I5c6dc5ea826c57b8c442ee0e876010a9ab726612

commit_message:
Add CloudSIG xena release file

Add release file for Testing CloudSIG xena repo [1].
This will be used to run some scenario jobs in RDO[2] which
will build containers using CloudSIG repo and then deploy
those containers.

current-tripleo-rdo is used instead of current-tripleo
as TripleO has not branched stable/xena and not running
promotion pipeline for xena[3].

[1] http://mirror.centos.org/centos/8-stream/cloud/x86_64/openstack-xena/
[2] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/rdoinfo/+/36340
[3] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/xena/tripleo-independent-release.html

Change-Id: Ib393188b68cf923231cba81a62d05011fe0387ed

commit_message:
Drop legacy undercloud install

Use undercloud_install from tripleo-operator-ansible
for all supported releases i.e train+.

Also cleanup vars/templates related to legacy undercloud
install.

Due to release=master condition tripleo-operator-ansible
was used only for master and in mean while there were
multiple releases.

Change-Id: I813decf17ff58b53677bd84a4fab5c1fad7d60ef

The EFI partition UUID may be None and this will break

instantiating a node, it creates an exception at the end of

commit_message:
Assert EFI part UUID is not None before editing fstab

The EFI partition UUID may be None and this will break
the fstab editing. While this is not necessarily fatal when
instantiating a node, it creates an exception at the end of
bootloader installation, so only attempt to add a line to
fstab when the UUID is not None.

Change-Id: I68799980e67c05afe4ca68ca9733605dd166d54d
(cherry picked from commit 333ed70c94e366f16d8f2633f74a5ef05aa5fadb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/04/814904/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Rules in policy directory files can be deleted.

Policy directory files can only add new rules or
update existing rules in cache, but cannot return back
loaded rules in memory to their default value.
This incorrect behavior was fixed in the patch.

Member "_loaded_files" of class Enforcer should keep
list of loaded policy config files paths.
In fact if the same file is changed many times
then the same file path is added many times.
If a file is deleted it's path not deleted from "_loaded_files".
The member is very misleading and is not used in code.
So this member was deleted in the patch because of
above mentioned resons.

Change-Id: I9ede38d8cf2ae968d3d8c0b1240bd6a51e6aa931
Closes-Bug: 1943584

commit_message:
CI: add host configure tests for firewalld

Follow up adding tests for Id60e25e129e323f3c07e702bb81a11efc530fb3e.

Change-Id: Ieb6d6e4d491b4ceb44d5fe364f0da215ac303fe1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/99/812299/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _is_firewalld_supported(): info = distro.linux_distribution() return info[0].startswith('CentOS') @pytest.mark.skipif(not _is_firewalld_supported(), reason="Firewalld only supported on CentOS") def test_firewalld(host): assert host.package("firewalld").is_installed assert host.service("firewalld.service").is_enabled assert host.service("firewalld.service").is_running with host.sudo(): zones = host.check_output("firewall-cmd --get-active-zones") expected_zones = ['public', 'test-zone1', 'test-zone2', 'test-zone3', 'test-zone4'] for zone in expected_zones: assert zone in zones # TODO(mgoddard): Test rules

commit_message:
Prevent Bifrost from using firewalld

This is to avoid conflicting with iptables rules configured on the seed
host by Kayobe.

A new variable kolla_bifrost_use_firewalld is introduced to configure
whether Bifrost uses firewalld.

Change-Id: I7049eae6518f818f9e180dfdb6f515d527644808
Story: 2009252
Task: 43442
(cherry picked from commit 9f6c912b3418b21c06f53860e786b5b56daddff6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/04/814704/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Whether Bifrost uses firewalld. Default value is false to avoid conflicting # with iptables rules configured on the seed host by Kayobe. kolla_bifrost_use_firewalld: False

commit_message:
Remove stale config dump from seed hypervisor host configure

The config dump was removed from host configure commands in
I85670be7242bc436f73c689f027670b0938ba031, but somehow the seed
hypervisor was missed.

Change-Id: I4ae457a784423dcce96e51b4bb21219831acc854

commit_message:
Fix molecule job

This adds the possibility to sova uses a local file instead of
downloading from github.
This is required because the verification searchs for a specific
failure, that recently was updated in the sova config file, and
the test started to fail. So, now, we use a static sova config
file to be used by the molecule, avoiding these kind of failures
happen in the future.

Change-Id: I2530188f1795a39ec6ec7e43c9ba118349c08541

commit_message:
Add el9 vars file for bootstrap

We need to create a el9 bootstrap file to ensure the packages get
installed correctly. Currently it's falling back to redhat.yml which is
really the el7 file.

Change-Id: I070c9a7703655f642894f9f6885256806db54d3c

commit_message:
Removing validations.yml playbook from job definition

The validations.yml playbook is going to be included
in the multinode.yml.
Executing it twice is not necessary and could lead to
suboptimal results.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/+/814407

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5dd904a66de07b77892966c0a375084e2401fb0c

commit_message:
Break apart clouds.yaml creation

Instead of waiting untill all users are created to lay down the
clouds.yaml file, let's populate it with the admin profiles first so
that we have something we can use to create other resources in keystone
immediately.

This helps remove the usage of environment variables for authorization.

Change-Id: I0aadaa3b75123bc14b9105bad3fa7e7934d6b853

commit_message:
Set proxy option in early dnf invocation

If hosts need to use a proxy to install packages and python is absent,
the call to install the python package will hang, at least on CentOS.

Set proxy if it exists in dnf_config using a command-line option. Later
uses of dnf will be after dnf.conf has been updated.

Change-Id: Ic949577afd3ea07306cebf224637a08a1ecce0f5
Story: 2009274
Task: 43528
(cherry picked from commit 29d73eed7a175f8d4126570c3321dc966f0547f1)

added_lines: dnf_options: - "-y" - "{% if 'proxy' in dnf_config %}--setopt=proxy={{ dnf_config['proxy'] }}{% endif %}" # TODO(priteau): Support apt proxy raw: "test -e /usr/bin/apt && (sudo apt -y update && sudo apt install -y python3-minimal) || (sudo dnf {{ dnf_options | select | join(' ') }} install python3)"
deleted_lines: raw: test -e /usr/bin/apt && (sudo apt -y update && sudo apt install -y python3-minimal) || (sudo dnf -y install python3)

commit_message:
Use 'cluster' config only for Active/Active drivers.

Cinder allows the use of the 'cluster' configuration key only when the
driver(s) configured claim to support 'Active/Active HA'.

This patch reads the key 'active_active_ha' from the related
subordinates to determine if the configured storage can be clustered.

Closes-Bug: #1947702
Change-Id: I84476fe1c1457a432ede531de9847787366b7bb0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-cinder refs/changes/45/814845/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: active_active_ha = True any_active_active_ha = False # check if any of the subordinates is not stateless # Check if the subordinates support Active/Active HA. Charms # that don't support this need to opt-out. val = relation_get('active_active_ha', rid=rid, unit=unit) or 'true' val = True if val.lower() == 'true' else False log('does unit %s support Active/Active HA? %s' % (unit, val)) active_active_ha = active_active_ha and val any_active_active_ha = any_active_active_ha or active_active_ha # A clustered Volume service can be deployed when the drivers # claim to be stateless and active-active HA support. if cmp_os_release >= 'ocata' and active_active_ha: clustering_config = 'cluster' else: clustering_config = 'host'

commit_message:
Make sure that rabbitmq_cacert has 'undef' as a default.

This is done so that the deployment does not fail if we do not pass any
rabbitmq:ssl_cacert key at all. This is needed on SSL (non TLS-E)
undercloud installations, see LP and related tht patch.

Change-Id: I4e9801ba3ced734e5aa3fa22df522fab0e84761a
Related-Bug: #1947776
(cherry picked from commit a9e0ec90f493880a8783b1654c82a4578df2a458)

commit_message:
Remove deprecation of heartbeat_in_pthread

In some circumstances services can be executed outside of mod_wsgi and
in a monkey patched environment. In this context we need to leave the
possibility to users to execute the heartbeat in a green thread.

The heartbeat_in_pthread was tagged as depreacted few months and planned
for a future removal. These changes drop this deprecation to allow to
enable green threads if needed.

Closes-Bug: #1934937
Change-Id: Iee2e5a6f7d71acba70bbc857f0bd7d83e32a7b8c

commit_message:
Replace py35 zuul/osci with charm yoga jobs

Python3.5 will not be supported by the 22.01 release of the
OpenStack charms.

Also add psutil to test-requirements.txt for >= py39.

Kolla Ansible on demand, 'kayobe overcloud facts gather'. This can be
used to populate a fact cache.

commit_message:
Make setup module arguments configurable

Ansible facts can have a large impact on the performance of the Ansible
control host. This patch introduces some control over which facts are
gathered (kayobe_ansible_setup_gather_subset) and which facts are stored
(kayobe_ansible_setup_filter). By default we do not change the default
values of these arguments to the setup module. The flexibility of these
arguments is limited, but they do provide enough for a large performance
improvement in a typical moderate to large OpenStack cloud.

In particular, the large complex dict fact for each interface has a
large effect, and on an OpenStack controller or hypervisor there may be
many virtual interfaces. We can use the kayobe_ansible_setup_filter
variable to help:

    kayobe_ansible_setup_filter: 'ansible_[!qt]*'

This causes Ansible to collect but not store facts matching that
pattern, which includes the virtual interface facts. Currently we are
not referencing other facts matching the pattern within Kayobe.
Note that including the 'ansible_' prefix causes meta facts module_setup
and gather_subset to be filtered, but this seems to be the only way to
get a good match on the interface facts. To work around this, we use
ansible_facts rather than module_setup to detect whether facts exist in
the cache.

The exact improvement will vary, but has been reported to be as large as
18x on systems with many virtual interfaces.

This change also introduces a new command to gather facts for Kayobe &
Kolla Ansible on demand, 'kayobe overcloud facts gather'. This can be
used to populate a fact cache.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/794610
Story: 2007993
Task: 42586

Change-Id: I5ce3c734433e1682ee942867505468c57440e689
(cherry picked from commit 2648f48746fa01a5215e1fd9c79a0e7821414841)

commit_message:
Fix ServerGroup create

Nova api has a different signature from microversion
2.64 onwards[1].

Also adds support_status for 'rules' property missed
earlier in I8e77f54303298da00cbe719afccb449f10fe387c.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/novaclient/v2/server_groups.py#L103-L104

commit_message:
CI: enable DNF tests on CentOS Stream 8

These were inadvertently skipped following the move to CentOS Stream,
due to matching the distro name on CentOS Linux.

Backport to Victoria.

Change-Id: I478d6304c3f8d207bc7062a0909147a169003027
(cherry picked from commit 6a69a4f4db9f66978d9b593b0f510b1046fa969b)

commit_message:
Update the Nova CLI docoder document

There are several update in CLI decoder document.
- Change flavor set/unset to flavor set/unset --property
- Update the mapping with flavor-update, interface-attach, and interface-detach

Change-Id: I1db50188b3643d3fe28689dc73b3f63806defd29
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/21/812421/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

(Supported by API versions '2.55' - '2.latest') [hint: use '--os-compute-api- version' flag to show help message for proper version]interface-detach,server remove port,Detach a network interface from a server.

subject: Fix exception logging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-02 14:52:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-api-ref/commit/e35b4f9c958878bbb09e6c83a4e710886a57b899', 'message': 'Fix exception logging

When an exception happens while executing the method `_load_param_file`,
the exception logging `LOG.exception(exc_info=exc)` will generate an error.

A small snippet to reproduce the issue is the following code:
````
from sphinx.util import logging

LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__)

try:
    raise Exception("teste")
except Exception as exc:
    LOG.exception(exc_info=exc)

```

Which will generate the error:

```

Exception: teste

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/rafael/git/os-api-ref/os_api_ref/test-logging.py", line 8, in <module>
    LOG.exception(exc_info=exc)
TypeError: exception() missing 1 required positional argument: 'msg'

Process finished with exit code 1
```

With this fix, the exception loggin error is solved, and users get a meaningful message.

Change-Id: Ib3c3e93c283d86b9708c74e60c2ac5762dc2c222

commit_message:
Fix exception logging

When an exception happens while executing the method `_load_param_file`,
the exception logging `LOG.exception(exc_info=exc)` will generate an
error.

A small snippet to reproduce the issue is the following code:

  from sphinx.util import logging

  LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__)

  try:
      raise Exception("teste")
  except Exception as exc:
      LOG.exception(exc_info=exc)

Which will generate the error:

  Exception: teste

  During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "/home/rafael/git/os-api-ref/os_api_ref/test-logging.py", line 8, in <module>
      LOG.exception(exc_info=exc)
  TypeError: exception() missing 1 required positional argument: 'msg'

  Process finished with exit code 1

With this fix, the exception logging error is solved, and users get a
meaningful message.

Change-Id: Ib3c3e93c283d86b9708c74e60c2ac5762dc2c222
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-api-ref refs/changes/16/799216/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.exception(exc_info=exc, msg="Error while opening file [%s]." % fpath)

commit_message:
Fix branch problem in build.lock file

* Also add cffi pin for py35 for charm-tools build support.
* This charm is broken at this state (as a 21.10 candidate), but will be
  fixed via a cherry pick of I4e63e64612554d74ffaca5c4e07b90f7ceb88d59
  which resolves the hacluster 'common.py' import and also restarting
  services after config-changed.

This is https://github.com/juju/charm-tools/issues/604.

Change-Id: I00f4bc8251d9dc5e8f082539dfff96b972e115d2

formatting and remove an unnecessary MANIFEST.in file (pbr doesn't need
these)

commit_message:
Drop support for Sphinx < 4.x

Our tests are broken due to changes introduced by Sphinx 4.0 and thus
require some adaptation. Rather than introduce more logic into tests to
handle older versions, simply drop support for older versions of Sphinx.

Change-Id: I2e8ff5cc2e6b4703d7f767fc95b6766d727d8577
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update Manila deploy steps for Wallaby

Manila has changed from using subfolders to subvolumes.
We need a bit of a tidy up to prevent deploy errors.
This change also adds the ability to specify the ceph FS
Manila uses instead of relying on the default "first found".

Closes-Bug: #1938285
Closes-Bug: #1935784
Change-Id: I1d0d34919fbbe74a4022cd496bf84b8b764b5e0f
(cherry picked from commit 8d5dde3723c75958b7583d30b525667e99ec2496)

commit_message:
Remove PrettyTable version limit

PrettyTable is alive now. The newer release has been released
from Oct 2020.

It's good to keep the library newer. This patch removed the
version limitation.

Change-Id: I2dac2546c8578f54db7c4115fb6ef5614d893ae2

commit_message:
Fix graphs to use dns name

dns_name appears to be a more reliable key for the graphs as
instance may return the IP or the hostname which breaks the
host match

Change-Id: Ie2b890a1eddd62aeb28d4e0261b6626976bb9c14

commit_message:
infra: switch CI to build binary/source/infra at once

CI builds have to build binary/source/infra at same machine to make sure
they are built properly.

Change-Id: Id0f9dacd008f2da531eebeb84680b469f6c3343e

commit_message:
Introduce 'kolla_infra_install_type' variable

For now it is set to 'kolla_install_type' but this will change.

Implements: blueprint infra-images

Change-Id: I214ff571f3419b3bcbe39418b809d420e4191237

commit_message:
Add 'infra' install type.

For situation when someone wants to build only infrastructure images.

"--infra" argument will build them for binary/source install_type (True
by default to keep compatibility).

Change-Id: I72abad67d3ae9fadc754744602e6c02afaada730

commit_message:
Add xena bundles

- add non-voting focal-xena bundle
- add non-voting impish-xena bundle
- rebuild to pick up charm-helpers changes
- update tox/pip.sh to ensure setuptools<50.0.0
- sync *requirements.txt in order to pin cffi

Change-Id: Ic3c4a6d382d734dab5821c35eda4ba2d8e77ce53
Co-authored-by: Aurelien Lourot <aurelien.lourot@canonical.com>

added_lines: # NOTES: # * We avoid the new dependency resolver by pinning pip < 20.3, see # https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/9187 # * Pinning dependencies requires tox >= 3.2.0, see # https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-requires # * It is also necessary to pin virtualenv as a newer virtualenv would still # lead to fetching the latest pip in the func* tox targets, see # https://stackoverflow.com/a/38133283 requires = pip < 20.3 virtualenv < 20.0 setuptools<50.0.0 # NOTE: https://wiki.canonical.com/engineering/OpenStack/InstallLatestToxOnOsci minversion = 3.18.0 {toxinidir}/pip.sh install {opts} {packages}deps = flake8==3.9.2 charm-tools==2.8.3

commit_message:
openstack-base: drop anyjson

It is required only in Tacker and fails to be installed.

And even Tacker does not use it...

commit_message:
docs: Add parameters table to devices APIs

Since we were introduced microversion in Ussuri [1], that if we need to
add a microversion for an API we should mark it as
min_version and/or max_version, so we should maintain these parameters
with a list in the docs, it will be clearer and friendly for users.

[1]https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cyborg-specs/specs/ussuri/implemented/api-microversion.html

Co-Authored-By: Brin Zhang <zhangbailin@inspur.com>

Closes-Bug: #1927057
Change-Id: I25b3de9b37e1b8769f8f34783b62bb56d176c931

subject: Change github.com to opendev.org so git-review works
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-20 13:27:34.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/development_saio.rst', 'doc/source/first_contribution_swift.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/2d622770b5a96989d47fc521e163b0670eb6584b', 'message': "Change github.com to opendev.org so git-review works

Unfortunately, git-review ignores .gitreview when repository
was cloned from an https: schema URL, when looking for the
commit-msg hook. It only obeys .gitreview when the repositiory
was cloned from a git: schema, basically ssh. It seems easier
to change our documentation than to try to get git-review
changed. Also, there's an installed base of old git-review.
So, this fix changes a few lingering github.com references
in places where the repository may be later used to contribute.

Closes-Bug: #1947862
Change-Id: I41ad14a08ab73f275cbde3abcf3938c0e5f3698f
"}]
commit_message:
Change github.com to opendev.org so git-review works

Unfortunately, git-review ignores .gitreview when repository
was cloned from an https: schema URL, when looking for the
commit-msg hook. It only obeys .gitreview when the repositiory
was cloned from a git: schema, basically ssh. It seems easier
to change our documentation than to try to get git-review
changed. Also, there's an installed base of old git-review.
So, this fix changes a few lingering github.com references
in places where the repository may be later used to contribute.

Closes-Bug: #1947862
Change-Id: I41ad14a08ab73f275cbde3abcf3938c0e5f3698f

commit_message:
Remove useless anyjson lib

Package `anyjson` is not required from anywhere. In additoin, it cause a
dependency error while pip installation in devstack. So, remove the
library.

Signed-off-by: Yasufumi Ogawa <yasufum.o@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I0760c145bc755a1f39c2e5dd864c3371edb08f17

commit_message:
Modified container exclude list with distros

Why?
- Release has different containers exclude list
- We are using same list for different distros
- To track multiple release and multiple distros

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/813619 adds
the container exclude list with distros.

Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic7f5910569abe7d0a38e3314baaa8cc22d991263

commit_message:
Fix the help output for tripleo-mount-image

This change does the following to fix the help output of
tripleo-mount-image and tripleo-unmount-image
- defer set -x until actual inside the actual mount/unmount functions
- add --help to the getopt long arguments so it actually works
- print help and exit if mandatory arguments -a, -m are missing

Blueprint: whole-disk-default
Change-Id: I6d16fd95c098559af9ec4e38b336819fc1663eef

commit_message:
Flatten yaql list expressions

In python yaql 2, the expressions are returning a nested list but we
need a list of dictionaries in order to use map_merge.  This change adds
flatten so it returns [] instead of [[]] when nothing is available.

Change-Id: Iba0262fbc2af0903f02c8c28c7ba2b1d935abe7f

commit_message:
Workaround broken centos 7 pip

As described inline, pip can't talk to LetsEncrypt secured sites like
opendev.org.  Override pip to use the system certificates to work
around this.

I don't know if venv_pip_upgrade_noconf is still valid ... but we need
to obey the pip.conf.  Restrict it to Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I61d4787a87c667e6daf445918ba415ec83c30953
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/06/814506/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Since https://letsencrypt.org/docs/dst-root-ca-x3-expiration-september-2021/ # centos7 virtualenv uses a pip that vendors a cacert.pem that fails to talk to # https:// sites like opendev.org. Even upgrading pip doesn't help, because the # latest python2 version still has issues with openssl 1.0.2 on centos7; see # https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2015326 # This should match on these systems and override pip to use the system # certificates if [ -f /etc/pki/tls/certs/ca-bundle.crt ]; then /opt/ansible-runtime/bin/pip config set global.cert \ /etc/pki/tls/certs/ca-bundle.crt fi

subject: Fix trust token has a 403 error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-28 09:39:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara/commit/c5f61d4e99e6c82ef48967b03b42db12a36ec827', 'message': "Fix trust token has a 403 error

Sahara uses heat`s trust token to build other resource
component session client without auth_ref. This is not
allowed in keystone token method. The original is
described in this way : 'Do not allow tokens used for
delegation to create another token, or perform any
changes of state in Keystone.To do so is to invite
elevation of privilege attacks'.

The solution to the problem:
When building other components client, add auth_ref.

Change-Id: Ie2bbe89217312991360ff60c1e1df91305ec4140
Related-Bug: #1717918
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-05 15:21:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara/commit/ab728673965dfa0fa95e3899ef46b89156f8a8e4', 'message': "Fix trust token has a 403 error

component session client without auth_ref. This is not
allowed in keystone token method. The original is
described in this way : 'Do not allow tokens used for
delegation to create another token, or perform any
changes of state in Keystone.To do so is to invite
elevation of privilege attacks'.

The solution to the problem:
When building other components client, add auth_ref.

Change-Id: Ie2bbe89217312991360ff60c1e1df91305ec4140
Related-Bug: #1717918
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2018-02-05 16:57:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara/commit/304911792a533b80e50cfd43d039287ff5c530fa', 'message': "Fix trust token has a 403 error

Sahara uses heat`s trust token to build other resource
component session client without auth_ref. This is not
allowed in keystone token method. The original is
described in this way : 'Do not allow tokens used for
delegation to create another token, or perform any
changes of state in Keystone.To do so is to invite
elevation of privilege attacks'.

commit_message:
Fix trust token has a 403 error

Sahara uses heat`s trust token to build other resource
component session client without auth_ref. This is not
allowed in keystone token method. The original is
described in this way : 'Do not allow tokens used for
delegation to create another token, or perform any
changes of state in Keystone.To do so is to invite
elevation of privilege attacks'.

The solution to the problem:
When building other components client, add auth_ref.

Change-Id: Ie2bbe89217312991360ff60c1e1df91305ec4140
Related-Bug: #1717918
