commit_message:
Add RecordSet resource and zone list

This commit introduces a new io.murano.resources.RecordSet resource
type. When coupled with a commit to murano-dashboard, it allows
users to be able to select an available zone from a UI list and
have it passed to this RecordSet resource for provising a Designate
DNS record.

Change-Id: I0574950603ae9fa2289f9346cc8b2349e00cd6f8

commit_message:
Fix overcloud admin authorize

overcloud admin authorize can no longer be used with
ephemeral Heat. This change allows us to use an existing
inventory file. It also allows for the use to provide a
group from the Inventory rather than running against all
of the nodes in the inventory.

Change-Id: I07902a84e16af94b250ecb621017cd5b7de40a9c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/89/814289/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from ansible.parsing.dataloader import DataLoader from ansible.inventory.manager import InventoryManager def parse_ansible_inventory(inventory_file: str, group='all') -> list: """ Retrieve a list of hosts from a defined ansible inventory file. If no hosts are found, an empty list will be returned :param inventory: Ansible inventory file :param group: The group to return hosts from, default will be 'all' """ inventory = InventoryManager(loader = DataLoader(), sources=[inventory_file]) return(inventory.get_hosts(pattern=group))

commit_message:
Elevating priviledges for the check_package_update

Priviledges for the check_package_update use in the check_latest_packages_version
role are now elevated to prevent permissions issues on satellite registered hosts.

Resolves: rhbz#2005986

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2acbebab3c51da957a81bf846b6409166dd15fcb

subject: Make setup module arguments configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-09-30 07:41:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/commit/319b416d647be855d4e8a8f500f48bcda83152d4', 'message': "Make setup module arguments configurable

Ansible facts can have a large impact on the performance of the Ansible
control host. This patch introduces some control over which facts are
gathered (kayobe_ansible_setup_gather_subset) and which facts are stored
(kayobe_ansible_setup_filter). By default we do not change the default
values of these arguments to the setup module. The flexibility of these
arguments is limited, but they do provide enough for a large performance
improvement in a typical moderate to large OpenStack cloud.

In particular, the large complex dict fact for each interface has a
large effect, and on an OpenStack controller or hypervisor there may be
many virtual interfaces. We can use the kayobe_ansible_setup_filter
variable to help:

    kayobe_ansible_setup_filter: 'ansible_[!qt]*'

This causes Ansible to collect but not store facts matching that
pattern, which includes the virtual interface facts. Currently we are
not referencing other facts matching the pattern within Kayobe.
Note that including the 'ansible_' prefix causes meta facts module_setup
and gather_subset to be filtered, but this seems to be the only way to
get a good match on the interface facts. To work around this, we use
ansible_facts rather than module_setup to detect whether facts exist in
the cache.

The exact improvement will vary, but has been reported to be as large as
18x on systems with many virtual interfaces.

This change also introduces a new command to gather facts for Kayobe &
Kolla Ansible on demand, 'kayobe overcloud facts gather'. This can be
used to populate a fact cache.

commit_message:
Make setup module arguments configurable

Ansible facts can have a large impact on the performance of the Ansible
control host. This patch introduces some control over which facts are
gathered (kayobe_ansible_setup_gather_subset) and which facts are stored
(kayobe_ansible_setup_filter). By default we do not change the default
values of these arguments to the setup module. The flexibility of these
arguments is limited, but they do provide enough for a large performance
improvement in a typical moderate to large OpenStack cloud.

In particular, the large complex dict fact for each interface has a
large effect, and on an OpenStack controller or hypervisor there may be
many virtual interfaces. We can use the kayobe_ansible_setup_filter
variable to help:

    kayobe_ansible_setup_filter: 'ansible_[!qt]*'

This causes Ansible to collect but not store facts matching that
pattern, which includes the virtual interface facts. Currently we are
not referencing other facts matching the pattern within Kayobe.
Note that including the 'ansible_' prefix causes meta facts module_setup
and gather_subset to be filtered, but this seems to be the only way to
get a good match on the interface facts. To work around this, we use
ansible_facts rather than module_setup to detect whether facts exist in
the cache.

The exact improvement will vary, but has been reported to be as large as
18x on systems with many virtual interfaces.

This change also introduces a new command to gather facts for Kayobe &
Kolla Ansible on demand, 'kayobe overcloud facts gather'. This can be
used to populate a fact cache.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/794610
Story: 2007993
Task: 42586

Change-Id: I5ce3c734433e1682ee942867505468c57440e689
(cherry picked from commit 2648f48746fa01a5215e1fd9c79a0e7821414841)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/83/811783/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: filter: "{{ kayobe_ansible_setup_filter }}" gather_subset: "{{ kayobe_ansible_setup_gather_subset }}" when: not ansible_facts filter: "{{ kayobe_ansible_setup_filter }}" gather_subset: "{{ kayobe_ansible_setup_gather_subset }}"

commit_message:
21.10 - Stable cut of charms for testing period

* use stable/21.10 libraries

commit_message:
DPDK required libdpdk-dev package to bind port

Without this package ovs failed to bind dpdk interface to
ovs provider bridge. This is ubuntu where they split
dependencies libs/drivers to different package.

Example: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/dpdk/pmds-20.0/librte_pmd_ixgbe.so
file required by Intel NIC which is part of that package.

Change-Id: Ia0cacbbffca363f79d4d43edbc1eb140bfea5e04

commit_message:
Remove --skip-nodes-and-networks

The depens-on removes the usage of --skip-nodes-and-networks,
instead the existing --baremtal-deployment option is used to
provide the capability to enable/disable "all-in-one" network+
node provisioning with overcloud deploy command.

Depends-On: Idaab1f28c4d645279eff0c01b24435bf8571299b
Change-Id: I97b8c8762524efbfc12533bbd557a689cff53273

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-18 12:29:12.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/test_maintenance.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/ovn_l3/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/maintenance.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/e814e93e8ed92683c5b46083fe479cf384b81ed5', 'message': '[OVN] Tune OVN routers to reduce the mem footprint for ML2/OVN

In order to avoid having a MAC_Binding table explosion and helping
lowering the memory footprint when using ML2/OVN this patch is setting
two options to the OVN routers:

* always_learn_from_arp_request: By setting this to False we
  avoid learning from ARP replies observed in the network. Only the
  ARP requests sent by OVN will generate a MAC_Binding entry in the
  OVSDB database. For larger broadcasts domains this avoids having a
  MAC_Binding table explosion, reduce the DB size and memory footprint
  of ML2/OVN.

* dynamic_neigh_routers: By setting this to True we avoid
  pre-populating flows for router to router communication, reduding
  the number of flows, DB size and memory footprint of ML2/OVN.

For more information on these option for core OVN please refer to:
https://www.ovn.org/support/dist-docs/ovn-nb.5.html

This patch also includes a new maintenance task to include these options
to existing routers in the system.

Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit a278c5ba789c014ec777a75fc9538179d6707202)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Tune OVN routers to reduce the mem footprint for ML2/OVN

In order to avoid having a MAC_Binding table explosion and helping
lowering the memory footprint when using ML2/OVN this patch is setting
two options to the OVN routers:

* always_learn_from_arp_request: By setting this to False we
  avoid learning from ARP replies observed in the network. Only the
  ARP requests sent by OVN will generate a MAC_Binding entry in the
  OVSDB database. For larger broadcasts domains this avoids having a
  MAC_Binding table explosion, reduce the DB size and memory footprint
  of ML2/OVN.

* dynamic_neigh_routers: By setting this to True we avoid
  pre-populating flows for router to router communication, reduding
  the number of flows, DB size and memory footprint of ML2/OVN.

For more information on these option for core OVN please refer to:
https://www.ovn.org/support/dist-docs/ovn-nb.5.html

This patch also includes a new maintenance task to include these options
to existing routers in the system.

Related-Bug: #1946318
Change-Id: I056acdec9b6ee2341d2bc4f7bd9a678f3bf91972
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit a278c5ba789c014ec777a75fc9538179d6707202)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/19/814419/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import copy # TODO(lucasagomes): Remove this in the Z cycle # A static spacing value is used here, but this method will only run # once per lock due to the use of periodics.NeverAgain(). @periodics.periodic(spacing=600, run_immediately=True) def check_router_mac_binding_options(self): if not self.has_lock: return cmds = [] for router in self._nb_idl.lr_list().execute(check_error=True): if (router.options.get('always_learn_from_arp_request') and router.options.get('dynamic_neigh_routers')): continue opts = copy.deepcopy(router.options) opts.update({'always_learn_from_arp_request': 'false', 'dynamic_neigh_routers': 'true'}) cmds.append(self._nb_idl.update_lrouter(router.name, options=opts)) if cmds: with self._nb_idl.transaction(check_error=True) as txn: for cmd in cmds: txn.add(cmd) raise periodics.NeverAgain()

commit_message:
Add release notes for ``prefer-chassis-as-gw`` option

Related-Bug: #1946456
Change-Id: I0c3a369e34bda7e3a2af23145383be60e1cac7de
Co-authored-by: Aurelien Lourot <aurelien.lourot@canonical.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-guide refs/changes/19/814719/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OVN chassis charms: New option to influence scheduling of gateways ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The ovn-chassis and ovn-dedicated-chassis charms has a new configuration option: ``prefer-chassis-as-gw``. For a deployment with multiple named OVN chassis applications, this option allows control of which application should have its units preferred when scheduling gateways. It defaults to 'false' which will make the Cloud Management System (CMS) schedule gateways to any chassis with appropriate bridge mappings configured. OVN chassis charms: Change of behavior for gateway chassis scheduling ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ To improve the control of gateway chassis scheduling for the cloud operator, a new configuration option was introduced as detailed in `OVN chassis charms: New option to influence scheduling of gateways`_. A side effect of this change is that the CMS may reschedule gateway chassis for its routers on charm upgrade. With OVN routers are HA by default, so the impact should be minimal. OVN and SR-IOV: servicing external DHCP and metadata requests ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ When instances are deployed with SR-IOV networking in an OVN deployment a change of configuration may be required to retain servicing of DHCP and metadata requests. If your deployment has SR-IOV instances, make sure that at least one of the OVN chassis named applications has the ``prefer-chassis-as-gw`` configuration option set to 'true'. The root of the issue is in how Neutron handles scheduling of gateway chassis for L3 routers and external services differently, and is tracked in bug `LP #1946456`_... _LP #1946456: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1946456

commit_message:
Map system_scope in creds dictionary

An earlier patch[1] added a mapping for context 'system_scope'
to 'system' when enforce was called with a RequestContext
object. However, enforce can also be called with a creds dictionary
that may contain the context 'system_scope' element. When this
occured, 'system_scope' was not mapped to 'system' and the enforce
would fail with an InvalidScope exception.
This patch moves the 'system_scope' mapping from only occuring
with RequestContext objects to also map it when a creds dictonary
is passed to enforce.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.policy/+/578995

Change-Id: I83a22c3f825bad0c88018118f8630a20a445965e
(cherry picked from commit 9774108cf91408e9cb825b317f48a3a3f856e161)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy refs/changes/07/811507/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Enable new SELinux boolean for vTPM support

In order to get a working vTPM support in containers, we need to enable
a new SELinux boolean provided by openstack-selinux[1]

This patch affects only nova-modular-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml for
master and future releases.

[1] https://github.com/redhat-openstack/openstack-selinux/pull/80

Change-Id: I0db66dd124e3e02fd2fe3c729dc0fb3eeafec7a0
Closes-Bug: #1902468
Resolves: rhbz#2007314

commit_message:
Fix OVN migration workload creation order

Currently workload VMs start before subnet is connected to router.
When DVR is enabled this causes sometimes that one of the VMs is not
able to get metadata.

Closes bug: #1947547

Change-Id: Ifd686d7ff452abd1226fbbc97f499e05102e4596

commit_message:
UC/Standalone - Set ip_version in DeployedServerPortMap

Set ip_version property in the subnets section in DeployedServerPortMap
set up in the environment for Undercloud and Standalone deployments.

This will ensure that the NetIpVersionMapValue is populated properly,
and puppet parameters like 'rabbit_ipv6' will be correctly populated
for IPv6 undercloud deployment.

Closes-Bug: #1947177
Change-Id: I60c8d845b0b0035364e19ac6aa8cad0bc9e614d3

subject: Use ansible_user_dir path in artg_repos_dir
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-20 05:28:43.000000000', 'files': ['toci-quickstart/config/testenv/multinode.yml', 'toci-quickstart/config/testenv/ovb.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/commit/994175ccdad66b3a4bd90a3637d7aa39fb2c7705', 'message': 'Use ansible_user_dir path in artg_repos_dir

Currently artg_repos_dir path points to
/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack.

On EL9, we have /home/zuul and /home/zuul-worker dir
exists and default user is zuul-worker.

artg_repos_dir is looking for clonned repos in /home/zuul path but repos
are clonned in /home/zuul-worker, leading to failure.

More info about issue is here:
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/testproject/+/35229/23#message-265a04d5718b866a2ecf508af68df2e4159af457

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iea958e037ab63896def82608bc2ce2ba0d30948c
'}]
commit_message:
Use ansible_user_dir path in artg_repos_dir

Currently artg_repos_dir path points to
/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack.

On EL9, we have /home/zuul and /home/zuul-worker dir
exists and default user is zuul-worker.

artg_repos_dir is looking for clonned repos in /home/zuul path but repos
are clonned in /home/zuul-worker, leading to failure.

More info about issue is here:
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/testproject/+/35229/23#message-265a04d5718b866a2ecf508af68df2e4159af457

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iea958e037ab63896def82608bc2ce2ba0d30948c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/02/814702/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: artg_repos_dir: "{{ ansible_user_dir }}/src/opendev.org/openstack"

subject: Do not set rabbitmq SSL CA certs when InternalTLSCAFile is ''
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-19 19:42:55.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-container-puppet.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/f8e7bf2bba79120fcabcb60d889333df06a3bc8a', 'message': 'Do not set rabbitmq SSL CA certs when InternalTLSCAFile is ''

The undercloud installation sets InternalTLSCAFile to '' when
undercloud_service_certificate is set (done via
I5d7f35194f98b2d5c06a417cac75d52ff646def0 "undercloud: Disable CA path
if user-provided cert is used"). In this case we end up setting
rabbitmq::{ssl_cacert,ssl_management_cacert} to '' which then breaks
puppet-rabbitmq because it verifies that they are absolute paths.

Let's just skip passing them when InternalTLSCAFile is set to
empty.

Depends-On: I4e9801ba3ced734e5aa3fa22df522fab0e84761a
Closes-Bug: #1947776
Change-Id: I16f0fd04e1ae941d09d567eadaeb5bda959099fc
'}]
commit_message:
Do not set rabbitmq SSL CA certs when InternalTLSCAFile is ''

The undercloud installation sets InternalTLSCAFile to '' when
undercloud_service_certificate is set (done via
I5d7f35194f98b2d5c06a417cac75d52ff646def0 "undercloud: Disable CA path
if user-provided cert is used"). In this case we end up setting
rabbitmq::{ssl_cacert,ssl_management_cacert} to '' which then breaks
puppet-rabbitmq because it verifies that they are absolute paths.

Let's just skip passing them when InternalTLSCAFile is set to
empty.

Depends-On: I4e9801ba3ced734e5aa3fa22df522fab0e84761a
Closes-Bug: #1947776
Change-Id: I16f0fd04e1ae941d09d567eadaeb5bda959099fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/39/814639/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: rabbitmq_cacert_set: not: {equals: [{get_param: InternalTLSCAFile}, '']} # Only set CAs then InternalTLSCAFile is not '' - if: - rabbitmq_cacert_set - rabbitmq::ssl_cacert: {get_param: InternalTLSCAFile} rabbitmq::ssl_management_cacert: {get_param: InternalTLSCAFile}

subject: Make sure that rabbitmq_cacert has 'undef' as a default.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-19 19:42:46.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/rabbitmq.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/a9e0ec90f493880a8783b1654c82a4578df2a458', 'message': "Make sure that rabbitmq_cacert has 'undef' as a default.

This is done so that the deployment does not fail if we do not pass any
rabbitmq:ssl_cacert key at all. This is needed on SSL (non TLS-E)
undercloud installations, see LP and related tht patch.

Change-Id: I4e9801ba3ced734e5aa3fa22df522fab0e84761a
Related-Bug: #1947776
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure that rabbitmq_cacert has 'undef' as a default.

This is done so that the deployment does not fail if we do not pass any
rabbitmq:ssl_cacert key at all. This is needed on SSL (non TLS-E)
undercloud installations, see LP and related tht patch.

Change-Id: I4e9801ba3ced734e5aa3fa22df522fab0e84761a
Related-Bug: #1947776
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/38/814638/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Defaults to hiera('rabbitmq::ssl_cacert', undef) $rabbitmq_cacert = hiera('rabbitmq::ssl_cacert', undef),

Include validation.yml playbook in multinode.yml playbook

Changes tags of the validation.yml playbook to:

 - overcloud-deploy

Changes name of the play to be more descriptive.

commit_message:
multipath/iscsi: iSCSI connections are not reinitiated after reboot

After compute host reboot, in an iSCSI/multipath environment, some
of the connections to the iSCSI portal are not reinitiated and missing
iSCSI devices are observed. This patchset introduced retries for this
particular scenario.

Closes-Bug: #1944474
Change-Id: I60ee7421f7b792e8324286908a9fdd8fb53e433e
(cherry picked from commit 8832c5389964973084cd0f80a2d8f7f24255ea3f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/91/813091/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | `Bug #1944474 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/os-brick/+bug/1944474>`_: Fixed missing retries to reinitiate iSCSI connections with high concurrency of connections and with multipath enabled.

commit_message:
Enable running on Debian Bullseye

Some adaption in database handling is all that is missing. Also add a
platform job that tests this.

Co-Authored-By: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I6dd3e48444dd415d84df5e7f5c74540847cdd6db

commit_message:
Update centos element for 9-stream

This adds 9-stream support to the centos element.

See https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:cs9 for related patches.

Change-Id: Ib80fbd21edb77c25764eff2c0d66e55bde7a90af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/19/806819/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ "${DIB_RELEASE}" = 9 ]]; then dib_release_path=9-stream else dib_release_path=${DIB_RELEASE} fi BASE_IMAGE_FILE=${BASE_IMAGE_FILE:-$(curl -s https://cloud.centos.org/centos/${dib_release_path}/${ARCH}/images/ | grep -o "CentOS-.[^>]*${DIB_FLAVOR}-.[^>]*.qcow2" | sort -r | head -1)}

commit_message:
Update Manila deploy steps for Wallaby

Manila has changed from using subfolders to subvolumes.
We need a bit of a tidy up to prevent deploy errors.
This change also adds the ability to specify the ceph FS
Manila uses instead of relying on the default "first found".

Closes-Bug: #1938285
Closes-Bug: #1935784
Change-Id: I1d0d34919fbbe74a4022cd496bf84b8b764b5e0f
(cherry picked from commit 8d5dde3723c75958b7583d30b525667e99ec2496)

added_lines: from unittest.mock import call self.servers_mock = self.app.client_manager.compute.servers self.servers_mock.reset_mock() class TestHypervisorServersSet(TestHypervisor): def setUp(self): super(TestHypervisorServersSet, self).setUp() self.hypervisors = compute_fakes.FakeHypervisor.create_hypervisors() self.hypervisors_mock.list.return_value = self.hypervisors self.first_hypervisor_attrs = { 'api_version': api_versions.APIVersion('2.26'), 'host': self.hypervisors[0].hypervisor_hostname } self.second_hypervisor_attrs = { 'api_version': api_versions.APIVersion('2.26'), 'host': self.hypervisors[1].hypervisor_hostname } self.methods = { 'update': None, 'add_tag': None, 'set_meta': None, } self.first_hypervisor_fake_servers = compute_fakes.FakeServer.create_servers( attrs=self.first_hypervisor_attrs, methods=self.methods, count=3) self.second_hypervisor_fake_servers = compute_fakes.FakeServer.create_servers( attrs=self.second_hypervisor_attrs, methods=self.methods, count=2) self.fake_servers = self.first_hypervisor_fake_servers +\ self.second_hypervisor_fake_servers self.servers_mock.list.return_value = self.first_hypervisor_fake_servers self.cmd = hypervisor.SetHypervisorServers(self.app, None) def test_hypervisor_servers_change_description(self): self.app.client_manager.compute.api_version = \ api_versions.APIVersion('2.26') test_new_description = 'this is test description.' arg_list = [ '--description', test_new_description, self.hypervisors[0].hypervisor_hostname ] verify_list = [ ('description', test_new_description), ('hypervisor', self.hypervisors[0].hypervisor_hostname) ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arg_list, verify_list) result = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.fake_servers[0].update.assert_called_once_with(description=test_new_description) self.fake_servers[1].update.assert_called_once_with(description=test_new_description) self.fake_servers[2].update.assert_called_once_with(description=test_new_description) self.fake_servers[3].update.assert_not_called() self.fake_servers[4].update.assert_not_called() self.assertIsNone(result) def test_hypervisor_servers_add_tag(self): self.app.client_manager.compute.api_version = \ api_versions.APIVersion('2.26') tags = ['tag1', 'tag2'] arg_list = [ '--tag', tags[0], '--tag', tags[1], self.hypervisors[0].hypervisor_hostname ] verify_list = [ ('tags', tags), ('hypervisor', self.hypervisors[0].hypervisor_hostname) ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arg_list, verify_list) result = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.fake_servers[0].add_tag.assert_has_calls([call('tag1'), call('tag2')]) self.fake_servers[1].add_tag.assert_has_calls([call('tag1'), call('tag2')]) self.fake_servers[2].add_tag.assert_has_calls([call('tag1'), call('tag2')]) self.fake_servers[3].add_tag.assert_not_called() self.fake_servers[4].add_tag.assert_not_called() self.assertIsNone(result) def test_hypervisor_servers_property(self): self.app.client_manager.compute.api_version = \ api_versions.APIVersion('2.26') arg_list = [ '--property', 'test_key1=test_value1', '--property', 'test_key2=test_value2', self.hypervisors[0].hypervisor_hostname ] verify_list = [ ('properties', {'test_key1': 'test_value1' , 'test_key2': 'test_value2'}), ('hypervisor', self.hypervisors[0].hypervisor_hostname) ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arg_list, verify_list) result = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.fake_servers[0].set_meta.assert_called_once_with(parsed_args.properties) self.fake_servers[1].set_meta.assert_called_once_with(parsed_args.properties) self.fake_servers[2].set_meta.assert_called_once_with(parsed_args.properties) self.fake_servers[4].set_meta.assert_not_called() self.fake_servers[4].set_meta.assert_not_called() self.assertIsNone(result)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-20 11:35:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3bf894a6e0a7259632207ea3a63bb3e3190c2011', 'message': 'Report gpu devices that only configured

If there are two gpu devices virtualized on the env, and config one enabled_vgpu_types and device_addresses, Nova will report these two gpu devices to Placement. we should only report the configured device_addresses to Placement.

Related-Bug: #1943934
Change-Id: I6b590fc4954c1c39d6cf5130c51ca10edd8fa130
'}]
commit_message:
Report gpu devices that only configured

If there are two gpu devices virtualized on the env, and config one enabled_vgpu_types and device_addresses, Nova will report these two gpu devices to Placement. we should only report the configured device_addresses to Placement.

Related-Bug: #1943934
Change-Id: I6b590fc4954c1c39d6cf5130c51ca10edd8fa130

commit_message:
Remove cyclic import

roles.py imports utils.py and utils.py is importing roles.py.
This change removes that cycle by moving the required function
to utils.py and removing the import of roles in utils.

Change-Id: I03c67636cb43332c79cbed77399af09c421bb4df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/94/814394/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Added var file for EL9

We cannot merge the redhat-7 and redhat-8 var file in a single
file as package names are different and if we include more
conditionals, it makes the files messy.

So adding a seperate var file for EL9.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2b5004bcf57b05fee16e10154355933cfeae3d44

commit_message:
Use Ubuntu minimal image as advanced guest image

Ubuntu minimal is smaller than regular cloud image.
It should works fine with less memory and boot faster than in
the gates.

Change-Id: Ie281698ecef05fd7ddf831eabd0e0121ac477709

commit_message:
Allow qemu-img to write out zeros to disk

Allow the sparse_size for qemu-img to be specified in order
instruct it to write out all zeros(when set to 0). Doing this
will cause it not to zero out the entire block device
which can be very costly on a slow HDD.

Story: 2009227
Task: 43315
Change-Id: I480352be378020a6063fe247238b18713031f6b0

commit_message:
Need to add netstat logging in the background

This patch helps us to log netstat while tempest is running.
Signed-off by: Soniya Vyas<svyas@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I79835bd478d3e149aeaed8e5784b1c4eb00baadb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/90/813590/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: start netstat logging in the backgrounbd shell: | set -e nohup /usr/bin/netstat -lnp -c 60 &> /var/log/netstat_audit.log & echo $! >/tmp/netstat.pid async: 0 poll: 0 become: true

commit_message:
Report pkt processing capacity on Neutron agent RP

Report the packet processing capacity on the Neutron agent resource
provider to Placement as the new 'NET_PACKET_RATE_KILOPACKET_PER_SEC'
or 'NET_PACKET_RATE_[E|I]GR_KILOPACKET_PER_SEC' resource inventory.
This is similar to how the bandwidth resource is reported today.

Partial-Bug: #1922237
See-Also: https://review.opendev.org/785236
Change-Id: I8deefbeed4b4b51dd20062df62c8891fee3ebf9d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/46/800446/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib import constants as n_const # RP_PP_WITHOUT_DIRECTION and RP_PP_WITH_DIRECTION are mutually # exclusive options. Use the one that was provided or fallback to # an empty dict. rp_pkt_processing=( configurations[n_const.RP_PP_WITHOUT_DIRECTION] if configurations.get(n_const.RP_PP_WITHOUT_DIRECTION) else configurations.get(n_const.RP_PP_WITH_DIRECTION, {})), rp_pkt_processing_inventory_defaults=configurations.get( n_const.RP_PP_INVENTORY_DEFAULTS, {}),

subject: Report CUSTOM_VNIC_TYPE_ traits on Neutron agent RP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-12 10:09:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/077978335ba715365b055d1ffeec42650bcaf67c', 'message': "Report CUSTOM_VNIC_TYPE_ traits on OVS agent RP

Now that the OVS agent RP is going to have its own resource inventory,
the Neutron server needs to report the same 'CUSTOM_VNIC_TYPE_' traits
on the OVS agent RP as reported on the bridge RPs. These are the vnic
types this agent configured to support.

See-Also: https://review.opendev.org/785236
Change-Id: I8ae6d2714474d0ca32441d07d7b4dc84571d14a6

commit_message:
Report CUSTOM_VNIC_TYPE_ traits on Neutron agent RP

Create a resource inventory on Neutron agent RP and report the same
'CUSTOM_VNIC_TYPE_' traits on it, as the ones reported on the bridge
RPs. These are the vnic types this agent configured to support.

Partial-Bug: #1922237
See-Also: https://review.opendev.org/785236
Change-Id: I8ae6d2714474d0ca32441d07d7b4dc84571d14a6

commit_message:
CI: enable DNF tests on CentOS Stream 8

These were inadvertently skipped following the move to CentOS Stream,
due to matching the distro name on CentOS Linux.

Backport to Victoria.

subject: [RFC] Alter wording on dvr_snat usage on computes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-20 10:13:07.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/admin/deploy-ovs-ha-dvr.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/3a86e3d0bf65f8a553cd7eac41411eb5bbd2ca84', 'message': '[RFC] Alter wording on dvr_snat usage on computes

There was a recent change in the guide around the use of
`agent_mode = dvr_snat` on compute nodes:

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/801503/2/doc/source/admin/deploy-ovs-ha-dvr.rst#112

At the same time, both the old and new description contains this:
https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/configuration/l3-agent.html#DEFAULT.agent_mode
"This mode must be used for an L3 agent running on a centralized node
(or in single-host deployments, e.g. devstack)"

And, also, Devstack uses dvr_snat for single-node deployments:
https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/ee629cc77554b18cfca77506d1531f99523d2a58/lib/neutron#L44-L49

This new messaging seems to be confusing: if agent_mode = dvr_snat can
work on single-node deployments like DevStack, it may work on compute
nodes in a multi-node deployment as well, since a single-node deployment
is a network node + compute node + control node.

While OVN is preferred going forward, there are existing ML2/OVS
environments that rely on dvr_snat on compute nodes. It would be good
to be able to contribute bug fixes around the cases that are possible
to support.

The goal of this change is to allow contributions around dvr_snat on
compute nodes instead of completely rendering this out of support in at
a late stage.

If there are known limitations (say specific to IPv6 or OVS firewall
driver as described here

https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1732067/comments/79)

a better way might be to document those unsupported scenarios for
operators to assess.

Related-Bug: #1732067
Related-Bug: #1732067
Related-Bug: #1945306
Change-Id: I9698b6cedd8aeefcc77d114bc8d5c5279966f53e
'}]
commit_message:
[RFC] Alter wording on dvr_snat usage on computes

There was a recent change in the guide around the use of
`agent_mode = dvr_snat` on compute nodes:

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/801503/2/doc/source/admin/deploy-ovs-ha-dvr.rst#112

At the same time, both the old and new description contains this:
https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/configuration/l3-agent.html#DEFAULT.agent_mode
"This mode must be used for an L3 agent running on a centralized node
(or in single-host deployments, e.g. devstack)"

And, also, Devstack uses dvr_snat for single-node deployments:
https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/ee629cc77554b18cfca77506d1531f99523d2a58/lib/neutron#L44-L49

This new messaging seems to be confusing: if agent_mode = dvr_snat can
work on single-node deployments like DevStack, it may work on compute
nodes in a multi-node deployment as well, since a single-node deployment
is a network node + compute node + control node.

While OVN is preferred going forward, there are existing ML2/OVS
environments that rely on dvr_snat on compute nodes. It would be good
to be able to contribute bug fixes around the cases that are possible
to support.

The goal of this change is to allow contributions around dvr_snat on
compute nodes instead of completely rendering this out of support in at
a late stage.

If there are known limitations (say specific to IPv6 or OVS firewall
driver as described here

https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1732067/comments/79)

a better way might be to document those unsupported scenarios for
operators to assess.

Related-Bug: #1732067
Related-Bug: #1732067
Related-Bug: #1945306
Change-Id: I9698b6cedd8aeefcc77d114bc8d5c5279966f53e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/33/814733/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ``agent_mode = dvr_snat`` is not recommended on compute nodes.
deleted_lines: ``agent_mode = dvr_snat`` is not supported on compute nodes.

commit_message:
New test cases for TLD tests suite

1) test_create_duplicated_tlds
   Try to create the same TLD twice, first attempt should PASS
   while second fails with 409 Conflict.
2) test_create_multiply_tlds
   Create 3 diferent TLDs, expected should PASS.
3) test_create_invalid_tld
   Attempts to create TLD using invalid values and
   huge size description. Expected 400 BadRequest
4) test_create_zone_for_not_existing_tld
   Create a zone with non existing TLD, should fail with
   400 BadRequest.
5) test_create_tld_as_primary_user
   Try to create a TLD usig Primary tenant.
   Expected: should fail with 403 Forbidden

Change-Id: Id01a1fc5eaf9d08039696795c6121e20fbe42bc7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin refs/changes/04/797904/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: credentials = ['admin', 'primary'] cls.primary_client = cls.os_primary.tld_client cls.primary_zone_client = cls.os_primary.zones_client @decorators.idempotent_id('961bd2e8-d4d0-11eb-b8ee-74e5f9e2a801') def test_create_duplicated_tlds(self): tld_data = {"name": "org", "description": "sample tld"} for attempt in range(2): if attempt == 0: LOG.info('Create a first "org" TLD') tld = self.admin_client.create_tld( tld_data['name'], tld_data['description'])[1] self.addCleanup(self.admin_client.delete_tld, tld['id']) self.assertEqual(tld_data["name"], tld['name']) if attempt == 1: LOG.info('Try to create a second "org" TLD') self.assertRaises( lib_exc.Conflict, self.admin_client.create_tld, tld_name=tld_data['name'], description=tld_data['description']) @decorators.idempotent_id('0c0ab92e-d4db-11eb-b8ee-74e5f9e2a801') def test_create_multiply_tlds(self): tlds = ['abc', 'def', 'gih'] for tld_name in tlds: tld_data = {"name": tld_name, "description": "sample tld"} LOG.info('Create a "{}" TLD'.format(tld_name)) tld = self.admin_client.create_tld( tld_data['name'], tld_data['description'])[1] self.addCleanup(self.admin_client.delete_tld, tld['id']) self.assertEqual(tld_data["name"], tld['name']) @decorators.idempotent_id('52a4bb4b-4eff-4591-9dd3-ad98316806c3') def test_create_invalid_tld(self): invalid_tlds = [' ', 'fff.', '^&$', 't' * 1000, '@p%'] for tld_name in invalid_tlds: tld_data = {"name": tld_name, "description": "sample tld"} LOG.info('Create a size description.') self.assertRaises( lib_exc.BadRequest, self.admin_client.create_tld, tld_name='org', description='example' * 1000) @decorators.idempotent_id('06deced8-d4de-11eb-b8ee-74e5f9e2a801') def test_create_zone_for_not_existing_tld(self): LOG.info('Create an "org" TLD') tld_data = {"name": "org", "description": "sample tld"} tld = self.admin_client.create_tld( tld_data['name'], tld_data['description'])[1] self.addCleanup(self.admin_client.delete_tld, tld['id']) self.assertEqual(tld_data["name"], tld['name']) LOG.info('Create a Primary zone with "org" (existing) TLD.') zone = self.primary_zone_client.create_zone(name='example.org.')[1] self.addCleanup( self.wait_zone_delete, self.primary_zone_client, zone['id']) LOG.info('Ensure we respond with CREATE+PENDING') self.assertEqual('CREATE', zone['action']) self.assertEqual('PENDING', zone['status']) LOG.info('Try to create a Primary zone with "zzz" (not existing) TLD.') self.assertRaises( lib_exc.BadRequest, self.primary_zone_client.create_zone, name='example.zzz.') @decorators.idempotent_id('757019c0-d4e2-11eb-b8ee-74e5f9e2a801') def test_create_tld_as_primary_user(self): tld_data = {"name": "org", commit_message:
Fix auth_url setting for devstack

Keystone is dropping some variables in devstack, switch to using the
same variable for the auth_url that keystone is using instead of
trying to reconstruct it ourselves.

Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: I3f167b3ce699669addc5ef07c174ffb142c2c8cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari refs/changes/01/814701/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $MASAKARI_CONF DEFAULT os_privileged_user_auth_url "$KEYSTONE_SERVICE_URI" iniset $MASAKARI_MONITORS_CONF api auth_url "$KEYSTONE_SERVICE_URI"
deleted_lines: iniset $MASAKARI_CONF DEFAULT os_privileged_user_auth_url "${KEYSTONE_AUTH_PROTOCOL}://${KEYSTONE_AUTH_HOST}/identity" iniset $MASAKARI_MONITORS_CONF api auth_url "${KEYSTONE_AUTH_PROTOCOL}://${KEYSTONE_AUTH_HOST}/identity"

commit_message:
docs: Improve info about neutron external interface

Change-Id: I3a9c49c73a932b3d5ceed65c92190e5d72e27bbb
Closes-Bug: #1626259
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/65/813965/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Network interfaces ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ for example provider networks, routers and floating IPs. For setting up the neutron external interface modifydesired interface name. This interface is used by hosts in the ``network`` group, and hosts in the ``compute`` group if ``enable_neutron_provider_networks`` is set or DVR is enabled. The interface is plugged into a bridge (Open vSwitch or Linux Bridge, depending on the driver) defined by ``neutron_bridge_name``, which defaults to ``br-ex``. The default Neutron physical network is ``physnet1``. Example: single interface ------------------------- In the case where we have only a single Neutron external interface, configuration is simple:Example: multiple interfaces ---------------------------- In some cases it may be necessary to have multiple external network interfaces. This may be achieved via comma-separated lists: .. code-block:: yaml neutron_external_interface: "eth1,eth2" neutron_bridge_name: "br-ex1,br-ex2" These two lists are "zipped" together, such that ``eth1`` is plugged into the ``br-ex1`` bridge, and ``eth2`` is plugged into the ``br-ex2`` bridge. Kolla Ansible maps these interfaces to Neutron physical networks ``phynet1`` and ``physnet2`` respectively. Example: shared interface ------------------------- Sometimes an interface used for Neutron external networking may also be used for other traffic. Plugging an interface directly into a bridge would prevent us from having a usable IP address on the interface. One solution to this issue is to use an intermediate Linux bridge and virtual Ethernet pair, then assign IP addresses on the Linux bridge. This setup is supported by :kayobe-doc:`Kayobe </>`. It is out of scope here, as it is non-trivial to set up in a persistent manner. Provider networks ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Provider networks allow to connect compute instances directly to physical networks avoiding tunnels. This is necessary for example for some performance critical applications. Only administrators of OpenStack can create such networks. For provider networks compute hosts must have external bridge created and configured by Ansible tasks like it is already done for tenant DVR mode networking. Normal tenant non-DVR networking does not need external bridge on compute hosts and therefore operators don't need additional dedicated network interface.
deleted_lines: for example provider networks and floating IPs. For setting up the neutron external interface please modifydesired interface name, ``eth1`` in the example below:.. note:: This is used by hosts in the ``network`` group, and hosts in the ``compute`` group if ``enable_neutron_provider_networks`` is set or DVR is enabled.

commit_message:
Update Manila deploy steps for Wallaby

Manila has changed from using subfolders to subvolumes.
We need a bit of a tidy up to prevent deploy errors.
This change also adds the ability to specify the ceph FS
Manila uses instead of relying on the default "first found".

Closes-Bug: #1938285
Closes-Bug: #1935784
Change-Id: I1d0d34919fbbe74a4022cd496bf84b8b764b5e0f

commit_message:
[OVN] Update the DHCP options when the metadata port is modified

Always update the DHCP options when the metadata port is created,
updated or deleted. If the metadata port IP addresses are updated,
the DHCP options register should be too, modifying the static routes
defined in "DHCP_Options.options.classless_static_route".

These static routes will be injected in the VM in the DHCP request.
The IP address of the metadata port should match with the static
route redirecting the traffic to the metadata IP address
"169.254.169.254/32":

  $ ip r
  default via 10.0.0.1 dev eth0
  10.0.0.0/28 dev eth0 scope link  src 10.0.0.7
  169.254.169.254 via 10.0.0.2 dev eth0  # 10.0.0.2 is the metadata
                                         # port IP address
Conflicts:
      neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py
      neutron/tests/functional/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py
      neutron/tests/unit/fake_resources.py

Closes-Bug: #1942794
Change-Id: Id5d4909caa521a899b97d83bdc1963b010e97dac
(cherry picked from commit bd0ded15ca21161c0f20679477445f4e31128267)
(cherry picked from commit 7efce62b4fc5cbf512a8fe71366910e37b053614)
(cherry picked from commit f4dd0b80ac166278239ed0c43e35dacfaea81d0b)

commit_message:
Set proxy option in early dnf invocation

If hosts need to use a proxy to install packages and python is absent,
the call to install the python package will hang, at least on CentOS.

Set proxy if it exists in dnf_config using a command-line option. Later
uses of dnf will be after dnf.conf has been updated.

Change-Id: Ic949577afd3ea07306cebf224637a08a1ecce0f5
Story: 2009274
Task: 43528
(cherry picked from commit 29d73eed7a175f8d4126570c3321dc966f0547f1)

commit_message:
Adding more tests to "Designate Limits" tests suite

1) test_list_designate_limits_as_primary_user
   Make sure that the expected limit fields are listed
   in Designate Limits API response
   Note: this test replaces "test_list_designate_limits"
   that was using Admin user.

2) test_list_designate_impersonate_another_user_as_admin
   Make sure that the Limit values retrieved for a Primary
   user are the same for Admin user when "x-auth-sudo-project-id"
   is included in API request sent by Admin.

3) test_list_designate_impersonate_another_user_as_alt
   Make sure that the Alt user is not able to impersonate
   Primary user and that API responds with "403 Forbidden"
   Note: such an option is available for Admin user only.

4) test_list_designate_limits_all_projects
   Make sure that the list of retrieved Designate Limits for
   all projects, contains both project IDs used within the
   test setup: Primary and Alt.

Change-Id: Icd9c17110375c5055778d22a6d7c23529bd3649b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin refs/changes/78/797678/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.lib import exceptions as lib_exc credentials = ['admin', 'primary', 'alt'] cls.primary_client = cls.os_primary.designate_limit_client cls.alt_client = cls.os_alt.designate_limit_client @decorators.idempotent_id('5a5118dc-d42a-11eb-aa4d-74e5f9e2a801') def test_list_designate_limits_as_primary_user(self): project_limits = self.primary_client.list_designate_limits() @decorators.idempotent_id('828572be-8662-11eb-8ff2-74e5f9e2a801') def test_list_designate_impersonate_another_user_as_admin(self): primary_project_limits = self.primary_client.list_designate_limits() LOG.info( 'Retrieved designate limits for Primary user are: {} '.format( primary_project_limits)) admin_sudo_project_limits = self.admin_client.list_designate_limits( headers={'x-auth-sudo-project-id': self.primary_client.project_id}) LOG.info( 'Retrieved designate limits for Admin user impersonates ' 'Primary user are: {} '.format(admin_sudo_project_limits)) self.assertEqual( primary_project_limits, admin_sudo_project_limits, 'Failed, Admin user should receive the same values for ' 'Designate limits as a Primary tenant did.') @decorators.idempotent_id('5975fee0-d430-11eb-aa4d-74e5f9e2a801') def test_list_designate_impersonate_another_user_as_alt(self): self.assertRaises( lib_exc.Forbidden, self.alt_client.list_designate_limits, headers={'x-auth-sudo-project-id': self.primary_client.project_id}) @decorators.idempotent_id('828572be-8662-11eb-8ff2-74e5f9e2a801') def test_list_designate_limits_all_projects(self): existing_project_ids = [ self.primary_client.project_id, self.alt_client.project_id] LOG.info('Project IDs we would expect to receive with Admin user ' 'uses: "x-auth-all-projects" HTTP header ' 'are {}: '.format(existing_project_ids)) admin_sudo_project_limits = self.admin_client.list_designate_limits( headers={'x-auth-all-projects': True}) LOG.info( 'Retrieved designate limits by Admin user for all projects ' 'are: '.format(admin_sudo_project_limits)) # Seems like a bug, maybe in Design as we don't even have # project_id specified in API response for Designate Limits.

commit_message:
Run functional tests on Debian Bullseye

We need to update the base reference platform we perform the
functional tests on.  Debian bullseye seems like the best choice -- it
is recent enough to last for a while, and will match the
nodepool-builder container environment.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/zuul/zuul-jobs/+/814088
Change-Id: Ic68e8c5b839cbc2852326747c68ef89f630f26a3

commit_message:
Simplify functests job

At one point we had an array of functest jobs; we were testing
building on trusty, bionic, maybe centos, with python2 and python3.
The only thing left of all these combos these days is "bionic-python3"
(that's where this naming comes from).

We can remove the levels of abstraction now and just have the one job
to avoid confusion.

Change-Id: Id37d62a17f9b7f6dc6dc35585c29eddd435ce913

commit_message:
epel: match replacement better

It looks like upstream have changed this line to "download.example",
breaking our subsitution.  Let's do a generic match.

Change-Id: I8e443022a5f239b98ccefe73a9abf8cf259dc8e9

commit_message:
Make the API tests compatible with scoped tokens

This patch makes the API tests compatible with keystone scoped
tokens and the new RBAC defaults.

For example, admin system scoped tokens do not have a project_id associated
with them requiring some tests to be updated to not assume the admin
credential always has a project_id.

This patch also makes some sections consistently ordered across files.

Change-Id: Ie2c7402967f40bb90e0d97dad1c3d59f82cb6d80

commit_message:
Remove extras job, put gentoo job in gate

The only job left in the "extras" functional test is for gentoo.  We
might as well just drop this and put the gentoo devstack test in the
gate -- in terms of resources it's a 1:1 swap now.

Cleanup the ordering of the check queue list

Change-Id: I2af8f9235131cd0cce33e67c8d0d05c3b357320d

commit_message:
functests: drop minimal tests in the gate

We test the minimal builds in the devstack based end-to-end tests.
There is no need to also run these functional tests; they test *less*
than the full build/upload/boot testing done in the devstack test.

We consolidate the separate "image" based job

Change-Id: I73ca83bedb4b0c40af5209f9c93a0e657c152591

commit_message:
ubuntu-systemd-container: deprecate and remove jobs

I'm not aware this element is used/was ever used.  It hasn't ever been
updated to Focal.  To reduce our testing footprint remove this test,
and note in the element its probably broken.

Change-Id: I17cd3b13948287fe78990cfbe16a22919a329ba9

commit_message:
Revert "Allowing ubuntu element use local image"

This reverts commit 1f4fb1d7a5709be3aa047430e698f6051887577f.

This unfortunately wasn't actually tested.  Because the image-based
tests run sequentially, a prior failure in the centos-8 job meant the
ubuntu job never ran.

This is failing with

 10-cache-ubuntu-tarball: line 28: DIB_LOCAL_IMAGE: unbound variable

There is also a seemingly unused variable DIB_IMAGE_LOCAL_FILE; I'm
not sure what this is doing.

For now revert, and it can be re-proposed with appropriate testing.

Change-Id: I0f3897c90dc863ee04c3295b9cb094f02d8658e3

commit_message:
Remove fedora-32 disk image config

This is a followup change to the previous change which removed fedora-32
node launches. Here we cleanup the disk image configs

Change-Id: I459ec47735550e4adcc912bd707836582223b075

commit_message:
Remove debian-stable job

The "stable" this originally referred to is stretch, which is now two
"stable"'s ago.  We've since realised that giving nodesets generic
names doesn't work so well for this reason and will use codenames in
the future (debian-bullseye, etc.).

Since we're not going to update this old branch to new releases,
remove this job so infra can remove the debian-stable nodeset.

Change-Id: I125e5e57a395ab00c1137cd72cced3b7a23c53d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ironic refs/changes/43/814343/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove debian-stable job

The "stable" this originally referred to is stretch, which is now two
"stable"'s ago.  We've since realised that giving nodesets generic
names doesn't work so well for this reason and will use codenames in
the future (debian-bullseye, etc.).

Since we're not going to update this old branch to new releases,
remove this job so infra can remove the debian-stable nodeset.

Change-Id: I6d2cd0c37d704e75a8effc32bd98249856145616

commit_message:
Remove debian-stable job

The "stable" this originally referred to is stretch, which is now two
"stable"'s ago.  We've since realised that giving nodesets generic
names doesn't work so well for this reason and will use codenames in
the future (debian-bullseye, etc.).

Since we're not going to update this old branch to new releases,
remove this job so infra can remove the debian-stable nodeset.

Change-Id: I0df31394b5f1ef74c87d3937975be5779823a8ce

commit_message:
Remove py35 tox jobs

At this point py35 practically means Xenial, and we are not interested
in having that as a build platform.  Drop the py35 jobs.

Update python setup.cfg metadata; we are building on 3.9 so add that.

Change-Id: I981f0f67a6fd809af1ab70934358dc3404890f35
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/80/814680/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Programming Language :: Python :: 3.9python_requires = >=3.6

subject: Add tripleo_dnf_stream Ansible module.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-07 10:27:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/113f7eaff1c06bbfc7311a19919deda8e5d1661d', 'message': 'Add dnf_stream Ansible module.

One of the functionalities the dnf Ansible module misses is the single
disabling and disabling of DNF modules. Currently only installation and
removal are supported.

The dnf_stream module is based on the dnf.py Ansible core module [0]
(so it will be simpler to contribute with this functionality to upstream
Ansible core) and covers the enabling and disabling of one or multiple
MODULE:STREAM.

This functionality is required when performing a minor update, as we
need to make sure that a set of streams are enabled to provide with
the right packages [1]. In this situation, the installation of the
whole module is not really required as a full upgrade will run after.

The module uses the options name (MODULE:STREAM) and state:[disabled or
enabled]. Example:
    - name: Enable the container-tools:3.0
      dnf_stream:
        - name: container-tools:3.0
          state: enabled

[0]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/lib/ansible/modules/dnf.py
[1]: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/deployment/tripleo-packages/tripleo-packages-baremetal-puppet.yaml#L378-L381

Change-Id: I992935e1c478591f3c8af5044df8a625af9eba85

commit_message:
Add tripleo_dnf_stream Ansible module.

One of the functionalities the dnf Ansible module misses is the single
disabling and disabling of DNF modules [0]. Currently only installation and
removal are supported.

The tripleo_dnf_stream module is based on the dnf.py Ansible core module [1]
(so it will be simpler to contribute with this functionality to upstream
Ansible core) and covers the enabling and disabling of one or multiple
MODULE:STREAM.

This functionality is required when performing a minor update, as we
need to make sure that a set of streams are enabled to provide with
the right packages [2]. In this situation, the installation of the
whole module is not really required as a full upgrade will run after.

The module uses the options name (MODULE:STREAM) and state:[disabled or
enabled]. Example:
    - name: Enable the container-tools:3.0
      tripleo_dnf_stream:
        - name: container-tools:3.0
          state: enabled

[0]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/64852
[1]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/lib/ansible/modules/dnf.py
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/deployment/tripleo-packages/tripleo-packages-baremetal-puppet.yaml#L378-L381

Change-Id: I992935e1c478591f3c8af5044df8a625af9eba85

commit_message:
Remove debian-stable job

The "stable" this originally referred to is stretch, which is now two
"stable"'s ago.  We've since realised that giving nodesets generic
names doesn't work so well for this reason and will use codenames in
the future (debian-bullseye, etc.).

Since we're not going to update this old branch to new releases,
remove this job so infra can remove the debian-stable nodeset.

Change-Id: Ie00eacabacae3f63c0d6d598694086d97c07ea8d

commit_message:
Remove debian-stable job

The "stable" this originally referred to is stretch, which is now two
"stable"'s ago.  We've since realised that giving nodesets generic
names doesn't work so well for this reason and will use codenames in
the future (debian-bullseye, etc.).

Since we're not going to update this old branch to new releases,
remove this job so infra can remove the debian-stable nodeset.

Change-Id: Ie64b8f5d1a7061470bfc5fa9756af2111a24144f

commit_message:
Remove debian-stable job

The "stable" this originally referred to is stretch, which is now two
"stable"'s ago.  We've since realised that giving nodesets generic
names doesn't work so well for this reason and will use codenames in
the future (debian-bullseye, etc.).

Since we're not going to update this old branch to new releases,
remove this job so infra can remove the debian-stable nodeset.

Change-Id: I882fa785f47b443f53f01709660182acb923ef2d

commit_message:
Add user messages for volume operations

This patch adds user messages for following volume operations:
1) Delete volume
2) Migrate volume
3) Retype volume

Change-Id: I7bf955123c2e7a63e6bb03f3bf67a874823dbff6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/15/793515/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: DELETE_VOLUME = ('018', _('delete volume')) MIGRATE_VOLUME = ('019', _('migrate volume')) RETYPE_VOLUME = ('020', _('retype volume')) DELETE_VOLUME, MIGRATE_VOLUME, RETYPE_VOLUME, VOLUME_IS_BUSY = ('022', _("Volume is busy.")) VOLUME_DELETE_ERROR = ('023', _("Volume failed to delete.")) VOLUME_MIGRATE_ERROR = ('024', _("Failed to migrate volume.")) VOLUME_RETYPE_ERROR = ('025', _("Failed to retype volume.")) VOLUME_IS_BUSY, VOLUME_DELETE_ERROR, VOLUME_MIGRATE_ERROR, VOLUME_RETYPE_ERROR, VOLUME_IS_BUSY: ['VolumeIsBusy'],

commit_message:
Allow customizing separator for api-paste.ini

The api-paste.ini accepts not only "=" but also ":" and some services
like Barbican have been using ":" for their default api-paste.ini
files.

[composite:main]
use = egg:Paste#urlmap
/: barbican_version
/v1: barbican-api-keystone

This change allows users to use ":" so that they can update the ini
files with keeping it consistent with the default fules

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/813614
Change-Id: I843154a46ac61c8ea54a7b28a42ad154568a845e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-19 13:13:05.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/remove-filename-param-from-vmedia-url-bf4773ede44f2206.yaml', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_image_utils.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/image_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/dd8e6c6c765ebf8388fce27ba00a0c1f130c3e29', 'message': 'Do not append filename parameter to image URL when using local file

Currently Ironic always adds a filename parameter to virtual media
image URL, for example:
http://localhost/redfish/boot.iso?filename=file.iso. This is useful
on certain BMCs which require a ".iso" suffix in the image URL
especially when using swift as the image source.
This should not be neccessary with file based virtual media images

Change-Id: I3338bdb6a24d9695ce32d205221183b9b876bcc8
(cherry picked from commit e05f74c623d53aecc4a2e097595da8cdbd2607ef)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not append filename parameter to image URL when using local file

Currently Ironic always adds a filename parameter to virtual media
image URL, for example:
http://localhost/redfish/boot.iso?filename=file.iso. This is useful
on certain BMCs which require a ".iso" suffix in the image URL
especially when using swift as the image source.
This should not be neccessary with file based virtual media images
and adding this parameter can cause issues in BMCs which do not
accept special characters such as "=" and "?" in virtual image URL.
This change alters Ironic's behaviour to only add the filename
parameter if swift backing store is used for the image.

Story: 2009278
Task: 43547

Change-Id: I3338bdb6a24d9695ce32d205221183b9b876bcc8
(cherry picked from commit e05f74c623d53aecc4a2e097595da8cdbd2607ef)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/77/814577/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: image_url = self._append_filename_param( image_url, os.path.basename(image_file))

commit_message:
Migrate and refactor operations

Copy all cloud operations pages and two management pages
from the CDG to this guide.

Refactor appropriately and fix broken links

Minor changes related to page titles

Change-Id: I9eb759b958d285aa7cdf381fb7d4ebf228bd21ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-guide refs/changes/25/813925/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :orphan: ================================================= Start MySQL InnoDB Cluster from a complete outage ================================================= Preamble -------- Regardless of how MySQL InnoDB Cluster services were shut down (gracefully, hard shutdown, or power outage) a special startup procedure is required in order to put the cloud database back online. Procedure --------- This example will assume that the state of the cloud database is as follows: .. code-block:: none juju status mysql-innodb-cluster App Version Status Scale Charm Store Channel Rev OS Message mysql-innodb-cluster 8.0.25 blocked 3 mysql-innodb-cluster charmstore stable 7 ubuntu Cluster is inaccessible from this instance. Please check logs for details. Unit Workload Agent Machine Public address Ports Message mysql-innodb-cluster/0 blocked idle 0/lxd/2 10.0.0.240 Cluster is inaccessible from this instance. Please check logs for details. mysql-innodb-cluster/1 blocked idle 1/lxd/2 10.0.0.208 Cluster is inaccessible from this instance. Please check logs for details. mysql-innodb-cluster/2* blocked idle 2/lxd/2 10.0.0.218 Cluster is inaccessible from this instance. Please check logs for details. Initialise the cluster by running the ``reboot-cluster-from-complete-outage`` action on any mysql-innodb-cluster unit: .. code-block:: none juju run-action --wait mysql-innodb-cluster/1 reboot-cluster-from-complete-outage .. important:: If the chosen unit is not the most up-to-date in terms of cluster activity the action will fail. However, the action's output messaging will include the correct node to use (in terms of its IP address). In such a case, simply re-run the action against the proper unit. The mysql-innodb-cluster application should now be back to a clustered and healthy state: .. code-block:: console App Version Status Scale Charm Store Channel Rev OS Message mysql-innodb-cluster 8.0.25 active 3 mysql-innodb-cluster charmstore stable 7 ubuntu Unit is ready: Mode: R/O, Cluster is ONLINE and can tolerate up to ONE failure. Unit Workload Agent Machine Public address Ports Message mysql-innodb-cluster/0 active idle 0/lxd/2 10.0.0.240 Unit is ready: Mode: R/O, Cluster is ONLINE and can tolerate up to ONE failure. mysql-innodb-cluster/1 active idle 1/lxd/2 10.0.0.208 Unit is ready: Mode: R/O, Cluster is ONLINE and can tolerate up to ONE failure. mysql-innodb-cluster/2* active idle 2/lxd/2 10.0.0.218 Unit is ready: Mode: R/W, Cluster is ONLINE and can tolerate up to ONE failure. See the :ref:`mysql-innodb-cluster section <mysql_innodb_cluster_startup>` on the :doc:`Managing power events <../howto/managing-power-events>` page for full coverage.

commit_message:
Add migration procedure for cinder-lvm

Add a procedure to assist users in migrating from
the legacy LVM-support built in to the cinder charm
to the de-coupled LVM-support in the cinder-lvm charm.

At this time the option `volume-backend-name` is
currently named `backend-name` but a backport is
targetted soon after release of OpenStack Charms
21.10.

Change-Id: I97cab38ecfcbfc586aeccaedcdba3c680b6e50db

commit_message:
Change config parameter 'backend-name' to 'volume-backend-name'

This patchset normalizes the configuration parameter so that it
matches what other charms are already using to make thins more
uniform and consistent.

Change-Id: I65ae3b12754a78d3419c69dc5e664d03409013bf

commit_message:
[OVN] Update the DHCP options when the metadata port is modified

Always update the DHCP options when the metadata port is created,
updated or deleted. If the metadata port IP addresses are updated,
the DHCP options register should be too, modifying the static routes
defined in "DHCP_Options.options.classless_static_route".

These static routes will be injected in the VM in the DHCP request.
The IP address of the metadata port should match with the static
route redirecting the traffic to the metadata IP address
"169.254.169.254/32":

  $ ip r
  default via 10.0.0.1 dev eth0
  10.0.0.0/28 dev eth0 scope link  src 10.0.0.7
  169.254.169.254 via 10.0.0.2 dev eth0  # 10.0.0.2 is the metadata
                                         # port IP address

Upstream Neutron-master brach:
  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/807692

Closes-Bug: #1942794
Change-Id: Id5d4909caa521a899b97d83bdc1963b010e97dac

commit_message:
infra-package-needs: install latest pip

The pip installed in the venv with "python3 -m venv" on Xenial is 8.X
-- this does not understand python_requires metadata on packages and
can thus pull in requirements that won't actually run inside the
virtualenv.

Avoid this by upgrading pip in the venv before installing.

While this is the immediate need; do the same on the other venv's we
create for general sanity.

Change-Id: I316e9587b6e290cd421b47f506c91dbebe0975c0

commit_message:
Add ubuntu-bionic-32GB

This adds the ubuntu-bionic-32GB label to vexxhost, which makes it
available in two regions (airship citycloud is the other).

The cpu/ram specs are matched in both clouds.

Change-Id: Iac79fab2478cc383083531886ee6b8a9e7c87187

commit_message:
[OVN] Update the DHCP options when the metadata port is modified

Always update the DHCP options when the metadata port is created,
updated or deleted. If the metadata port IP addresses are updated,
the DHCP options register should be too, modifying the static routes
defined in "DHCP_Options.options.classless_static_route".

These static routes will be injected in the VM in the DHCP request.
The IP address of the metadata port should match with the static
route redirecting the traffic to the metadata IP address
"169.254.169.254/32":

  $ ip r
  default via 10.0.0.1 dev eth0
  10.0.0.0/28 dev eth0 scope link  src 10.0.0.7
  169.254.169.254 via 10.0.0.2 dev eth0  # 10.0.0.2 is the metadata
                                         # port IP address
Conflicts:
      neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py
      neutron/tests/unit/fake_resources.py

Closes-Bug: #1942794
Change-Id: Id5d4909caa521a899b97d83bdc1963b010e97dac
(cherry picked from commit bd0ded15ca21161c0f20679477445f4e31128267)

commit_message:
Add user message for revert to snapshot

Since revert to snapshot is async operation, it might fail after API
returns to user.
This patch adds a user message for the following scenarios:
1) Driver failed to revert to snapshot
2) Driver failed to create temp volume from snapshot
3) Attach/Detach errors
4) Copy volume from temp vol to original vol error

Change-Id: Ic7c8e0a9919db8309a4662556331c628cf777edc

commit_message:
Fix request path to query a resource provider by uuid

To query a resource provider by uuid, request path should look like
 /resource_providers?uuid=<uuid>
istead of
 /resource_providers&uuid=<uuid>

This change fixes the wrong path so that "nova-manage placement audit"
command can look up the target resource provider properly.

Closes-Bug: #1936278
Change-Id: I2ae7e9782316e3662e4e51e3f5ba0ef597bf281b
(cherry picked from commit 1d3373dcf0a05d4a2c5b51fc1b74d41ec1bb1175)
(cherry picked from commit 62a3fa4fff70a1d03998626406a71b7dc09da733)
(cherry picked from commit 7dbceeceef0ca3657c72341375afc639be0b5c02)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-18 12:29:25.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/test_maintenance.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/ovn_l3/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/maintenance.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/34c3ec244e12e74c4fb3517d75303ec8a30fc581', 'message': '[OVN] Tune OVN routers to reduce the mem footprint for ML2/OVN

In order to avoid having a MAC_Binding table explosion and helping
lowering the memory footprint when using ML2/OVN this patch is setting
two options to the OVN routers:

* always_learn_from_arp_request: By setting this to False we
  avoid learning from ARP replies observed in the network. Only the
  ARP requests sent by OVN will generate a MAC_Binding entry in the
  OVSDB database. For larger broadcasts domains this avoids having a
  MAC_Binding table explosion, reduce the DB size and memory footprint
  of ML2/OVN.

* dynamic_neigh_routers: By setting this to True we avoid
  pre-populating flows for router to router communication, reduding
  the number of flows, DB size and memory footprint of ML2/OVN.

For more information on these option for core OVN please refer to:
https://www.ovn.org/support/dist-docs/ovn-nb.5.html

This patch also includes a new maintenance task to include these options
to existing routers in the system.

commit_message:
[OVN] Tune OVN routers to reduce the mem footprint for ML2/OVN

In order to avoid having a MAC_Binding table explosion and helping
lowering the memory footprint when using ML2/OVN this patch is setting
two options to the OVN routers:

* always_learn_from_arp_request: By setting this to False we
  avoid learning from ARP replies observed in the network. Only the
  ARP requests sent by OVN will generate a MAC_Binding entry in the
  OVSDB database. For larger broadcasts domains this avoids having a
  MAC_Binding table explosion, reduce the DB size and memory footprint
  of ML2/OVN.

* dynamic_neigh_routers: By setting this to True we avoid
  pre-populating flows for router to router communication, reduding
  the number of flows, DB size and memory footprint of ML2/OVN.

For more information on these option for core OVN please refer to:
https://www.ovn.org/support/dist-docs/ovn-nb.5.html

This patch also includes a new maintenance task to include these options
to existing routers in the system.

Related-Bug: #1946318
Change-Id: I056acdec9b6ee2341d2bc4f7bd9a678f3bf91972
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit a278c5ba789c014ec777a75fc9538179d6707202)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/20/814420/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import copy # TODO(lucasagomes): Remove this in the Z cycle # A static spacing value is used here, but this method will only run # once per lock due to the use of periodics.NeverAgain(). @periodics.periodic(spacing=600, run_immediately=True) def check_router_mac_binding_options(self): if not self.has_lock: return cmds = [] for router in self._nb_idl.lr_list().execute(check_error=True): if (router.options.get('always_learn_from_arp_request') and router.options.get('dynamic_neigh_routers')): continue opts = copy.deepcopy(router.options) opts.update({'always_learn_from_arp_request': 'false', 'dynamic_neigh_routers': 'true'}) cmds.append(self._nb_idl.update_lrouter(router.name, options=opts)) if cmds: with self._nb_idl.transaction(check_error=True) as txn: for cmd in cmds: txn.add(cmd) raise periodics.NeverAgain()

[OVN] Tune OVN routers to reduce the mem footprint for ML2/OVN

In order to avoid having a MAC_Binding table explosion and helping

* always_learn_from_arp_request: By setting this to False we
  avoid learning from ARP replies observed in the network. Only the
  ARP requests sent by OVN will generate a MAC_Binding entry in the
  OVSDB database. For larger broadcasts domains this avoids having a
  MAC_Binding table explosion, reduce the DB size and memory footprint
  of ML2/OVN.

* dynamic_neigh_routers: By setting this to True we avoid
  pre-populating flows for router to router communication, reduding
  the number of flows, DB size and memory footprint of ML2/OVN.

For more information on these option for core OVN please refer to:
https://www.ovn.org/support/dist-docs/ovn-nb.5.html

This patch also includes a new maintenance task to include these options
to existing routers in the system.

commit_message:
[OVN] Tune OVN routers to reduce the mem footprint for ML2/OVN

In order to avoid having a MAC_Binding table explosion and helping
lowering the memory footprint when using ML2/OVN this patch is setting
two options to the OVN routers:

* always_learn_from_arp_request: By setting this to False we
  avoid learning from ARP replies observed in the network. Only the
  ARP requests sent by OVN will generate a MAC_Binding entry in the
  OVSDB database. For larger broadcasts domains this avoids having a
  MAC_Binding table explosion, reduce the DB size and memory footprint
  of ML2/OVN.

* dynamic_neigh_routers: By setting this to True we avoid
  pre-populating flows for router to router communication, reduding
  the number of flows, DB size and memory footprint of ML2/OVN.

For more information on these option for core OVN please refer to:
https://www.ovn.org/support/dist-docs/ovn-nb.5.html

This patch also includes a new maintenance task to include these options
to existing routers in the system.

commit_message:
Use an older version of neutron-tempest-plugin for stein jobs

Since [0], stein uses an older version of tempest to fix jsonschema
issue observed in newer releases. This tag does not have
utils.is_network_feature_enabled used in test_metadata scenario.

As stein is in Extended Maintenance, use an older version for n-t-p to
fix gates. Also filter out port forwarding test as it is unstable in
this pinned version.

Closes-Bug: #1946748

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/812092

Change-Id: I724da80bc440cd5d5b947d0c0a08cbead95628e9

Upgrade networking to v1

This change updates the ingress networking version from v1beta1 to v1.

Also uplifts the ingress version to 1.0.2.

commit_message:
[OVN] Tune OVN routers to reduce the mem footprint for ML2/OVN

In order to avoid having a MAC_Binding table explosion and helping
lowering the memory footprint when using ML2/OVN this patch is setting
two options to the OVN routers:

* always_learn_from_arp_request: By setting this to False we
  avoid learning from ARP replies observed in the network. Only the
  ARP requests sent by OVN will generate a MAC_Binding entry in the
  OVSDB database. For larger broadcasts domains this avoids having a
  MAC_Binding table explosion, reduce the DB size and memory footprint
  of ML2/OVN.

* dynamic_neigh_routers: By setting this to True we avoid
  pre-populating flows for router to router communication, reduding
  the number of flows, DB size and memory footprint of ML2/OVN.

For more information on these option for core OVN please refer to:
https://www.ovn.org/support/dist-docs/ovn-nb.5.html

This patch also includes a new maintenance task to include these options
to existing routers in the system.

Related-Bug: #1946318

Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit a278c5ba789c014ec777a75fc9538179d6707202)

commit_message:
Add policy targets to volume-type API

Adding policy targets for types API to make it  more granular
such that each API namely POST, PUT and DELETE has a different
rule, that can be used to control the roles that have
access to it.

Closes-bug: #1841587

Change-Id: I8a6a14893af4f81e8a3fcd3974f2b56b58bc6865

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-09-28 14:39:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/8bde9b0a7e04638b738a988e14d826c8ede93c30', 'message': 'Ignore network errors during C_Finalize

The Trustway Proteccio HSM can somtimes return a network error when
attempting to finalize the cryptoki library.

The error can prevent reinitialization because we attempt to finalize
the library before initalizing a new connection.  When a network error
occurrs, barbican gets stuck in an error loop trying to finalize the
dead connection before starting a new one.

This patch adds code to ignore the network error when finalizing to
ensure we are able to attempt to reinitialize.

commit_message:
Ignore network errors during C_Finalize

The Trustway Proteccio HSM can somtimes return a network error when
attempting to finalize the cryptoki library.

The error can prevent reinitialization because we attempt to finalize
the library before initalizing a new connection.  When a network error
occurrs, barbican gets stuck in an error loop trying to finalize the
dead connection before starting a new one.

This patch adds code to ignore the network error when finalizing to
ensure we are able to attempt to reinitialize.

Connection errors during other operations will still result in 500
errors as expected.

Change-Id: I9ac6c7bbda0f81cb26e1c589803317df1ef11f39
(cherry picked from commit 70aac1f6980bd1ed6053c4b6c5c4171fdbfeeabb)
(cherry picked from commit 1b6cf81c23017915ffb380af6dfa8c7ca176fced)
(cherry picked from commit 2792aca796400055c5d1dc3d3f32b7b29f3a605d)
(cherry picked from commit 238b72cacaae637829b345c942ed928d0c40cbcd)

added_lines: def test_finalize_ignores_trustway_network_errors(self): self.lib.C_Finalize.return_value = 0x81000071 self.pkcs11.finalize() self.assertEqual(1, self.lib.C_Finalize.call_count)

commit_message:
Drop UndercloudMinion environments

This is no longer valid with the switch to ephemeral heat for
deployments.

We dropped the tripleoclient code for minion in [1]. With this patch
dropping UndercloudMinion environments.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/811995

Change-Id: I097b9b69ba6ed132b7c9fb0bc0e42f06808c6ab2

commit_message:
[OVN] Update the DHCP options when the metadata port is modified

Always update the DHCP options when the metadata port is created,
updated or deleted. If the metadata port IP addresses are updated,
the DHCP options register should be too, modifying the static routes
defined in "DHCP_Options.options.classless_static_route".

These static routes will be injected in the VM in the DHCP request.
The IP address of the metadata port should match with the static
route redirecting the traffic to the metadata IP address
"169.254.169.254/32":

  $ ip r
  default via 10.0.0.1 dev eth0
  10.0.0.0/28 dev eth0 scope link  src 10.0.0.7
  169.254.169.254 via 10.0.0.2 dev eth0  # 10.0.0.2 is the metadata
                                         # port IP address
Conflicts:
      neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py
      neutron/tests/unit/fake_resources.py

Closes-Bug: #1942794
Change-Id: Id5d4909caa521a899b97d83bdc1963b010e97dac
(cherry picked from commit bd0ded15ca21161c0f20679477445f4e31128267)
(cherry picked from commit 7efce62b4fc5cbf512a8fe71366910e37b053614)
