commit_message:
sharidng: update doc to only mention auto_shard experimental

There are been members of the community running sharding in production
and it's awesome. It's just the auto-sharding swift of that remains
experimental.

This patch removes the big sharding warning from the top of the
sharding overview page and better emphasises that it's the audo_shard
option that isn't ready for production use.

Change-Id: Id2c842cffad58fb6fd5e1d12619c46ffcb38f8a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/10/814510/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: It is strongly recommended that operators gain experience of sharding containers in a non-production cluster before using in production. The ``auto_shard`` option is currently **NOT** recommended for production systems and should be set to ``false`` (the default value). the ``swift-manage-shard-ranges`` tool.
deleted_lines: Container sharding is currently an experimental feature. It is strongly recommended that operators gain experience of sharding containers in a non-production cluster before using in production. the ``swift-manage-shard-ranges`` tool. The ``auto_shard`` option is currently NOT recommended for production systems and shoud be set to ``false`` (the default value).

commit_message:
Add a retry to the instropection waiting workbook

The workbook wait_for_introspection_to_finish needs a retry and a delay
to avoid issues in some deployments

related bug https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1999539

Change-Id: I2a23f33868ad71f6385403dbcb7353d1158d9e5a
(cherry picked from commit b02ad2618639ef39bd03c58d845ac8091d9bb90a)

commit_message:
Enable support for Libvirt modular daemons

This change enables support for modular libvirt
daemon configurations.

NOTE: As of now, this change doesn't handle any modular daemons
socket configuration.

Change-Id: I90c3dd7bd63f9f54e43eee7bc2f58d165ca80e57
(cherry picked from commit 448c9d3517d7662ee70becf9137b04652a150a24)

added_lines: require 'puppet' require 'puppet/type/virtqemud_config' describe 'Puppet::Type.type(:virtqemud_config)' do before :each do @virtqemud_config = Puppet::Type.type(:virtqemud_config).new(:name => 'DEFAULT/foo', :value => 'bar') end it 'should accept a valid value' do @virtqemud_config[:value] = 'bar' expect(@virtqemud_config[:value]).to eq('bar') end it 'should autorequire the package that install the file' do catalog = Puppet::Resource::Catalog.new anchor = Puppet::Type.type(:anchor).new(:name => 'nova::install::end') catalog.add_resource anchor, @virtqemud_config dependency = @virtqemud_config.autorequire expect(dependency.size).to eq(1) expect(dependency[0].target).to eq(@virtqemud_config) expect(dependency[0].source).to eq(anchor) end end

commit_message:
Enable new SELinux boolean for vTPM support

In order to get a working vTPM support in containers, we need to enable
a new SELinux boolean provided by openstack-selinux[1].

This patch affects only the deprecated
nova-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml template in order to do a clean
backport to stable/Wallaby and stable/Victoria.

[1] https://github.com/redhat-openstack/openstack-selinux/pull/80

Change-Id: I1d2368135f7b0a83dec2192c242c081e2f5127c1
Closes-Bug: #1902468
Resolves: rhbz#2007314
(cherry picked from commit f664302c3deb539c0f59fa5b1eff48449acf6b85)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/60/814360/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Adding gerritreview messages to starlingx channel

commit_message:
Do not append filename parameter to image URL when using local file

Currently Ironic always adds a filename parameter to virtual media
image URL, for example:
http://localhost/redfish/boot.iso?filename=file.iso. This is useful
on certain BMCs which require a ".iso" suffix in the image URL
especially when using swift as the image source.
This should not be neccessary with file based virtual media images
and adding this parameter can cause issues in BMCs which do not
accept special characters such as "=" and "?" in virtual image URL.
This change alters Ironic's behaviour to only add the filename
parameter if swift backing store is used for the image.

Story: 2009278
Task: 43547

Change-Id: I3338bdb6a24d9695ce32d205221183b9b876bcc8
(cherry picked from commit e05f74c623d53aecc4a2e097595da8cdbd2607ef)

Fix manila haproxy manage

In manila playbook we incorrectly defined haproxy backend name.
This wasn't catched by CI since we do single node deployment.

commit_message:
Retrive non-tripleo containers from buildah images

Due to fallback registry, non_tripleo_containers list does not
contains the list of actual pulled containers, it needs to be
retrived from buildah images output otherwise while pushing
the containers it will fail complaining containers does not
exists.

In this patch, we are retriving the image id and then passing
those image id to buildah to push it to content provider
registry.

It also collects only stdout from non_tripleo register
ansible var to store necessary data in the file.

Related-Bug: #1920873

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I972d03650653a63c0f5df0b3c2ef7bb710b4afba

commit_message:
Prevent Bifrost from using firewalld

This is to avoid conflicting with iptables rules configured on the seed
host by Kayobe.

A new variable kolla_bifrost_use_firewalld is introduced to configure
whether Bifrost uses firewalld.

Change-Id: I7049eae6518f818f9e180dfdb6f515d527644808
Story: 2009252
Task: 43442
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/97/811097/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Whether Bifrost uses firewalld. Default value is false to avoid conflicting # with iptables rules configured on the seed host by Kayobe. kolla_bifrost_use_firewalld: False

commit_message:
add kernel-modules-extra in overcloud image needed for HWOL

In case of ovs-hw-offload, without k-m-e installed,
it will have a performance impact because of excessive upcalls
due to the lack of act_ct.

This patch is intended to provision k-m-e in overcloud image
building.

act_ct would be added to kernel-core in rhel9.
So, k-m-e doesnt required in rhel9,centos9.

Closes-Bug: #1946227
Change-Id: If398172876059559ce70ebb868ada82da009a02d

added_lines: - kernel-modules-extra

commit_message:
Add option to use alernative CA server for certbot

This could be achieved using the
haproxy_ssl_letsencrypt_setup_extra_params variable, but this
makes it a bit neater.

Change-Id: Iee2d5a10e1762b23fcb3f3140950c76a754743b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server refs/changes/64/814364/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Use alternative CA that supports ACME, can be a public or private CA # haproxy_ssl_letsencrypt_certbot_server: "https://acme-staging-v02.api.letsencrypt.org/directory"

subject: Allow Docker to use insecure registry when deployed by Kayobe
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-01 16:15:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/commit/b8821b06c98e67c014f66909aecf86f9ee59735d', 'message': 'Allow Docker to use insecure registry when deployed by Kayobe

Kolla Ansible has recently updated the default Docker configuration to
stop using an insecure registry [1]. To avoid breaking existing Kayobe
deployments, automatically set docker_registry_insecure to true if we
deploy a registry without TLS.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/805449

Change-Id: Ifec7102812b5503cb02f207098192e99e7193d49
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2021-10-01 21:06:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/commit/b4306e56faa7b8fd7cd69d1f7b3013eb2a11fdf5', 'message': 'Allow Docker to use insecure registry when deployed by Kayobe

Kolla Ansible has recently updated the default Docker configuration to
stop using an insecure registry [1]. To avoid breaking existing Kayobe

commit_message:
Allow Docker to use insecure registry when deployed by Kayobe

Kolla Ansible has recently updated the default Docker configuration to
stop using an insecure registry [1]. To avoid breaking existing Kayobe
deployments, automatically set docker_registry_insecure to true if we
deploy a registry without TLS.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/805449

Change-Id: Ifec7102812b5503cb02f207098192e99e7193d49
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/68/812168/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Adds new variables ``docker_registry_insecure`` and ``kolla_docker_registry_insecure`` to configure whether Docker should use an insecure registry. upgrade: - | The default configuration of Docker, as set by Kolla Ansible, has changed to prevent Docker from using an insecure registry. To avoid breaking existing deployments, ``docker_registry_insecure`` is automatically set to ``true`` if Kayobe is configured to deploy an insecure registry service. If using a registry not deployed by Kayobe, review the value of ``docker_registry_insecure`` for your environment.

commit_message:
Unblock stable/train gate

This patch moves the failing gate job "barbican-grenade-devstack" to the
experimental gate.  This should allow us to merge bugfix backports while
we try to figure out why grenade is failing (likely because it's using
an old legacy devstack gate).

Change-Id: Ifca7bc3472912163e4e9b74028bdd02970baecba

commit_message:
[cleanup] Remove "Update flavors" from documentation

"Edit Flavor" feature is dropped in horizon by 377422b
and this patch removes its reference from the documentation
to avoid confusion.

Closes-Bug: #1940035
Change-Id: I76a0e0052c7ede9f9e9751b39a6264ffeb0322e3

commit_message:
Fix tripleo-get-hash tripleo-yum-config python installation

We are now consuming this as an ansible collection but it seems
we overlooked the setuptools setup.cfg install. For starters we
need the ansible module paths. Added a note to get_hash doc
about using --user for python setup.py install.
The depends-on is needed for the failing ubi-8 build job and is
not related to the change made here.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/814400

Change-Id: Ie5655bea08e21ce59f259832fd16cd713f90c916
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-repos refs/changes/75/813975/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove the "no service" option

Apparently, sealert doesn't allow this option to be used with other
options, and returns a wonderful:
"cannot run as noservice with other option"

Change-Id: I18d2a2efd21c2748a3e74907ba0654e51bf9fe82

commit_message:
Allow to disable GSSAPI authentication

If you don't need this authentication, setting the new
"tripleo_sshd_gssapii_authentication parameter to "no" will allow you to
actually disable this mecanism, leading to a faster ssh authentication.

Change-Id: Id0f2e66b04d7710aeb9c0faa903112f0cfd00877

commit_message:
Adding ncc-migration-ssh-auth-sharing spec

Partial-bug: #1468871
Change-Id: If1c8a8754b8fa6429e6b5c13c9d3c1a5d140236b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-specs refs/changes/97/806997/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Copyright 2021 Canonical Ltd. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: "None". For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ================================================================================ Sharing SSH authentication credentials across cloud-compute-related applications ================================================================================ Some cloud environments require different configuration settings (e.g. allocation ratios) for different hosts, yet still need to allow SSH-based migration between hosts. The proposed change in this spec would introduce a new config option to allow sharing of credentials across multiple applications related to the cloud-compute relation. Problem Description =================== At present, the nova-cloud-controller charm gathers SSH public keys for all cloud-compute-related applications. These SSH keys are then shared as needed, but only to peers within the same related application. While this is likely a sane default, especially considering that different applications may represent different classes of compute hosts which don't allow migration between them (e.g. SRIOV vs. non-SRIOV), there are cases where there is no fundamental reason to disallow migration. In cases like this, at present it's necessary to manually modify configuration files, perhaps setting them immutable, to provide the different configuration values needed for the different types of hosts, yet still allow them to perform migrations between each other. Thus, it is believed it would be beneficial to allow for specifying to nova-cloud-controller when it would be acceptable to share keys across applications. This specification is meant to address an implementation for the following feature request on Launchpad: https://bugs.launchpad.net/charms/+source/nova-cloud-controller/+bug/1468871 Proposed Change =============== Add a config option, migration-ssh-auth-sharing, for the purpose of specifying groups of related applications which should have SSH credentials shared across each other. The format of this parameter is a semicolon-separated list of groups, with each group being a comma-separated list of related applications. For example, a single group could be specified via e.g.:: nova-compute-a,nova-compute-b Multiple groups could be specified via e.g.:: nova-compute-a,nova-compute-b;nova-compute-sriov-a,nova-compute-sriov-b Groups are allowed to overlap. Keys from a given application will be shared with all the applications with which it shares one or more groups. Alternatively, if the operator knows it is acceptable to allow migrations across all applications related to the cloud-compute relation, they can specify the value "*" to enable this. Alternatives ------------ One alternative may be to write a subordinate charm simply for the purpose of sharing SSH keys and known hosts entries. While this could in theory be done, it is less than ideal because that effectively would create two sources of truth regarding which hosts should share credentials with which hosts, and it would effectively replicate a non-trivial amount of logic already handled by charm-nova-cloud-controller. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Paul Goins <paul.goins@canonical.com> Gerrit Topic ------------ Use Gerrit topic "migration-ssh-auth-sharing" for all patches related to this spec. .. code-block:: bash git-review -t migration-ssh-auth-sharing Work Items ---------- * Allow for sharing across specified groups of applications * Allow for sharing across all cloud-compute-related applications Repositories ------------ The changes would be isolated to the charm-nova-cloud-controller repository. Documentation ------------- At a minimum, config.yaml should be updated with appropriate documentation for the new parameter. The charm's README could also be updated with a section about this, although the description of the config option in config.yaml is expected to be sufficient. Security -------- This does inherently allow SSH access between compute nodes managed by multiple nova-compute applications, however the setting is strictly opt-in and clear regarding its scope. Testing ------- This functionality can be tested via unit tests. Functional tests may be overly cumbersome for this particular feature, although direct testing in a lab environment should also be done as a sanity check. Dependencies ============ N/A

commit_message:
Ubuntu systemd-networkd: VLAN ifname heuristics

Add a regular expression match to verify that VLAN
interfaces are named like VLAN interfaces, enabling
non-VLAN interfaces to exist on a network where the
VLAN ID is defined.

Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>
Story: 2009270
Task: 43511
Change-Id: If09c4840bbe51168a8b94be0db85e6610c21aa82
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/71/812271/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def net_is_vlan_interface(context, name, inventory_hostname=None): device = net_interface(context, name, inventory_hostname) if not device: raise errors.AnsibleFilterError( "Network interface for network '%s' on host '%s' not found" % (name, inventory_hostname)) # Use a heuristic to match conventional VLAN names, ending with a # period and a numerical extension to an interface name return re.match("[a-zA-Z0-9_\-]*.[1-9][0-9]*", device) @jinja2.contextfilterdef net_select_vlan_interfaces(context, names, inventory_hostname=None): return [name for name in names if net_is_vlan_interface(context, name, inventory_hostname)] @jinja2.contextfilter

commit_message:
Set proxy option in early dnf invocation

If hosts need to use a proxy to install packages and python is absent,
the call to install the python package will hang, at least on CentOS.

Set proxy if it exists in dnf_config using a command-line option. Later
uses of dnf will be after dnf.conf has been updated.

Change-Id: Ic949577afd3ea07306cebf224637a08a1ecce0f5
Story: 2009274
Task: 43528
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/46/802246/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Pin neutron-tempest-plugin to v1.6.0

Later versions of the neutron tempest plugin depend on a
more recent version of tempest than is used by the OSA
wallaby release and earlier stable releases. Later versions
of this plugin require the
'qos_limit_bandwidth_rules_client' component.

Change-Id: Ifba6836d824e7e6b956a81271d95d6dabe6c4163
(cherry picked from commit bd399b80e9de12452f1bee620bc60a69c142bf40)

subject: Fail when grub fails with current boot mode of BIOS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-09-17 14:39:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/4d178afefa3cea21bc8f403e467aa305a8ab9508', 'message': "Fail when grub fails with current boot mode of BIOS

A situation exists where you can tell ironic you want to deploy a UEFI
machine. Everything can look, be, and act like UEFI... except the
actual baremetal node. If it is in bios mode, and the image just doesn't
hae a bootloader binary header found, then we will eventually try to
install a bootlaoder. If that fails, that needs to fail as opposed to
be ignored.

We now fail when that is the case.

Change-Id: I10864417073dad59d5c4264450cd86079f15c42f
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2021-09-21 13:53:51.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/capture-bios-mode-failures-with-grub-7310fbaf65d0efc6.yaml', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/extensions/test_image.py', 'ironic_python_agent/extensions/image.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/e68630fe01a0c5fa855728ef0671dcd5b7fd0db5', 'message': "Fail when grub fails with current boot mode of BIOS

A situation exists where you can tell ironic you want to deploy a UEFI
machine. Everything can look, be, and act like UEFI... except the
actual baremetal node. If it is in bios mode, and the image just doesn't
hae a bootloader binary header found, then we will eventually try to
install a bootlaoder. If that fails, that needs to fail as opposed to
be ignored.

We now fail when that is the case.

Change-Id: I10864417073dad59d5c4264450cd86079f15c42f
"}]
commit_message:
Fail when grub fails with current boot mode of BIOS

A situation exists where you can tell ironic you want to deploy a UEFI
machine. Everything can look, be, and act like UEFI... except the
actual baremetal node. If it is in bios mode, and the image just doesn't
hae a bootloader binary header found, then we will eventually try to
install a bootlaoder. If that fails, that needs to fail as opposed to
be ignored.

We now fail when that is the case.

Change-Id: I10864417073dad59d5c4264450cd86079f15c42f

commit_message:
Implement namespace creation method

Since [1], Pyroute forks the namespace creation to avoid calling
destructive routine "libc.unshare(CLONE_NEWNET)" from the main
process. This implementation uses sockets between both processes
to return any error feedback sent from the child process.

This patch implements the same fork without any communication. If
the child process raises an exception other than "OSError(EEXIST)",
the child process returns 1 that is read by the the main process,
that raises a "RuntimeError" exception.

Related-Bug: #1917487

[1]https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/commit/81db2c98a1dda1c575ae087519cb08aa6ffdb39e

Conflicts:
    neutron/privileged/agent/linux/ip_lib.py

Change-Id: I0294586335a71d0757803843f675124bfb450967
(cherry picked from commit eb567478516897fadac1b7d205bef5c86284eace)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/88/801988/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pid = os.fork() if pid == 0: try: netns.create(name, libc=_get_cdll()) except OSError as e: if e.errno != errno.EEXIST: os._exit(1) except Exception: os._exit(1) os._exit(0) else: if os.waitpid(pid, 0)[1]: raise RuntimeError(_('Error creating namespace %s' % name))
deleted_lines: try: netns.create(name, libc=_get_cdll()) except OSError as e: if e.errno != errno.EEXIST: raise

commit_message:
Implement namespace creation method

Since [1], Pyroute forks the namespace creation to avoid calling
destructive routine "libc.unshare(CLONE_NEWNET)" from the main
process. This implementation uses sockets between both processes
to return any error feedback sent from the child process.

This patch implements the same fork without any communication. If
the child process raises an exception other than "OSError(EEXIST)",
the child process returns 1 that is read by the the main process,
that raises a "RuntimeError" exception.

Related-Bug: #1917487

commit_message:
Fix idrac-wsman set_power_state to wait on HW

set_power_state has returned to the caller immediately without
confirming the system has reached the requested state. This fixes that
by synchronously waiting until the target state has been read before
returning.

That bug can cause instance workload deployments to fail on Dell EMC
PowerEdge server models on which IPA ramdisk soft power off fails and
ironic employs its OOB fallback strategy. After an otherwise successful
deployment, the node is active, but is powered off. No error is reported
in last_error. If the subsequent instance workflow expects the system to
be powered on into the operating system, it fails.

Story: 2009204
Task: 43261
Change-Id: I3112a22149c07e5508f26c79f33d09aeb905c308
(cherry picked from commit 2a0fd1d13f178c9872330cf6498dc25572a721da)

When requested state is reboot, not used as not waiting then. node = task.node if calc_power_state == states.REBOOT: # TODO(rloo): Support timeouts! if timeout is not None: LOG.warning("The 'idrac-wsman' Power Interface does not " "support 'timeout' parameter when setting " "power state to reboot. Ignoring " "timeout=%(timeout)s", {'timeout': timeout}) else: # Skipped for reboot as can't match reboot with on/off. # Reboot so far has been part of workflow that is not followed # by another power state change that could break the flow. cond_utils.node_wait_for_power_state( task, calc_power_state, timeout) :param timeout: Time to wait for the node to reach the requested state. When requested state is reboot, not used as not waiting then. _set_power_state(task, power_state, timeout) _set_power_state(task, states.REBOOT, timeout)
deleted_lines: def _set_power_state(node, power_state): :param node: an ironic node object. :param timeout: timeout (in seconds). Unsupported by this interface. # TODO(rloo): Support timeouts! if timeout is not None: LOG.warning( "The 'idrac' Power Interface's 'set_power_state' method " "doesn't support the 'timeout' parameter. Ignoring " "timeout=%(timeout)s", {'timeout': timeout}) _set_power_state(task.node, power_state) # TODO(rloo): Support timeouts! if timeout is not None: LOG.warning("The 'idrac' Power Interface's 'reboot' method " "doesn't support the 'timeout' parameter. Ignoring " "timeout=%(timeout)s", {'timeout': timeout}) _set_power_state(task.node, states.REBOOT)

commit_message:
Add support for Ironic inspection through DHCP-relay

This change updates documentation, examples and tests to support
Ironic inspection through DHCP-relay. The dnsmasq service should be
configured with more specific format set in the variable
``ironic_dnsmasq_dhcp_range``. See the dnsmasq manual page [1].

[1] https://thekelleys.org.uk/dnsmasq/docs/dnsmasq-man.html

Change-Id: I9488a72db588e31289907668f1997596a8ccdec6
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 37e4dba87920c86aa50e426ac7ae152b414b08ab)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/90/813890/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: In the same file, define a network interface as the default NIC for dnsmasq and a range of IP addresses that will be available for use by Ironic inspector. The optional netmask of the network should be provided in case when DHCP-relay is used. Finally, define a network to be used for the Ironic cleaning network: ironic_dnsmasq_dhcp_range: "192.168.5.100,192.168.5.110,255.255.255.0"
deleted_lines: In the same file, define a network interface as the default NIC for dnsmasq, a range of IP addresses that will be available for use by Ironic inspector, as well as a network to be used for the Ironic cleaning network: ironic_dnsmasq_dhcp_range: "192.168.5.100,192.168.5.110"

commit_message:
Add support for Ironic inspection through DHCP-relay

This change updates documentation, examples and tests to support
Ironic inspection through DHCP-relay. The dnsmasq service should be
configured with more specific format set in the variable
``ironic_dnsmasq_dhcp_range``. See the dnsmasq manual page [1].

[1] https://thekelleys.org.uk/dnsmasq/docs/dnsmasq-man.html

Change-Id: I9488a72db588e31289907668f1997596a8ccdec6
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 37e4dba87920c86aa50e426ac7ae152b414b08ab)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/91/813891/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

The optional netmask of the network should be provided in case when DHCP-relay is used. Finally, define a network to be used for the Ironic cleaning network: ironic_dnsmasq_dhcp_range: "192.168.5.100,192.168.5.110,255.255.255.0"

subject: [mariadb] Start new nodes serially
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-18 16:00:16.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/mariadb/handlers/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1947485-d059864252fb1813.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/8109217a736fd8ba0cfc7406c6d994e703d8a4fc', 'message': '[mariadb] Start new nodes serially

There seems to be a bug in Galera that causes
TASK [mariadb : Check MariaDB service WSREP sync status]
to fail.
One (in case of 3-node cluster) or more (possible with
more-than-3-node clusters) nodes may "lose the race" and get stuck
in the "initialized" state of WSREP.
This is entirely random as is the case with most race issues.
MariaDB service restart on that node will fix the situation but
it's unwieldy.
The above may happen because Kolla Ansible starts and waits for
all new nodes at once.
This did not bother the old galera (galera 3) which figured out
the ordering for itself and let each node join the cluster properly.
The proposed workaround is to start and wait for nodes serially.

Change-Id: I449d4c2073d4e3953e9f09725577d2e1c9d563c9
Closes-Bug: #1947485
(cherry picked from commit c94cc4a61a6c213da21b4f161ec43ce1d6f067e7)
'}]
commit_message:
[mariadb] Start new nodes serially

There seems to be a bug in Galera that causes
TASK [mariadb : Check MariaDB service WSREP sync status]
to fail.
One (in case of 3-node cluster) or more (possible with
more-than-3-node clusters) nodes may "lose the race" and get stuck
in the "initialized" state of WSREP.
This is entirely random as is the case with most race issues.
MariaDB service restart on that node will fix the situation but
it's unwieldy.
The above may happen because Kolla Ansible starts and waits for
all new nodes at once.
This did not bother the old galera (galera 3) which figured out
the ordering for itself and let each node join the cluster properly.
The proposed workaround is to start and wait for nodes serially.

Change-Id: I449d4c2073d4e3953e9f09725577d2e1c9d563c9
Closes-Bug: #1947485
(cherry picked from commit c94cc4a61a6c213da21b4f161ec43ce1d6f067e7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/50/814450/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes an issue with multinode MariaDB deployments which could fail the playbook execution on WSREP check due to the new behaviour of Galera 4. `LP#1947485 <https://launchpad.net/bugs/1947485>`__.

commit_message:
[mariadb] Start new nodes serially

There seems to be a bug in Galera that causes
TASK [mariadb : Check MariaDB service WSREP sync status]
to fail.
One (in case of 3-node cluster) or more (possible with
more-than-3-node clusters) nodes may "lose the race" and get stuck
in the "initialized" state of WSREP.
This is entirely random as is the case with most race issues.
MariaDB service restart on that node will fix the situation but
it's unwieldy.
The above may happen because Kolla Ansible starts and waits for
all new nodes at once.
This did not bother the old galera (galera 3) which figured out
the ordering for itself and let each node join the cluster properly.
The proposed workaround is to start and wait for nodes serially.

Change-Id: I449d4c2073d4e3953e9f09725577d2e1c9d563c9
Closes-Bug: #1947485
(cherry picked from commit c94cc4a61a6c213da21b4f161ec43ce1d6f067e7)

subject: Fix build.lock file so that charm builds
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-15 11:59:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-cinder-lvm/commit/2072fb9a75c47ecce22eb372b761f43a8ff3d2e7', 'message': 'Fix build.lock file so that charm builds

Due to https://github.com/juju/charm-tools/issues/606 the build.lock
contained the wrong branch info.  This fixes it to stable, and will
allow it to push.

Change-Id: I278fa07c38d58cb29bbe81e4ad6fdd0901600f0a
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2021-10-16 17:01:30.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'src/build.lock'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-cinder-lvm/commit/80275468c23a266e86e2c2a73b5eaea07b5ddb39', 'message': 'Fix build.lock file so that charm builds

Due to https://github.com/juju/charm-tools/issues/606 the build.lock
contained the wrong branch info.  This fixes it to stable, and will
allow it to push.

* Also add cffi pin for py35 for charm-tools build support.

commit_message:
Fix build.lock file so that charm builds

Due to https://github.com/juju/charm-tools/issues/606 the build.lock
contained the wrong branch info.  This fixes it to stable, and will
allow it to push.

* Also add cffi pin for py35 for charm-tools build support.

Change-Id: I278fa07c38d58cb29bbe81e4ad6fdd0901600f0a

commit_message:
Fix build.lock file so charm can build

Due to https://github.com/juju/charm-tools/issues/604 writing the
build.lock fails when the interface:ceph-mds file is in the build.
Update the build.lock with the commit as the branch.

Change-Id: I4ad693c87e2dbcdcec2eba316ababdd5449e5e67

commit_message:
Integration with Kolla and Kolla-Ansible

1. Add kolla and kolla-ansible integrated patch
2. Add README to introduce how we can build skyline image with kolla
and deploy skyline with kolla-ansible
3. Add kolla folder as irrelevant files into jobs

Change-Id: I0cc7e9ddd62fc3e20564bf8a0d98d5c7b8f8abac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/skyline-apiserver refs/changes/50/813550/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # kolla ansible 部署 ## 准备 + ens3(ubuntu)/eth0(centos):平台访问网络 + ens4(ubuntu)/eth1(centos):业务网络 + 8GB内存 100GB磁盘 + ubuntu 20.04 / centos8 ## 环境准备 ```shell sudo apt update ``` + ubuntu 20.04 ```shell sudo apt install python3-dev libffi-dev gcc libssl-dev sudo apt install python3-pip ``` + centos8 ```shell sudo dnf install python3-devel libffi-devel gcc openssl-devel python3-libselinux sudo dnf install python3-pip ``` ```shell sudo pip3 install -U pip sudo pip install -U 'ansible<3.0' ``` **注:ansible版本需>=2.10** ## 源码包准备 ```shell tar -xvf kolla.tar tar -xvf kolla-ansible.tar ``` ## 配置 ```shell sudo pip3 install ./kolla sudo pip3 install ./kolla-ansible sudo mkdir -p /etc/kolla sudo chown $USER:$USER /etc/kolla cp -r kolla-ansible/etc/kolla/* /etc/kolla cp kolla-ansible/ansible/inventory/* . kolla-genpwd ``` 创建并编辑 `/etc/ansible/ansible.cfg` 文件 ```bash [defaults] host_key_checking=False pipelining=True forks=100 ``` 编辑 `/etc/kolla/globals.yml` 文件，根据需要进行配置文件修改 ```bash network_interface: "ens3" neutron_external_interface: "ens4" kolla_internal_vip_address: "192.168.10.250" ``` ## 部署 ```shell kolla-ansible -i ./all-in-one bootstrap-servers kolla-ansible -i ./all-in-one prechecks kolla-ansible -i ./all-in-one deploy ``` ## skyline 镜像构建 编辑 `/etc/docker/daemon.json` 文件，删除以下配置项 ```shell bridge: "none" ``` 重启 docker 服务 ```shell sudo service docker restart ``` 构建本地仓库 registry ```shell docker run -d --name registry --restart=always -p 4000:5000 -v registry:/var/lib/registry registry:2 ``` 构建 skyline 镜像 ```shell kolla-build -b ubuntu -t source --push --tag master --cache --registry 127.0.0.1:4000 -n kolla skyline ``` ## skyline 部署 编辑 `/etc/kolla/globals.yml` 文件 ```bash enable_skyline: "yes" docker_registry: "127.0.0.1:4000" docker_namespace: "kolla" ``` kolla-ansible 进行 skyline 部署 ```shell kolla_base_distro: "ubuntu" kolla_install_type: "source" kolla-ansible -i ./all-in-one bootstrap-servers -t skyline kolla-ansible -i ./all-in-one prechecks -t skyline kolla-ansible -i ./all-in-one deploy -t skyline ```

commit_message:
Add missing font for PDF doc generation

openstack-tox-docs job started to fail with the following error:

! LaTeX Error: File `tgtermes.sty' not found.

This patch adds the required font package to bindep doc profile.

Change-Id: Ia57b4ce4aa996e61346eae0f4b6a6599f8555652
(cherry picked from commit d36954704d1e327686596024aeb4c21a370b4d45)

commit_message:
Remove CentOS 7 image resolv.conf workaround

This workaround is no longer needed for current CentOS 8 images as
resolv.conf file comes now empty.

Moreover, the workaround has been preventing seed host configure from
running successfully on Ubuntu hosts.

Change-Id: I30e34e3c58db3f3a93a07f3d6d53671286e4260e
(cherry picked from commit 914d61d83bbebe0097f6337d4741d512baa9e186)

commit_message:
Fix VLAN placement

The VLAN key needs to be nested under the subnet
dictionary. Otherwise they will fail the schema validation
during network deployment.

This changes moves them in all examples to the subnet
dictionaries in each file.

Closes-Bug: #1930316
Change-Id: I0a73443630faf25de870a7878a9568ac8319aee9
(cherry picked from commit f38d6cef061f09e79dbc6ec74ab437e3b9b6476b)

commit_message:
Remove redundant node_periodic tests

Drivers using the decorator don't need to test all its aspects, only
the code they provide (the function body and predicates).

commit_message:
Remove CentOS 7 image resolv.conf workaround

This workaround is no longer needed for current CentOS 8 images as
resolv.conf file comes now empty.

Moreover, the workaround has been preventing seed host configure from
running successfully on Ubuntu hosts.

Change-Id: I30e34e3c58db3f3a93a07f3d6d53671286e4260e
(cherry picked from commit 914d61d83bbebe0097f6337d4741d512baa9e186)

commit_message:
Added missing storage to deployment documentation

The swift-storage config in README requires additional block device.
The juju deploy command supplies block device now.

Change-Id: I97d59e6fd274050b2f83ccfa1b1d81e92242febe

commit_message:
Do not use any parts of image URL in temporary file names

We currently use the last component, which is:
a) a potential information exposure,
b) can hit file name length limits [1]

Use the master path file name instead, which is always a UUID.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2014630

Change-Id: I2aa1230468132c2b7a8585d691ec180947f89c1e
(cherry picked from commit 7d85694fdf85a269cb3023083bf567a0e7e4ec13)

added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes ``File name too long`` in the image caching code when a URL contains a long query string.

commit_message:
Do not use any parts of image URL in temporary file names

We currently use the last component, which is:
a) a potential information exposure,
b) can hit file name length limits [1]

Use the master path file name instead, which is always a UUID.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2014630

Change-Id: I2aa1230468132c2b7a8585d691ec180947f89c1e
(cherry picked from commit 7d85694fdf85a269cb3023083bf567a0e7e4ec13)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/76/814376/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes ``File name too long`` in the image caching code when a URL contains a long query string.

commit_message:
Enable new SELinux boolean for vTPM support

In order to get a working vTPM support in containers, we need to enable
a new SELinux boolean provided by openstack-selinux[1].

This patch affects only the deprecated
nova-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml template in order to do a clean
backport to stable/Wallaby and stable/Victoria.

[1] https://github.com/redhat-openstack/openstack-selinux/pull/80

Change-Id: I1d2368135f7b0a83dec2192c242c081e2f5127c1
Closes-Bug: #1902468
Resolves: rhbz#2007314
(cherry picked from commit f664302c3deb539c0f59fa5b1eff48449acf6b85)

commit_message:
Bump python-ironicclient to 4.9.0

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/814110 cuts an
intermediate release of python-ironicclient (4.9.0).

The UC needs to be updated with the latest version as it contains
new features and fixes that needs to be work with TripleO
master deployment on CentOS Stream 9.

Depends_On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/814110

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I597e31734cec76258540f4b4a02aa87dd275362e

commit_message:
Remove helm status from deployment scripts for common

With the move to helm v3, helm status requires a namespace to be specified, but doing so breaks helm v2 compatability. This change removes the usage of helm serve in openstack-helm-infra's deployment scripts.

Change-Id: I8e035d70dd652d5253f534ad6b28042347158ff4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/59/813859/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Use yaml.safe_load to load YAML files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-18 15:43:40.000000000', 'files': ['tools/render-ansible-tasks.py', 'tools/yaml-validate.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/3b986aba9b4429ae57e6fcb9a72f4cd6a7623a98', 'message': 'Use yaml.safe_load to load YAML files

Since PyYAML 5.1, yaml.load without specifying the Loader option is
deprecated and shows the following warning.

YAMLLoadWarning: calling yaml.load() without Loader=... is deprecated,
as the default Loader is unsafe.
Please read https://msg.pyyaml.org/load for full details.

This change replaces yaml.load by yaml.safe_load (which is effectively
same as adding Loader=yaml.SafeLoader) to get rid of that warning
message. Also, existing all usage of yaml.load with the Loader option

commit_message:
Use yaml.safe_load to load YAML files

Since PyYAML 5.1, yaml.load without specifying the Loader option is
deprecated and shows the following warning.

YAMLLoadWarning: calling yaml.load() without Loader=... is deprecated,
as the default Loader is unsafe.
Please read https://msg.pyyaml.org/load for full details.

This change replaces yaml.load by yaml.safe_load (which is effectively
same as adding Loader=yaml.SafeLoader) to get rid of that warning
message. Also, existing all usage of yaml.load with the Loader option
are also replaced so that we to make all implementation to load yaml
files consistent.

Closes-Bug: #1947373

Change-Id: Id44fa2354429b944fbc0809f63db558bb7de23f7
(cherry picked from commit 53040573abca10c9eefdad7688a56610c67ed645)
(cherry picked from commit 8a4351664dff20f3594bcdd8fc0999d35689779c)

commit_message:
Ease KeepAliveTimeout in line with keystoneauth1.session.Session

Apache2's default value for KeepAliveTimeout is 5 seconds, which is okay
for general web-page serving use cases. However, sessions and connection
pools created by keystoneauth1.session.Session can be terminated
unnecessarily during multiple API calls in a session due to the short
KeepAliveTimeout.

Let's ease KeepAliveTimeout to 75 seconds, which is fairly standard for
API services behind a reverse proxy since it's the default value of
nginx.

Closes-Bug: #1947010
Change-Id: Iff24f0f4b35fcc239abc14f37a76dcad8380d785
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-keystone refs/changes/21/813921/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: KeepAliveTimeout 75 MaxKeepAliveRequests 1000

commit_message:
Allow to pass arbitrary parameters to TCIB image config

This new parameter takes key=value format, and can be passed multiple
times.

Those key/values can then be used within the image description files in
order to make them support different releases, or just use the value in
case we have a specific version (python-version for instance).

This will be useful in order to support container builds on both CS8 and
CS9 releases without too many duplications or headaches.

Note that a "tcib_" prefix is enforced for the keys.

Closes-Bug: #1942510
Change-Id: I7fe4d59f1fb76ba59d065b56c5900f4d3cfcda2e
(cherry picked from commit fb6daacedd733fbaa801507a7acf14c699faf0c5)
(cherry picked from commit 351bc64f4cbd823bcfc33676b11af4d2eac831c3)

commit_message:
bnr fix the exportation of the ceph authentication

The file ceph authetication is not being generated due to an
undefined variable.

This patch inserts the tasks that saves the content of
the file in to the block, so the variables are defined.

Change-Id: Id0c841723da00096e379133429a685bffaf407d3

commit_message:
Fix gitignore pattern for vault related files

previous pattern ignored any file that started with 'vault_'.
While not affecting changes to the vault_key_manager.py file that was
already checked into the repository, this pattern effectively hides said
file from many modern search tools (like ack, ag or ripgrep)
that by default ignore files according to .gitignore patterns.

This patch changes this pattern to ignore 'vault_*' files and
directories only in the root of the repo.

Change-Id: Id2095d9a401154435c346916e10df777b70d28dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/castellan refs/changes/19/810119/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix Ganesha repository broken urls

Few URLs from some ganesha repositories were not corresponding
to actual valid URLs, where packages could be searched in
the repository.

These broken URLs have now been fixed.

Change-Id: If27b488cfec29731b74e7db774c4811b0e34c14e

subject: Remove execpost and align systemd timeouts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-13 11:40:23.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_container_manage/templates/systemd-service.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/fdfc59cd1d1024d132e6046f3ba4746fed23c8c2', 'message': "Remove execpost and align systemd timeouts

Align systemd timeouts to podman[1].
Remove stop command with ExecStopPost command, because it won't
help much to run same command twice if it's stuck.
Set default time for stop command to 50 if not defined otherwise.
In case it's stuck, systemd will nuke everything (TimeoutStopSec=60)
60 seconds = 50 seconds of trying to stop + 10 seconds for avoiding
the race.

[1] https://github.com/containers/podman/pull/8889
Change-Id: Ife90b6c45b7f4a3fd829b60f9aa785fc580a31b8
"}]
commit_message:
Remove execpost and align systemd timeouts

Align systemd timeouts to podman[1].
Remove stop command with ExecStopPost command, because it won't
help much to run same command twice if it's stuck.
Set default time for stop command to 50 if not defined otherwise.
In case it's stuck, systemd will nuke everything (TimeoutStopSec=60)
60 seconds = 50 seconds of trying to stop + 10 seconds for avoiding
the race.

[1] https://github.com/containers/podman/pull/8889
Change-Id: Ife90b6c45b7f4a3fd829b60f9aa785fc580a31b8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/00/813800/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ExecStop=/usr/bin/podman stop -t {{ lookup('dict', container_data_unit).value.stop_grace_period | default(50) | int }} {{ lookup('dict', container_data_unit).key }}TimeoutStopSec={{ 2*lookup('dict', container_data_unit).value.stop_grace_period | default(60) | int }}
deleted_lines: ExecStop=/usr/bin/podman stop -t {{ lookup('dict', container_data_unit).value.stop_grace_period | default(42) | int }} {{ lookup('dict', container_data_unit).key }} ExecStopPost=/usr/bin/podman stop -t {{ lookup('dict', container_data_unit).value.stop_grace_period | default(42) | int }} {{ lookup('dict', container_data_unit).key }}TimeoutStopSec={{ 2*lookup('dict', container_data_unit).value.stop_grace_period | default(42) | int }}

commit_message:
[ovn] Add logs for ovs to ovn migration

Log the results of the Ansible playbooks by default so that it is easier
to go through them later in case there's something unexpected. The log
is located in $HOME instead of /var/log/ to avoid the need of privileges.

Signed-off-by: Elvira García <egarciar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ida2fc11f28200030fff9ddf1e56fc442a2016bab
(cherry picked from commit 744e906f8710434a5cd98df96349833292690651)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/59/813759/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: log_path = $HOME/ovn_migration_ansible.log

subject: Wrap stopping podman -t with systemd timeouts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-08-31 13:54:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/5135957c56cafc30534866e2c3498dda25ca079f', 'message': 'Wrap stopping podman -t with systemd timeouts

Currently with KillMode=none, if podman -t hangs, the command repeats
leaving the process and its cgroup around.
But if a stop/start command hangs, we should not start another one.

Instead time it out properly via TimeoutStopSec set to the timeout
given to the managed podman action + 1 sec. Then if it expires, kill
its cgroup all the way (KillMode=control-group) before rerunning the
same operation. Also note that using KilMode process is not recommended
by systemd man pages.

Change-Id: Iefe861f91cefe2a9cf773cae98b2440566ae8b5e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2021-09-07 14:25:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/5e639e73efab9e68ad75add904719fdb63c67699', 'message': 'Wrap stopping podman -t with systemd timeouts

Currently with KillMode=none, if podman -t hangs, the command repeats
leaving the process and its cgroup around.
But if a stop/start command hangs, we should not start another one.

Instead time it out properly via TimeoutStopSec set to the 2x of
the timeout given to the managed podman action. Then if it expires,
kill its cgroup all the way (KillMode=control-group is a default)
before rerunning the same operation. Also note that using KilMode
process is not recommended by systemd man pages.

Increase the grace stop timeout defaults 10->42s to align it with:
https://github.com/containers/podman/pull/8889

Change-Id: Iefe861f91cefe2a9cf773cae98b2440566ae8b5e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2021-09-23 05:59:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/250fb740f172db55b7b9c40776271fa7a2779cdd', 'message': 'Wrap stopping podman -t with systemd timeouts

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2021-09-29 09:04:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/44742c2f7c09310b8dc7e881dae1608984013ffe', 'message': 'Wrap stopping podman -t with systemd timeouts

Currently with KillMode=none, if podman -t hangs, the command repeats
leaving the process and its cgroup around.
But if a stop/start command hangs, we should not start another one.

Instead time it out properly via TimeoutStopSec set to the 2x of
the timeout given to the managed podman action. Then if it expires,
kill its cgroup all the way (KillMode=control-group is a default)
before rerunning the same operation. Also note that using KilMode
process is not recommended by systemd man pages.

Increase the grace stop timeout defaults 10->42s to align it with:
https://github.com/containers/podman/pull/8889

Avoid restarting of already running containers to reduce upgrade/update
impact. Since changing service units causes a global restart of
containers and could affect data plane, let only do that for new
deployments.

NOTE: this change should not be backported because of the described
upgrade aftereffects.

'}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2021-09-30 08:52:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/9f7e8716b6bac662163cc0bd9448fe74c851fb06', 'message': 'Wrap stopping podman -t with systemd timeouts

Currently with KillMode=none, if podman -t hangs, the command repeats
leaving the process and its cgroup around.
But if a stop/start command hangs, we should not start another one.

Instead time it out properly via TimeoutStopSec set to the 2x of
the timeout given to the managed podman action. Then if it expires,
kill its cgroup all the way (KillMode=control-group is a default)
before rerunning the same operation. Also note that using KilMode
process is not recommended by systemd man pages.

Increase the grace stop timeout defaults 10->42s to align it with:
https://github.com/containers/podman/pull/8889

Avoid upgrade impact to already running containers (changing service
units causes a recreation of containers and could affect data plane).

Anchor file /etc/sysconfig/podman_systemd_anchor controlls allowance
of disruptive (global) changes in systemd service units generated with
tripleo_container_manage. When file is there, systemd units may be
changed all together, which causes recreation of the managed
containers. If file is absent, no such changes would be let into the
service units.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/811892
Change-Id: Iefe861f91cefe2a9cf773cae98b2440566ae8b5e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Increase the grace stop timeout defaults 10->42s to align it with:
https://github.com/containers/podman/pull/8889

Avoid upgrade impact to already running containers (changing service
units causes a recreation of containers and could affect data plane).

Anchor file /etc/sysconfig/podman_systemd_anchor controlls allowance
of disruptive (global) changes in systemd service units generated with
tripleo_container_manage. When file is there, systemd units may be
changed all together, which causes recreation of the managed
containers. If file is absent, no such changes would be let into the

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/811892
Change-Id: Iefe861f91cefe2a9cf773cae98b2440566ae8b5e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2021-10-01 13:36:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/23a05fb4787660dfd6d61a9701725d97b7ccc5be', 'message': 'Wrap stopping podman -t with systemd timeouts

Currently with KillMode=none, if podman -t hangs, the command repeats
leaving the process and its cgroup around.
But if a stop/start command hangs, we should not start another one.

Instead time it out properly via TimeoutStopSec set to the 2x of
the timeout given to the managed podman action. Then if it expires,
kill its cgroup all the way (KillMode=control-group is a default)
before rerunning the same operation. Also note that using KilMode
process is not recommended by systemd man pages.

Increase the grace stop timeout defaults 10->42s to align it with:
https://github.com/containers/podman/pull/8889

NOTE: the dependency fix provides anchor file
/etc/sysconfig/podman_systemd_anchor that controlls allowance
of rolling out disruptive (global) changes.

Use this facility to avoid upgrade impact to already running
containers (changing service units causes a recreation of containers
and could affect data plane).

Closes-bug: #1945791

commit_message:
Wrap stopping podman -t with systemd timeouts

Currently with KillMode=none, if podman -t hangs, the command repeats
leaving the process and its cgroup around.
But if a stop/start command hangs, we should not start another one.

Instead time it out properly via TimeoutStopSec set to the 2x of
the timeout given to the managed podman action. Then if it expires,
kill its cgroup all the way (KillMode=control-group is a default)
before rerunning the same operation. Also note that using KilMode
process is not recommended by systemd man pages.

Increase the grace stop timeout defaults 10->42s to align it with:
https://github.com/containers/podman/pull/8889

Closes-bug: #1945791
Change-Id: Iefe861f91cefe2a9cf773cae98b2440566ae8b5e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/53/806753/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: KillMode=control-group TimeoutStopSec={{ 1+lookup('dict', container_data_unit).value.stop_grace_period | default(10) | int }}

commit_message:
[ovn] Add logs for ovs to ovn migration

Log the results of the Ansible playbooks by default so that it is easier
to go through them later in case there's something unexpected. The log
is located in $HOME instead of /var/log/ to avoid the need of privileges.

Signed-off-by: Elvira García <egarciar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ida2fc11f28200030fff9ddf1e56fc442a2016bab
(cherry picked from commit 744e906f8710434a5cd98df96349833292690651)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/60/813760/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: log_path = $HOME/ovn_migration_ansible.log

commit_message:
Fix community image handling in launch instance form

Community images which are not owned by a focused project are not
included in the normal image list API (i.e., without specifying
"community" as visibility), so we need an extra call of the image
list API specifying "community" visibility in a filter.

It was originally fixed by [1] but was dropped in [2].
The main motivation of [2] is to address "Duplicates in a repeater
are not allowed" error in the JavaScript console.

The approach of [2] was to drop multiple glance API calls, but
the right solution would be to check duplicated images included
in both API calls. This situation with duplicated images happens
when a community image is owned by a focused project. In such case,
the community image is included in the responses of both API calls.

This commit adds a logic to check image IDs already processed.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/614688
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/640762

Closes-Bug: #1914045
Related-Bug: #1779250
Related-Bug: #1818508

Change-Id: I2ed1b6064ddd6f62818d6112e98e5d5a98beae9d
(cherry picked from commit c9bb0e95eaa7ae4f0cce21bc0a246a9b0cd2f880)

subject: Do not use any parts of image URL in temporary file names
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-15 16:59:35.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/image_cache.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_image_cache.py', 'releasenotes/notes/image-cache-size-28a9072901b98edf.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/7d85694fdf85a269cb3023083bf567a0e7e4ec13', 'message': 'Do not use any parts of image URL in temporary file names

We currently use the last component, which is:
a) a potential information exposure,
b) can hit file name length limits [1]

Use the master path file name instead, which is always a UUID.

Change-Id: I2aa1230468132c2b7a8585d691ec180947f89c1e
'}]
commit_message:
Do not use any parts of image URL in temporary file names

We currently use the last component, which is:
a) a potential information exposure,
b) can hit file name length limits [1]

Use the master path file name instead, which is always a UUID.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2014630

Change-Id: I2aa1230468132c2b7a8585d691ec180947f89c1e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/01/814201/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add missing dependency about nova_api_paste_ini

This change fixes missing dependency about nova_api_paste_ini, which
should have been added when the nova_paste_api_ini resource type was
renamed to the nova_api_paste_ini resource type[1].

[1] b5c5d7acc3cc2cf2836a4f4556543d3fe1737b95

Change-Id: I6bf4da9360f78ee94dbf02e7a6f7b109cf50b154

[ovn] Add logs for ovs to ovn migration

Log the results of the Ansible playbooks by default so that it is easier
to go through them later in case there's something unexpected. The log
is located in $HOME instead of /var/log/ to avoid the need of privileges.

Signed-off-by: Elvira García <egarciar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ida2fc11f28200030fff9ddf1e56fc442a2016bab
(cherry picked from commit 744e906f8710434a5cd98df96349833292690651)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/58/813758/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: log_path = $HOME/ovn_migration_ansible.log

commit_message:
Fix the wrong exception used to retry detach API calls

When cinderclient receives an error response from API, it raises one
of the exceptions from the cinderclient.exceptions module instead of
the cinderclient.apiclient.exceptions module.

This change fixes the wrong exception used to detect 500 error from
cinder API, so that API calls to detach volumes are properly retried.

Closes-Bug: #1944043
Change-Id: I741cb6b29a67da8c60708c6251c441d778ca74d0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/34/809934/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: (isinstance(e, cinder_exception.ClientException) and e.code == 500)) (isinstance(e, cinder_exception.ClientException) and e.code == 500)) (isinstance(e, cinder_exception.ClientException) and e.code == 500))
deleted_lines: from cinderclient import apiclient as cinder_apiclient type(e) == cinder_apiclient.exceptions.InternalServerError) type(e) == cinder_apiclient.exceptions.InternalServerError) type(e) == cinder_apiclient.exceptions.InternalServerError)

[ovn] Add logs for ovs to ovn migration

Log the results of the Ansible playbooks by default so that it is easier
to go through them later in case there's something unexpected. The log
is located in $HOME instead of /var/log/ to avoid the need of privileges.

commit_message:
Try to use 'release' for container image build - fallback to branch

In [1] the container build template was updated to use 'release'
rather than 'branch' var. However this is not defined for the
build-containers-ubi-8 job resulting in related-bug. Instead we
can try to use 'release' and fall back to 'branch' if release
is not defined.

Change-Id: Ifee7bf97ef30056ffac0ac381e4ea36f5c491a2c
Related-Bug: 1947572
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/00/814400/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if release|default(branch) not in ["train", "ussuri", "victoria", "wallaby"] %}

subject: db: Add migration to resolve shadow table discrepancies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-08-23 23:15:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4741a4ff8805e94a9aaed97f645877a00f17d6a9', 'message': 'db: Add migration to resolve shadow table discrepancies

As part of the migration to alembic, a number of mistakes were noted in
the migrations. These were all a result of doing things differently for
the shadow table compared to the main table. Resolve some of these in a
new migration to both address the bugs and test out the alembic
machinery.

Note that we don't actually resolve all of the mismatches. A large
number of these mismatches were caused by the addition of
'nullable=False' to a column in a main table but not the equivalent
shadow table. With the benefit of hindsight, this is probably wise and
possibly even intended. If we were to apply the new constraint to the
shadow table also, we'd need a data migration to populate any remaining
NULL fields in the shadow tables. This data migration could be very
costly and may not even possible as we don't necessarily have all
available context required to do this population. As a result, the
wording around these differences is changed to indicate that we will
likely never address these "bugs".

A number of mistakes in the tests are corrected. In addition, an empty
test module, 'nova.tests.functional.db.api', is removed. This should
have been deleted in change Ie9d00e25b7e99104155466060a2b6f8a884a5e0a
("db: Normalize migrations tests") when we moved all the tests from this
module to the 'nova.tests.unit.db.api' module.

Change-Id: Icdc683d534a4fd35af399561253888abb9193c7d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2021-08-24 17:23:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c31fc03acf76a16c42ebf97c704480d5c2e09d9d', 'message': 'db: Add migration to resolve shadow table discrepancies

As part of the migration to alembic, a number of mistakes were noted in
the migrations. These were all a result of doing things differently for
the shadow table compared to the main table. Resolve some of these in a
new migration to both address the bugs and test out the alembic
machinery.

Note that we don't actually resolve all of the mismatches. A large
number of these mismatches were caused by the addition of
'nullable=False' to a column in a main table but not the equivalent
shadow table. With the benefit of hindsight, this is probably wise and
possibly even intended. If we were to apply the new constraint to the
shadow table also, we'd need a data migration to populate any remaining
NULL fields in the shadow tables. This data migration could be very
costly and may not even possible as we don't necessarily have all
available context required to do this population. As a result, the
wording around these differences is changed to indicate that we will
likely never address these "bugs".

A number of mistakes in the tests are corrected. In addition, an empty
test module, 'nova.tests.functional.db.api', is removed. This should
have been deleted in change Ie9d00e25b7e99104155466060a2b6f8a884a5e0a
("db: Normalize migrations tests") when we moved all the tests from this
module to the 'nova.tests.unit.db.api' module.

Change-Id: Icdc683d534a4fd35af399561253888abb9193c7d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
db: Add migration to resolve shadow table discrepancies

As part of the migration to alembic, a number of mistakes were noted in
the migrations. These were all a result of doing things differently for
the shadow table compared to the main table. Resolve some of these in a
new migration to both address the bugs and test out the alembic
machinery.

Note that we don't actually resolve all of the mismatches. A large
number of these mismatches were caused by the addition of
'nullable=False' to a column in a main table but not the equivalent
shadow table. With the benefit of hindsight, this is probably wise and
possibly even intended. If we were to apply the new constraint to the
shadow table also, we'd need a data migration to populate any remaining
NULL fields in the shadow tables. This data migration could be very
costly and may not even possible as we don't necessarily have all
available context required to do this population. As a result, the
wording around these differences is changed to indicate that we will
likely never address these "bugs".

Change-Id: Icdc683d534a4fd35af399561253888abb9193c7d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove helm status from deployment scripts for apparmor

With the move to helm v3, helm status requires a namespace to be specified, but doing so breaks helm v2 compatability. This change removes the usage of helm serve in openstack-helm-infra's deployment scripts.

Change-Id: Idd97b6c8d2531c8cd55629a3ce91b2581af904f4

commit_message:
[ceph-mon] Skip monmap endpoint check for missing mons

This change adds a condition to ensure that an IP address was
obtained for a ceph-mon kubernetes endpoint before building the
expected endpoint string and checking it against the monmap. If an
IP address isn't available, the check is skipped for that mon.

Change-Id: I45a2e2987b5ef0c27b0bb765f7967fcce1af62e4

commit_message:
[ovn] Add logs for ovs to ovn migration

Log the results of the Ansible playbooks by default so that it is easier
to go through them later in case there's something unexpected. The log
is located in $HOME instead of /var/log/ to avoid the need of privileges.

Signed-off-by: Elvira García <egarciar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ida2fc11f28200030fff9ddf1e56fc442a2016bab
(manually cherry picked from commit 744e906f8710434a5cd98df96349833292690651)

commit_message:
Rely on proxy for compute.flavor cloud layer operations

- stop applying normalization to flavor operations in the cloud layer
- return bare flavor resources
- drop logic for fetching extra_specs in cloud layer (already present in
  proxy)
- use conn.compute.extensions to get extensions
- drop flavor.links attribute as being absoutely useless on the resource

Change-Id: Id6fc34fd1aa7dec37a4886eeef9206cda685f4bb

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing from stable branches

This topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to test
lower constraints [1]. As decided in horizon weekly meeting in
the past[2], stable branches will drop the lower-constraints job from CI.

[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html
[2]https://meetings.opendev.org/irclogs/%23openstack-meeting-alt/%23openstack-meeting-alt.2021-03-24.log.html#t2021-03-24T15:12:58

Change-Id: I3f4367817cdf04eacacba8b2ba2bbc06b09d3132
(cherry picked from commit 38ccf26b174c071f2ada5e65aa210634668786a3)
(cherry picked from commit e96945376c1cdc69ab28e7820e3bcaf2a45fee71)

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing from stable branches

This topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to test
lower constraints [1]. As decided in horizon weekly meeting in
the past[2], stable branches will drop the lower-constraints job from CI.

[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html
[2]https://meetings.opendev.org/irclogs/%23openstack-meeting-alt/%23openstack-meeting-alt.2021-03-24.log.html#t2021-03-24T15:12:58

Change-Id: I3f4367817cdf04eacacba8b2ba2bbc06b09d3132

commit_message:
Implement API protection testing for metadef objects

This commit adds some basic protection tests so that we can start
testing the secure RBAC changes proposed to glance.

Depends-On: If2001ef652e21f54048db0fc67893337681a2b6f
Change-Id: I4125fe0bfd8c039dbd4f60099b85e0766056135b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-tempest-plugin refs/changes/93/802793/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import abc from tempest import config from tempest.lib.common.utils import data_utils from tempest.lib import decorators from tempest.lib import exceptions from glance_tempest_plugin.tests.rbac.v2 import base as rbac_base CONF = config.CONF class MetadefV2RbacObjectsTest(rbac_base.ImageV2RbacBaseTests, metaclass=abc.ABCMeta): @classmethod def setup_clients(cls): super().setup_clients() cls.persona = getattr(cls, f'os_{cls.credentials[0]}') cls.client = cls.persona.namespace_objects_client @classmethod def setup_credentials(cls): super().setup_credentials() cls.os_primary = getattr(cls, f'os_{cls.credentials[0]}') @abc.abstractmethod def test_create_object(self): """Test add_metadef_object policy.""" pass @abc.abstractmethod def test_get_object(self): """Test get_metadef_object policy.""" pass @abc.abstractmethod def test_list_objects(self): """Test list_metadef_objects policy.""" pass @abc.abstractmethod def test_update_object(self): """Test update_metadef_object policy.""" pass @abc.abstractmethod def test_delete_object(self): """Test delete_metadef_object policy.""" pass class SystemAdminTests(MetadefV2RbacObjectsTest, rbac_base.BaseV2MetadefTest): credentials = ['system_admin', 'project_admin'] @decorators.skip_because(bug='968696') def test_get_object(self): pass @decorators.skip_because(bug='968696') def test_list_objects(self): pass @decorators.skip_because(bug='968696') def test_update_object(self): pass @decorators.skip_because(bug='968696') def test_create_object(self): pass @decorators.skip_because(bug='968696') def test_delete_object(self): pass class SystemMemberTests(SystemAdminTests, rbac_base.BaseV2MetadefTest): credentials = ['system_member', 'project_admin', 'system_admin'] class SystemReaderTests(SystemMemberTests, rbac_base.BaseV2MetadefTest): credentials = ['system_reader', 'project_admin', 'system_admin'] class ProjectAdminTests(MetadefV2RbacObjectsTest, rbac_base.BaseV2MetadefTest): credentials = ['project_admin', 'system_admin'] def _create_objects(self, namespaces, client=None): objects = [] for namespace in namespaces: object_name = "object_of_%s" % (namespace['namespace']) self.do_request('create_namespace_object', expected_status=201, client=client, namespace=namespace['namespace'], name=object_name) objects_with_ns = {} objects_with_ns['namespace'] = namespace objects_with_ns['object'] = object_name objects.append(objects_with_ns) self.addCleanup(self._cleanup_namespace, namespace) return objects def test_create_object(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create metadef object for above created namespaces by admin _ = self._create_objects(ns_A, client=self.namespace_objects_client) _ = self._create_objects( ns_B, client=project_client.namespace_objects_client) def test_get_object(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create metadef objects for above created namespaces objects_A = self._create_objects( ns_A, client=self.namespace_objects_client) objects_B = self._create_objects( ns_B, client=project_client.namespace_objects_client) # Get all metadef objects with admin role objects = objects_A + objects_B for obj in objects: self.do_request('show_namespace_object', expected_status=200, namespace=obj['namespace']['namespace'], object_name=obj['object']) def test_list_objects(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create metadef objects for above created namespaces objects_A = self._create_objects( ns_A, client=self.namespace_objects_client) objects_B = self._create_objects( ns_B, client=project_client.namespace_objects_client) # List all the objects by project A with admin role namespaces = ns_A + ns_B objects_list = [] objects = objects_A + objects_B for namespace in namespaces: resp = self.do_request('list_namespace_objects', expected_status=200, namespace=namespace['namespace']) objects_list.append(resp['objects'][0]['name']) for obj in objects: self.assertIn(obj['object'], objects_list) def test_update_object(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create metadef objects for above created namespaces objects_A = self._create_objects( ns_A, client=self.namespace_objects_client) objects_B = self._create_objects( ns_B, client=project_client.namespace_objects_client) # Update by project A with admin role objects = objects_A + objects_B for obj in objects: self.do_request('update_namespace_object', expected_status=200, namespace=obj['namespace']['namespace'], object_name=obj['object'], name=data_utils.arbitrary_string()) def test_delete_object(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create metadef objects for above created namespaces objects_A = self._create_objects( ns_A, client=self.namespace_objects_client) objects_B = self._create_objects( ns_B, client=project_client.namespace_objects_client) # Get all metadef objects with admin role objects = objects_A + objects_B for obj in objects: self.do_request('delete_namespace_object', expected_status=204, namespace=obj['namespace']['namespace'], object_name=obj['object']) class ProjectMemberTests(ProjectAdminTests, rbac_base.BaseV2MetadefTest): credentials = ['project_member', 'project_admin', 'system_admin'] def test_create_objects(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create metadef objects is not allowed for non admin role namespaces = ns_A + ns_B for namespace in namespaces: object_name = "object_of_%s" % (namespace['namespace']) self.do_request('create_namespace_object', expected_status=exceptions.Forbidden, namespace=namespace['namespace'], name=object_name) self.addCleanup(self._cleanup_namespace, namespace) def test_get_object(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create metadef objects for above created namespaces objects_A = self._create_objects( ns_A, client=self.namespace_objects_client) objects_B = self._create_objects( ns_B, client=project_client.namespace_objects_client) # Get all metadef objects by Project C with non admin role objects = objects_A + objects_B for obj in objects: if obj['namespace']['visibility'] == 'public': self.do_request('show_namespace_object', expected_status=200, namespace=obj['namespace']['namespace'], object_name=obj['object']) else: self.do_request('show_namespace_object', expected_status=exceptions.Forbidden, namespace=obj['namespace']['namespace'], object_name=obj['object']) project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') def test_list_objects(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create metadef objects for above created namespaces objects_A = self._create_objects( ns_A, client=self.namespace_objects_client) objects_B = self._create_objects( ns_B, client=project_client.namespace_objects_client) # List all the metadef objects by Project C with non admin role namespaces = ns_A + ns_B objects_list = [] objects = objects_A + objects_B for namespace in namespaces: if namespace['visibility'] == 'public': resp = self.do_request('list_namespace_objects', expected_status=200, namespace=namespace['namespace']) objects_list.append(resp['objects'][0]['name']) else: self.do_request('list_namespace_objects', expected_status=exceptions.Forbidden, namespace=namespace['namespace']) for obj in objects: if obj['namespace']['visibility'] == 'public': self.assertIn(obj['object'], objects_list) else: self.assertNotIn(obj['object'], objects_list) def test_update_object(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create metadef objects for above created namespaces objects_A = self._create_objects( ns_A, client=self.namespace_objects_client) objects_B = self._create_objects( ns_B, client=project_client.namespace_objects_client) # Update metadef objects by non admin role is not allowed objects = objects_A + objects_B for obj in objects: self.do_request('update_namespace_object', expected_status=exceptions.Forbidden, name=data_utils.arbitrary_string(), namespace=obj['namespace']['namespace'], object_name=obj['object']) def test_delete_object(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create metadef objects for above created namespaces objects_A = self._create_objects( ns_A, client=self.namespace_objects_client) objects_B = self._create_objects( ns_B, client=project_client.namespace_objects_client) # Delete metadef object is not allowed by non admin role objects = objects_A + objects_B for obj in objects: self.do_request('delete_namespace_object', expected_status=exceptions.Forbidden, namespace=obj['namespace']['namespace'], object_name=obj['object']) class ProjectReaderTests(ProjectMemberTests, rbac_base.BaseV2MetadefTest): credentials = ['project_reader', 'project_admin', 'system_admin']

Pin various python libs and fix branch in build.lock

The python lib pins are for py35 compatability.  The branch issue is due
to bug https://github.com/juju/charm-tools/issues/604

* Also add cffi pin for py35 for charm-tools build support.

commit_message:
Support for ports and primarySubnet fields in machine.

For now, by default, pod network was taken from OpenShift Machine spec,
by looking for "networks" field and get the first item out of it to
figure out right subnet. Currently there is another field, where
networks can be defined - under "ports" field, where subnet for fixed
IPs can be found. Additionally, to avoid confusion, there is another
field, which defines primary subnet for the pods - "primarySubnet".

Implementation has been adapted to reflect that change:

1. primarySubnet will be examined, to get the subnet id
2. if primarySubnet does not exists, networks field will be examined
3. if there is no networks field (or it doesn't contain subnets), ports
   field will be examined for subnet id

Change-Id: I35b6f2e6288cbe3fd80b74a5da03639d7bd0a765

commit_message:
Delete log entries when SG or port is deleted

NOTE: this patch is an ammend of [1].

When a SG or a port is deleted, the related log entry should be
too. A log entry has the following fields:
- log.resource_id = SG ID
- log.target_id = port ID

[1] was deleting all log entries, related or not with the SG ID
deleted. This is because "get_logs_bound_sg" returned all log entries,
including those ones without any "resource_id" or "target_id".

Now this method can return only the log entries related to a port or
a SG, excluding those ones without those two parameters populated.

Closes-Bug: #1939558

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/804237

Change-Id: Icb92327a06486e168ce064532d819347e6031cc1

to fail.
One (in case of 3-node cluster) or more (possible with
more-than-3-node clusters) nodes may "lose the race" and get stuck
in the "initialized" state of WSREP.
This is entirely random as is the case with most race issues.
MariaDB service restart on that node will fix the situation but
it's unwieldy.

all new nodes at once.

the ordering for itself and let each node join the cluster properly.

commit_message:
[mariadb] Start new nodes serially

There seems to be a bug in Galera that causes
TASK [mariadb : Check MariaDB service WSREP sync status]
to fail.
One (in case of 3-node cluster) or more (possible with
more-than-3-node clusters) nodes may "lose the race" and get stuck
in the "initialized" state of WSREP.
This is entirely random as is the case with most race issues.
MariaDB service restart on that node will fix the situation but
it's unwieldy.
The above may happen because Kolla Ansible starts and waits for
all new nodes at once.
This did not bother the old galera (galera 3) which figured out
the ordering for itself and let each node join the cluster properly.
The proposed workaround is to start and wait for nodes serially.

Change-Id: I449d4c2073d4e3953e9f09725577d2e1c9d563c9
Closes-Bug: #1947485
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/87/814187/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
